name: VENDOR_ID_AND_DEVICE_ID
description:
Vendor ID and Device ID
Device ID assigned by the
manufacturer of the device. On
power-up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be
rewritten independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: VID
bit_ranges.description:
Vendor ID [VID]
This is the Vendor ID assigned by
PCI SIG to the manufacturer of the
device. The Vendor ID is set in the
Vendor ID Register within the local
management  register block.

bit_ranges.name: DID
bit_ranges.description:
Device ID [DID]
Device ID assigned by the
manufacturer of the device. On
power-up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be
rewritten independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

name: COMMAND_AND_STATUS
description:
Command and Status Register
This bit is set when the core has
received a poisoned TLP. The Parity
Error Response enable bit (bit 6) has
no effect on the setting of this bit.
This field can also be cleared from
the local management bus by writing
a 1 into this bit position.

bit_ranges.name: ISE
bit_ranges.description:
IO-Space Enable [ISE]
Enables IO accesses through the
core for this PCI Function. This field
can be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: MSE
bit_ranges.description:
Mem-Space Enable [MSE]
Enables memory accesses through
the core for this PCI Function. This
field can be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: BE
bit_ranges.description:
Bus-Master Enable [BE]
Enables the device to issue memory
and I/O requests from this Function.
This field can be written from the
local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PERE
bit_ranges.description:
Parity Error Response Enable [PERE]
When this bit is 1, the core sets the
Master Data Parity Error status bit
when it detects the following error
conditions: (i) The core receives a
poisoned completion from the link in
response to a request. (ii) The core
sends out a poisoned write request
on the link (this may be because an
underflow occurred during the
packet  transfer
at the host interface of the core.).
When this bit   is 0, the Master Data
Parity Error status bit is never set.
This field can be written from the
local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SE
bit_ranges.description:
SERR Enable [SE]
Enables the reporting of fatal and
non-fatal errors detected by the core
to the Root Complex. This field can
be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IMD
bit_ranges.description:
INTx Message Disabled [IMD]
Enables or disables the transmission
of INTx   Assert and De-assert
messages from the core. Setting this
bit to 1 disables generation of INTx
assert/de-assert messages in the
core. This field can be written from
the local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IS
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Status [IS]
This bit is valid only when the core is
configured to support legacy
interrupts. Indicates that the core
has a pending interrupt, that is, the
core has sent an Assert_INTx
message but has not transmitted a
corresponding  Deassert_INTx
message.

bit_ranges.name: CL
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities List [CL]
Indicates the presence of PCI
Extended Capabilities registers. This
bit is hardwired to 1.

bit_ranges.name: R5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R5]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MDPE
bit_ranges.description:
Master Data Parity Error [MDPE]
When the Parity Error Response
enable bit is 1, the core sets this bit
when it detects the following error
conditions: (i) The core receives a
poisoned completion from the link in
response to a request. (ii) The core
sends out a poisoned write request
on the link (this may be because an
underflow occurred during the
packet transfer at the host interface
of the core.). This bit remains 0
when the Parity Error Response
enable bit is 0. This field can also be
cleared from the local management
bus by writing a 1 into this bit
position.

bit_ranges.name: R6
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R6]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: STA
bit_ranges.description:
Signaled Target Abort [STA]
This bit is set when the core has
sent a completion to the link with
the Completer Abort status. This
field can also be cleared from the
local management bus by writing a 1
into this bit position.

bit_ranges.name: RTA
bit_ranges.description:
Received Target Abort [RTA]
This bit is set when the core has
received a completion from the link
with the Completer Abort status.
This field can also be cleared from
the local management bus by writing
a 1 into this bit position

bit_ranges.name: RMA
bit_ranges.description:
Received Master Abort [RMA]
This bit is set when the core has
received a completion from the link
with the Unsupported Request
status. This field can also be cleared
from the local management bus by
writing a 1 into this bit position

bit_ranges.name: SSE
bit_ranges.description:
Signaled System Error [SSE]
If the SERR enable bit is 1, this bit is
set when the core has sent out a
fatal or non-fatal error message on
the link to the Root Complex. If the
SERR enable bit is 0, this bit remains
0. This field can also be cleared from
the local management bus by writing
a 1 into this bit position.

bit_ranges.name: DPE
bit_ranges.description:
Detected Parity Error [DPE]
This bit is set when the core has
received a poisoned TLP. The Parity
Error Response enable bit (bit 6) has
no effect on the setting of this bit.
This field can also be cleared from
the local management bus by writing
a 1 into this bit position.

name: REVISION_ID_AND_CLASS_CODE
description:
Revision ID and Class Code Register
Identifies the function of the device.
On power-  up, the core sets it to
the value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be
rewritten independently for each
Function from the local management
bus

bit_ranges.name: RID
bit_ranges.description:
Revision ID [RID]
Assigned by the manufacturer of the
device to identify the revision
number of the device. On power-up,
the core sets it to the value defined
in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This
field can be re- written
independently for each Function
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: PIB
bit_ranges.description:
Programming Interface Byte [PIB]
Identifies the register set layout of
the device. On power-up, the core
sets it to the value defined in the
RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field
can be re- written independently for
each Function from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: SCC
bit_ranges.description:
Sub-Class Code [SCC]
Identifies a sub-category within the
selected function. On power-up, the
core sets it to the value defined in
the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field
can be re-written independently for
each Function from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: CC
bit_ranges.description:
Class Code [CC]
Identifies the function of the device.
On power-  up, the core sets it to
the value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be
rewritten independently for each
Function from the local management
bus

name: BIST,_HEADER_TYPE,_LATENCY_TIMER_AND_CACHE_LINE_SIZE_S
description:
BIST, Header Type, Latency Timer and Cache Line Size Registers
BIST control register.It can be
accessed using local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: CLS
bit_ranges.description:
Cache Line Size [CLS]
Cache Line Size Register defined in
PCI Specifications 3.0. This field can
be read or written, both from the
link and from the local management
bus, but its value is not  used.

bit_ranges.name: LT
bit_ranges.description:
Latency Timer [LT]
This is an unused field and is
hardwired to  0.

bit_ranges.name: HT
bit_ranges.description:
Header Type [HT]
Identifies format of header. This field
is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: DT
bit_ranges.description:
Device Type [DT]
Identifies whether the device
supports a single Function or
multiple Functions. This bit is read as
0 when only Function 0 has been
enabled in the Physical Function
Configuration Register (in the local
management block), and as 1 when
more than one Function has been
enabled.

bit_ranges.name: BR
bit_ranges.description:
BIST Register [BR]
BIST control register.It can be
accessed using local management
bus.

name: BASE_ADDRESS_0
description:
Base Address Register 0
This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated Physical
Function.

bit_ranges.name: MSI0
bit_ranges.description:
Memory Space Indicator [MSI0]
Specifies whether this BAR defines a
memory address range or an I/O
address range (0 = memory, 1 =
I/O). The value read in this field is
determined by the setting of BAR
Configuration Registers of the
associated Physical  Function

bit_ranges.name: R7
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R7]
This bit is hardwired to 0 for both
memory and I/O BARs.

bit_ranges.name: S0
bit_ranges.description:
Size [S0]
When the BAR is used to define a
memory address range, this field
indicates whether the address
range is 32-bit or 64-bit (0 = 32-
bit, 1 = 64 bit).
For 64-bit address ranges, the value
in BAR 1 is treated as a continuation
of the base address in BAR 0. The
value read in this field is determined
by the setting of BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated Physical
Function.

bit_ranges.name: P0
bit_ranges.description:
Prefetchability [P0]
When the BAR is used to define a
memory address range, this field
declares whether data from the
address range is prefetchable (0 =
non- prefetchable, 1 =
prefetchable). The value read in this
field is determined by the setting of
BAR Configuration Registers of the
associated Physical Function

bit_ranges.name: R8
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R8]
These bits are hardwired to  0

bit_ranges.name: BAMR0
bit_ranges.description:
Base Address - RO part [BAMR0]
This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated Physical
Function. All other bits are not
writeable, and are read as 0's.

bit_ranges.name: BAMRW
bit_ranges.description:
Base Address - RW part [BAMRW]
This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated Physical
Function.

name: BASE_ADDRESS_1
description:
Base Address Register 1
This field defines the base address of
the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits   in this
field determines the BAR aperture
setting of BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated
Physical Function. All other bits are
not writeable, and are read as 0's.

bit_ranges.name: BAMRW
bit_ranges.description:
Base Address - RW part [BAMRW]
This field defines the base address of
the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits   in this
field determines the BAR aperture
setting of BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated
Physical Function. All other bits are
not writeable, and are read as 0's.

description:
Base Address Register 2
This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated Physical
Function.

bit_ranges.description:

Specifies whether this BAR defines a
memory address range or an I/O
address range (0 = memory, 1 =
I/O). The value read in this field is
determined by the setting of BAR

associated Physical  Function

value read in this field is determined

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: SUBSYSTEM_VENDOR_ID_AND_SUBSYSTEM_ID
description:
Subsystem Vendor ID and Subsystem ID Register
Specifies the Subsystem ID assigned
by the manufacturer of the device.
On power-up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be re-
written independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: SVID
bit_ranges.description:
Subsystem Vendor ID [SVID]
Specifies the Subsystem Vendor ID
assigned by the PCI SIG to the
manufacturer of the device. Its value
comes from the Subsystem Vendor
ID Register in the local management
register block.

bit_ranges.name: SID
bit_ranges.description:
Subsystem ID [SID]
Specifies the Subsystem ID assigned
by the manufacturer of the device.
On power-up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be re-
written independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: CAPABILITIES_POINTER
description:
Capabilities Pointer
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CP
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Contains pointer to the first PCI
Capability Structure. This field is set
by default to the value defined in the
RTL file reg_defaults.h. It can be re-
written independently for every
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: R15
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R15]
Reserved

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: INTERRUPT_LINE_AND_INTERRUPT_PIN
description:
Interrupt Line and Interrupt Pin Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ILR
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Line Register [ILR]
Identifies the IRQx input of the
interrupt controller at the Root
Complex that is activated by this
Functions interrupt (00 = IRQ0, ... ,
0F = IRQ15,  FF = unknown or not
connected). This field is writable
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: IPR
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Pin Register [IPR]
Identifies the interrupt input (A, B,
C, D) to which this Functions
interrupt output is connected to
(01= INTA, 02 = INTB, 03 = INTC,
04 = INTD). The assignment of
interrupt inputs to Functions is fixed
when the core is configured. This
field can be re-written independently
for each Function from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R16
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R16]
Reserved

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: POWER_MANAGEMENT_CAPABILITIES
description:
Power Management Capabilities Register
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D3cold state. Because
the device does not have aux power,
this bit is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Identifies that the capability
structure is for Power Management.
This field is set by default to 01 hex.
It can be re-written independently
for each Function from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: CP
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Contains pointer to the next PCI
Capability Structure. The core sets it
to the value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be re-
written independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: VID
bit_ranges.description:
Version ID [VID]
Indicates the version of the PCI Bus
Power Management Specifications
that the Function implements. This
field is set by default to 011 (Version
1.2). It can be re-written
independently  for each Function
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: PC
bit_ranges.description:
PME Clock [PC]
Not applicable to PCI Express. This
bit is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DSI
bit_ranges.description:
Device Specific Initialization Bit [DSI]
This bit, when set, indicates that the
device requires additional
configuration steps beyond setting
up its PCI configuration space, to
bring it to the D0 active state from
the D0 uninitialized state. This bit is
hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: MCRAPS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Current Required from Aux Power Supply [MCRAPS]
Specifies the maximum current
drawn by the device from the aux
power source in the D3cold state.
This field is not implemented in
devices not supporting PME
notification when in the D3cold
state, and is therefore hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: D1S
bit_ranges.description:
D1 Support [D1S]
Set if the Function supports the D1
power state. This bit can be modified
from the local management bus by
writing into Function 0. All other
Functions assume the value set in
Function 0s Power Management
Capabilities Register.

bit_ranges.name: D2S
bit_ranges.description:
D2 Support [D2S]
Set if the Function supports the D2
power state. Currently hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: PSD0S
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D0 State [PSD0S]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D0 state.  This bit is set
to 1 by default, but can be modified
from the local management bus by
writing into Function 0. All other
Functions assume the value set in
Function 0s Power Management
Capabilities Register.

bit_ranges.name: PSD1S
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D1 State [PSD1S]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D1 state. This bit can be
modified from the local management
bus by writing into Function 0. All
other Functions assume the value
set in Function 0s Power
Management  Capabilities Register.

bit_ranges.name: PSD2S
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D2 State [PSD2S]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D2 state. This bit is
hardwired to 0 because D2 state is
not supported.

bit_ranges.name: PSDHS
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D3(hot) Statue [PSDHS]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D3hot state. This bit is
set to 1 by default, but can be
modified from the local management
bus by writing into Function 0. All
other Functions assume the value
set in Function 0s Power
Management Capabilities Register.

bit_ranges.name: PSDCS
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D3(cold) State [PSDCS]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D3cold state. Because
the device does not have aux power,
this bit is hardwired to 0.

name: POWER_MANAGEMENT_CONTROL/STATUS_REPORT
description:
Power Management Control/Status Report
This optional register is not
implemented in the PCIe core. This
field is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: PS
bit_ranges.description:
Power State [PS]
Indicates the power state this
Function is currently in. This field
can be read by the software to
monitor the current power state, or
can be written to cause a transition
to a new state. The valid settings are
00 (state D0), 01 (state D1) and 11
(state D3hot). The software should
not write
any other value into this field. This
field can also be written from the
local management bus independently
for each Function.

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: NSR
bit_ranges.description:
No Soft Reset [NSR]
When this bit is set to 1, the
Function will maintain all its state in
the PM state D3hot. The software is
not required to re-initialize the
Function registers on the transition
back to D0. This bit is set to 1 by
default, but can be modified
independently for each PF from the
local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PE
bit_ranges.description:
PME Enable [PE]
Setting this bit enables the
notification of PME events from the
associated Function. This bit can be
set also by writing into this register
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PMES
bit_ranges.description:
PME Status [PMES]
When PME notification is enabled,
writing a 1 into this bit position from
the local management bus sets this
bit and causes the core to send a
PME message from the associated
Function. When the Root Complex
processes this message, it will turn
off this bit by writing a 1 into this bit
position through a Config Write. This
bit can be set or cleared from the
local management bus, by writing a
1 or 0, respectively. It can only be
cleared from the configuration path
(by writing a 1).

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DR
bit_ranges.description:
Data Register [DR]
This optional register is not
implemented in the PCIe core. This
field is hardwired to 0.

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: MSI_CONTROL
description:
MSI Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CID1
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID1]
Specifies that the capability structure is
for MSI. Hardwired to 05 hex.

bit_ranges.name: CP1
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP1]
Pointer to the next PCI Capability
Structure.   This can be modified from
the local management bus. This field can
be written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: ME
bit_ranges.description:
MSI Enable [ME]
Set by the configuration program to
enable the MSI feature. This field can
also be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: MMC
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Message Capable [MMC]
Encodes the number of distinct messages
that the core is capable of generating for
this Function (000 = 1, 001 = 2, 010 =
4, 011 = 8, 100 = 16, 101= 32). Thus,
this field defines the number of the
interrupt vectors for this Function. The
core allows up to 32 distinct messages,
but the setting of this field must be based
on the number of interrupt inputs of the
core that are actually used by the client.
For example, if the client logic uses 8 of
the 32 distinct MSI interrupt inputs of the
core   for this Function, then the value of
this field must be set to 011. This field
can be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: MME
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Message Enable [MME]
Encodes the number of distinct messages
that the core is programmed to generate
for this Function (000 = 1, 001 = 2, 010
= 4, 011 = 8, 100 = 16, 101= 32). This
setting must be based on the number of
interrupt inputs of the core that are
actually used   by this Function. This
field can be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: BAC64
bit_ranges.description:
64-Bit Address Capable [BAC64]
Set to 1 to indicate that the device is
capable of generating 64-bit addresses
for MSI messages. Can be modified using
local management interface

bit_ranges.name: MC
bit_ranges.description:
MSI masking capable [MC]
can be modified using local management
interface

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

name: MSI_MESSAGE_LOW_ADDRESS
description:
MSI Message Low Address Register
Lower bits of the address to be used
in MSI messages. This field can also
be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
The two lower bits of the address are
hardwired to 0 to align the address
on a double-word  boundary.

bit_ranges.name: MAL
bit_ranges.description:
Message Address Low [MAL]
Lower bits of the address to be used
in MSI messages. This field can also
be written from the local
management bus.

name: MSI_MESSAGE_HIGH_ADDRESS
description:
MSI Message High Address Register
Contains bits 63:32 of the 64-bit
address to be used in MSI Messages.
A value of 0 specifies that 32-bit
addresses are to be used in the
messages. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: MAH
bit_ranges.description:
Message Address High [MAH]
Contains bits 63:32 of the 64-bit
address to be used in MSI Messages.
A value of 0 specifies that 32-bit
addresses are to be used in the
messages. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

name: MSI_MESSAGE_DATA
description:
MSI Message Data Register
Hardwired to 0

bit_ranges.name: MD
bit_ranges.description:
Message Data [MD]
Message data to be used for this
Function. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Hardwired to 0

name: MSI_MASK
description:
MSI Mask Register
Please note that if the Multiple
Message Capable field is changed
from the local management APB bus,
then the width of this field also
changes correspondingly

bit_ranges.name: MM
bit_ranges.description:
MSI Mask [MM]
Mask bits for MSI interrupts. The
Multiple Message Capable field of the
MSI Control Register specifies the
number of distinct interrupts forthe
Function, which determines the
number of valid mask bits. Please
note that if the Multiple Message
Capable field is changed from the
local management APB bus, then the
width of the MSI Mask field also
changes  correspondingly

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Please note that if the Multiple
Message Capable field is changed
from the local management APB bus,
then the width of this field also
changes correspondingly

name: MSI_PENDING_BITS
description:
MSI Pending Bits Register
Please note that if the Multiple
Message Capable field is changed
from the local management APB bus,
then the width of this field also
changes correspondingly

bit_ranges.name: MP
bit_ranges.description:
MSI Pending Bits [MP]
Pending bits for MSI interrupts. This
field can be written from the APB
interface to reflect the current
pending status. The Multiple
Message Capable field of the MSI
Control Register specifies the
number of distinct interrupts for the
Function, which determines the
number of valid pending bits. Please
note that if the Multiple Message
Capable field is changed from the
local management APB bus, then the
width of the MSI Pending Bits field
also changes  correspondingly

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Please note that if the Multiple
Message Capable field is changed
from the local management APB bus,
then the width of this field also
changes correspondingly

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: MSI_X_CONTROL
description:
MSI-X Control Register
Set by the configuration program to
enable the MSI-X feature. This field
can also be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Identifies that the capability
structure is for MSI-X. This field is
set by default to 11 hex. It can be
rewritten independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: CP
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Contains pointer to the next PCI
Capability Structure. This is set to
point to the PCI Express Capability
Structure at 30 hex. This can be
rewritten independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: MSIXTS
bit_ranges.description:
MSI-X Table Size [MSIXTS]
Specifies the size of the MSI-X Table,
that is, the number of interrupt
vectors definedfor the Function. The
programmed value is 1 minus the
size of the table (that is, this field is
set to 0 if the table size is 1.). It can
be re- written independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: FM
bit_ranges.description:
Function Mask [FM]
This bit serves as a global mask to
all the interrupt conditions
associated with this Function. When
this bit is set, the core will not send
out MSI-X messages from this
Function. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: MSIXE
bit_ranges.description:
MSI-X Enable [MSIXE]
Set by the configuration program to
enable the MSI-X feature. This field
can also be written from the local
management bus.

name: MSI_X_TABLE_OFFSET
description:
MSI-X Table Offset Register
Offset of the memory address where
the MSI- X Table is located, relative
to the selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD aligned.

bit_ranges.name: BARI
bit_ranges.description:
BAR Indicator Register [BARI]
Identifies the BAR corresponding to
the memory address range where
the MSI-X Table is located (000 =
BAR 0, 001 = BAR 1, ... , 101 = BAR
5).

bit_ranges.name: TO
bit_ranges.description:
Table Offset [TO]
Offset of the memory address where
the MSI- X Table is located, relative
to the selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD aligned.

name: MSI_X_PENDING_INTERRUPT
description:
MSI-X Pending Interrupt Register
Offset of the memory address where
the PBA is located, relative to the
selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD aligned.

bit_ranges.name: BARI1
bit_ranges.description:
BAR Indicator Register [BARI1]
Identifies the BAR corresponding to
the memory address range where
the PBA Structure is located (000 =
BAR 0, 001 = BAR 1, ... , 101 = BAR
5). The value programmed must be
the same as the BAR Indicator
configured in the MSI-X Table Offset
Register.Identifies the BAR
corresponding to the memory
address range where the PBA
Structure is located (000 = BAR 0,
001 = BAR1, ... , 101 = BAR 5). The
value programmed must be the
same as the BAR Indicator
configured in the MSI-X Table Offset
Register.

bit_ranges.name: PBAO
bit_ranges.description:
PBA Offset [PBAO]
Offset of the memory address where
the PBA is located, relative to the
selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD aligned.

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_CAPABILITY_LIST
description:
PCI Express Capability List Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Specifies Capability ID assigned by
PCI SIG for this structure. This field
is hardwired to 10  hex.

bit_ranges.name: NCP
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Pointer [NCP]
Points to the next PCI capability
structure. Set to 0 because this is
the last capability structure.

bit_ranges.name: PCV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [PCV]
Identifies the version number of the
capability structure. The value
depends on the value of the strap
input PCIE_GENERATION_SEL If
PCIE_GENERATION_SEL indicates
Gen 2 or later generations, then the
value is 2 else 1. It can be modified
through local management
interface.

bit_ranges.name: DT
bit_ranges.description:
Device Type [DT]
Indicates the type of device
implementing this Function. This
field is hardwired to 0 in the EP
mode.

bit_ranges.name: SS
bit_ranges.description:
Slot Status [SS]
Set to 1 when the link connected to
a slot. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: IMN
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Message Number [IMN]
Identifies the MSI or MSI-X interrupt
vector for the interrupt message
generated corresponding to the
status bits in the Slot Status
Register, Root Status Register, or this
capability structure. This field must
be defined based on the chosen
interrupt mode - MSI or MSI-X. This
field is hardwired to  0.

bit_ranges.name: TRS
bit_ranges.description:
TCS Routing Supported [TRS]
When set to 1, this bit indicates that
the device supports routing of
Trusted Configuration Requests. Not
valid for Endpoints. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CAPABILITIES
description:
PCI Express Device Capabilities Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MPS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Payload Size [MPS]
Specifies maximum payload size
supported by the device.

bit_ranges.name: PFS
bit_ranges.description:
Phantom Functions Supported [PFS]
This field is used to extend the tag
field by combining unused Function
bits with the tag bits. This field is
hardwired to 00 to disable this
feature.

bit_ranges.name: ETFS
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Tag Field Supported [ETFS]
Extended Tag Field Not Supported.
Hard coded to 0.

bit_ranges.name: AL0SL
bit_ranges.description:
Acceptable L0S Latency [AL0SL]
Specifies acceptable latency that the
Endpoint can tolerate while
transitioning from L0S to L0. It is set
by default to the value define in
reg_defaults.h. It can be re-written
independently for each Function
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: AL1SL
bit_ranges.description:
Acceptable L1 Latency [AL1SL]
Specifies acceptable latency that the
Endpoint can tolerate while
transitioning from L1 to L0. It is set
by default to the value define in
reg_defaults.h. It can be re-written
independently for each Function
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RBER
bit_ranges.description:
Role- Based Error Reporting [RBER]
Enables role-based error reporting.
It is hardwired to 1.It can be re-
written independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CSPLV
bit_ranges.description:
Captured Slot Power Limit Value [CSPLV]
Specifies upper limit on power
supplied by slot. It is set by default
to the value define in reg_defaults.h.
It can be re-written independently
for each Function from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: CPLS
bit_ranges.description:
Captured Power Limit Scale [CPLS]
Specifies the scale used by Slot
Power Limit Value. It is set by
default to the value define in
reg_defaults.h. It can be re-written
independently for each Function
from the local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: FC
bit_ranges.description:
FLR Capable [FC]
Set when device has Function-Level
Reset capability. It is set by default
to 1. It can be re- written
independently for each Function
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CONTROL_AND_STATUS
description:
PCI Express Device Control and Status Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ECER
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Correctable Error Reporting [ECER]
Enables the sending of ERR_COR
messages by the core on the
detection of correctable  errors.

bit_ranges.name: ENFER
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Non- Fatal Error Reporting [ENFER]
Enables the sending of
ERR_NONFATAL messages by the
core on the detection of non-fatal
errors.

bit_ranges.name: EFER
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Fatal Error Reporting [EFER]
Enables the sending of ERR_FATAL
messages by the core on the
detection of fatal  errors.

bit_ranges.name: EURR
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Unsupported Request Reporting [EURR]
Enables the sending of error
messages by the core on receiving
unsupported requests.

bit_ranges.name: ERO
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Relaxed Ordering [ERO]
When set, this bit indicates that the
device is allowed to set the Relaxed
Ordering bit in the Attributes field of
transactions initiated from  it, when
the transactions do not require
Strong Ordering.

bit_ranges.name: MPS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Payload Size [MPS]
Specifies the maximum TLP payload
size configured. The device must be
able to receive a TLP of this
maximum size, and should not
generate TLPs larger than this
value. The configuration program
sets this field based on the
maximum payload size in the
Device Capabilities Register, and the
capability of the other  side.

bit_ranges.name: ETFE
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Tag Field Enable [ETFE]
Enables the extension of the tag
field from 5 to 8 bits.

bit_ranges.name: EPH
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Phantom Functions [EPH]
This field is hardwired to 0 as the
core does not support this feature.

bit_ranges.name: EAP
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Aux Power [EAP]
Used only when device used aux
power. This field is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: ENS
bit_ranges.description:
Enable No Snoop [ENS]
When set to 1, the device is allowed
to set the No Snoop bit in initiated
transactions in which cache
coherency is not needed.

bit_ranges.name: MRRS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Read Request Size [MRRS]
Specifies the maximum size allowed
in read requests generated by the
device.

bit_ranges.name: FLR
bit_ranges.description:
Function- Level Reset [FLR]
Writing a 1 into this bit position
generates a Function-Level Reset for
the selected Function. This bit reads
as 0.

bit_ranges.name: CED
bit_ranges.description:
Correctable Error Detected [CED]
Set to 1 by the core when it detects
a correctable error, regardless of
whether error reporting is enabled
or not, and regardless of whether
the error is masked.

bit_ranges.name: NFED
bit_ranges.description:
Non-Fatal Error Detected [NFED]
Set to 1 by the core when it detects
a non-fatal error, regardless of
whether error reporting  is enabled
or not, and regardless of whether
the error is masked.

bit_ranges.name: FED
bit_ranges.description:
Fatal Error Detected [FED]
Set to 1 by the core when it detects
a fatal error, regardless of whether
error reporting is enabled or not,
and regardless of whether the error
is  masked.

bit_ranges.name: URD
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Request Detected [URD]
Set to 1 by the core when it
receives an unsupported request,
regardless of whether its reporting
is enabled or  not.

bit_ranges.name: APD
bit_ranges.description:
Aux Power Detected [APD]
Set when auxiliary power is
detected by the device. This is an
unused field.

bit_ranges.name: TP
bit_ranges.description:
Transaction Pending [TP]
Indicates if any of the Non-Posted
requests issued by the Function are
still  pending.

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

name: LINK_CAPABILITIES
description:
Link Capabilities Register
Specifies the port number assigned
to the PCI Express link connected to
this  device.

bit_ranges.name: MLS
bit_ranges.description:
Maximum Link Speed [MLS]
Indicates the maximum speed
supported by the link. (2.5 GT/s, 5
GT/s per lane). This field is
hardwired to 0001 (2.5GT/s) when
the strap input
PCIE_GENERATION_SEL is set to 0,
to 0010 (5 GT/s) when the strap is
set to  1.

bit_ranges.name: MLW
bit_ranges.description:
Maximum Link Width [MLW]
Indicates the maximum number of
lanes supported by the device. This
field is hardwired based on the
setting of the LANE_COUNT_IN strap
input.

bit_ranges.name: ASPM
bit_ranges.description:
Active State Power Management [ASPM]
Indicates the level of ASPM support
provided   by the device. This field
can be re-written independently for
each Function from the local
management bus. When SRIS is
enabled in local management
register bit, L0s capability is not
supported and is forced  low.

bit_ranges.name: L0SEL
bit_ranges.description:
L0S Exit Latency [L0SEL]
Specifies the time required for the
device to transition from L0S to L0.
This parameter is dependent on the
Physical Layer implementation.  It is
set by default to the value define in
reg_defaults.h. It can be re-written
independently for each Function
from the local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: L1EL
bit_ranges.description:
L1 Exit Latency [L1EL]
Specifies the exit latency from L1
state. This parameter is dependent
on the Physical Layer
implementation. It is set by default
to the value define in
reg_defaults.h. It can be  re-written
independently for each Function
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: CPM
bit_ranges.description:
Clock Power Management [CPM]
Indicates that the device supports
removal of referenc clocks. It is set
by default to the value of the define
in reg_defaults.h. It can be re-
written independently for each
function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: SDERC
bit_ranges.description:
Surprise Down Error Reporting Capability [SDERC]
Indicates the capability of the device
to report a Surprise Down error
condition. This bit is hardwired to 0,
as this version of the core does not
support the feature.

bit_ranges.name: DLLARC
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Layer Active Reporting Capability [DLLARC]
Set to 1 if the device is capable of
reporting that the DL Control and
Management State Machine  has
reached the DL_Active state. This bit
is hardwired to 0, as this version of
the core does not support the
feature.

bit_ranges.name: LBNC
bit_ranges.description:
Link Bandwidth Notification Capability [LBNC]
A value of 1b indicates support for
the Link Bandwidth Notification
status and interrupt mechanisms.
Reserved for  Endpoint.

bit_ranges.name: AOC
bit_ranges.description:
ASPM Optionality Compliance [AOC]
Setting this bit indicates that the
device supports the ASPM
Optionality feature. It can be turned
off by writing a 0 to this bit position
through the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R5]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PN
bit_ranges.description:
Port Number [PN]
Specifies the port number assigned
to the PCI Express link connected to
this  device.

name: LINK_CONTROL_AND_STATUS
description:
Link Control and Status Register
This bit is Set by hardware to
indicate that hardware has
autonomously changed Link speed
or width, without the Port
transitioning through DL_Down
status, for reasons other than to
attempt to correct unreliable Link
operation. This triggers an interrupt
to be generated through
PHY_INTERRUPT_OUT if enabled.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0. Not
applicable to Endpoints where field
is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: ASPMC
bit_ranges.description:
Active State Power Management Control [ASPMC]
Controls the level of ASPM support
on the PCI Express link associated
with this Function. The valid setting
are 00: ASPM disabled 01: L0s
entry enabled, L1 disabled 10: L1
entry enabled, L0s disabled 11:
Both L0s and L1 enabled.

bit_ranges.name: R6
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R6]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RCB
bit_ranges.description:
Read Completion Boundary [RCB]
Indicates the Read Completion
Boundary of the Root Port connected
to this Endpoint (0 = 64 bytes, 1 =
128 bytes). This field can be written
from the APB bus by setting [21] bit
high of the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR
during a local management
register write.

bit_ranges.name: LD
bit_ranges.description:
Link Disable [LD]
Writing a 1 to this bit position
causes the LTSSM to go to the
Disable Link state. The LTSSM stays
in the Disable Link state while this
bit is set. Reserved for Endpoint
mode.

bit_ranges.name: RL
bit_ranges.description:
Retrain Link [RL]
Setting this bit to 1 causes the
LTSSM to initiate link training.
Reserved for Endpoint mode. This
bit always reads as 0

bit_ranges.name: CCC
bit_ranges.description:
Common Clock Configuration [CCC]
A value of 0 indicates that the
reference clock of this device is
asynchronous to that of the
upstream device. A value of 1
indicates that the reference clock is
common.

bit_ranges.name: ES
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Synch [ES]
Set to 1 to extend the sequence of
ordered sets transmitted while
exiting from the L0S  state.

bit_ranges.name: ECPM
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Clock Power Management [ECPM]
When this bit is set to 1, the device
may use the CLKREQ# pin on the
PCIe connector to power manage
the Link clock. This bit is writeable
only when the Clock Power
Management bit in the  Link
Capability Register is set to 1.

bit_ranges.name: R9
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R9]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LBMIE
bit_ranges.description:
Link Bandwidth Management Interrupt Enable [LBMIE]
When Set, this bit enables the
generation of an interrupt to
indicate that the Link Bandwidth
Management Status bit has been
Set. This enables an interrupt to be
generated through PHY
INTERRUPT_OUT if triggered.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0. Not
applicable to Endpoints where field
is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: LABIE
bit_ranges.description:
Link Autonomous Bandwidth Interrupt Enable [LABIE]
When Set, this bit enables the
generation of an interrupt to
indicate that the Link Autonomous
Bandwidth Status bit has been Set.
This enables an interrupt to be
generated through
PHY_INTERRUPT_OUT if triggered.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0. Not
applicable to Endpoints where field
is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R15_12
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R15_12]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: NLS
bit_ranges.description:
Negotiated Link Speed [NLS]
Negotiated link speed of the device.
The only supported speed ids are
2.5 GT/s per lane (0001),5 GT/s per
lane (0010).

bit_ranges.name: NLW
bit_ranges.description:
Negotiated Link Width [NLW]
Set at the end of link training to the
actual link width negotiated between
the two sides. Value is undefined if
this register is accessed before link
training.

bit_ranges.name: R8
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R8]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LTS
bit_ranges.description:
Link Training Status [LTS]
This read-only bit indicates that the
Physical Layer LTSSM is in the
Configuration or Recovery state, or
that 1b was written to the Retrain
Link bit but Link training has not yet
begun. Hardware clears this bit
when the LTSSM exits the
Configuration/ Recovery state. Not
applicable to Endpoints where field
is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: SCC
bit_ranges.description:
Slot Clock Configuration [SCC]
Indicates that the device uses the
reference clock provided by the
connector.

bit_ranges.name: DLLA
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Layer Active [DLLA]
Indicates the status of the Data Link
Layer. Set to 1 when the DL Control
and Management State Machine has
reached the DL_Active state. This
bit is hardwired to 0 in this version
of the  core.

bit_ranges.name: LBMS
bit_ranges.description:
Link Bandwidth Management Status [LBMS]
This bit is Set by hardware to
indicate that either link training has
completed following write to retrain
link bit, or when HW has changed
link speed or width to attempt to
correct unreliable link operation.
This triggers an interrupt to be
generated through
PHY_INTERRUPT_OUT if enabled.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0. Not
applicable to Endpoints where field
is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: LABS
bit_ranges.description:
Link Autonomous Bandwidth Status [LABS]
This bit is Set by hardware to
indicate that hardware has
autonomously changed Link speed
or width, without the Port
transitioning through DL_Down
status, for reasons other than to
attempt to correct unreliable Link
operation. This triggers an interrupt
to be generated through
PHY_INTERRUPT_OUT if enabled.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0. Not
applicable to Endpoints where field
is hardwired to 0.

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_2
description:
PCI Express Device Capabilities Register 2
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CTR
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Ranges [CTR]
Specifies the Completion Timeout
values supported by the device. This
field is set by default to 0010 (10
ms - 250 ms). The actual timeout
values are in two programmable
local management registers, which
allow the timeout settings of the two
sub-ranges within Range B to be
programmed independently.

bit_ranges.name: CTDS
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Disable Supported [CTDS]
A 1 in this field indicates that the
associated Function supports the
capability to turn off its Completion
timeout. This bit is set to 1 by
default, but can be re-written
independently for each Function
from the local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: AFS
bit_ranges.description:
ARI forwarding support [AFS]
ARI  forwarding supported.

bit_ranges.name: OPRS
bit_ranges.description:
OP routing supported [OPRS]
Atomic OP routing  supported.

bit_ranges.name: BAOCS32
bit_ranges.description:
32-Bit Atomic Op Completer Supported [BAOCS32]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: BAOCS64
bit_ranges.description:
64-Bit Atomic Op Completer Supported [BAOCS64]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: BAOCS128
bit_ranges.description:
128-Bit CAS Atomic Op Completer Supported [BAOCS128]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R12
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R12]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LMS
bit_ranges.description:
LTR Mechanism Supported [LMS]
A 1 in this bit position indicates that
the Function supports the Latency
Tolerance Reporting (LTR) Capability.
This bit is set to 1 by default, but
can be turned off for all Physical
Functions by writing into PF 0.

bit_ranges.name: TCS
bit_ranges.description:
TPH Completer Supported [TCS]
These bits, when set, indicate that
the Function is capable of serving as
a completer for requests with
Transaction Processing Hints (TPH).
It can be turned off for all Physical
Functions by writing into PF 0.
Defined Encodings are: 00b TPH and
Extended TPH Completer not
supported. 01b TPH Completer
supported; Extended TPH Completer
not supported. 10b Reserved. 11b
Both TPH and Extended TPH
Completer supported.

bit_ranges.name: R13
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R13]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: OPFFS
bit_ranges.description:
OBFF Supported [OPFFS]
A 1 in this bit position indicates that
the Function supports the Optimized
Buffer Flush/Fill (OBFF) capability
using message  signaling.

bit_ranges.name: EXFS
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Format Field Supported [EXFS]
Indicates that the Function supports
the 3-bit definition of the Fmt field
in the TLP header. This bit is
hardwired to 1 for all Physical
Functions.

bit_ranges.name: EEPS
bit_ranges.description:
End-End TLP Prefix Supported [EEPS]
Indicates whether the Function
supports End-End TLP Prefixes. A 1
in this field indicates that the
Function supports receiving TLPs
containing End- End TLP Prefixes.

bit_ranges.name: MEEP
bit_ranges.description:
Max End- End TLP Prefixes [MEEP]
Indicates the maximum number of
End-End TLP Prefixes supported by
the Function. The supported values
are: 01b 1 End-End TLP Prefix 10b 2
End- End TLP Prefixes

bit_ranges.name: R14
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R14]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CONTROL_AND_STATUS_2
description:
PCI Express Device Control and Status Register 2
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CTV
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Value [CTV]
Specifies the Completion Timeout
value for the device. Allowable
values are 0101 (sub-range 1) and
0110 (sub-range 2). The
corresponding timeout values are
stored in the local management
registers Completion Timeout
Interval Registers 0 and 1,
respectively.

bit_ranges.name: CTD
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Disable [CTD]
Setting this bit disables Completion
Timeout in the device. This bit can
also be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: AFE
bit_ranges.description:
ARI forwarding enable [AFE]
ARI forwarding enable

bit_ranges.name: AORE
bit_ranges.description:
Atomic Op Requester Enable [AORE]
This bit must be set to enable the
generation of Atomic Op Requests
from the Function. If the client logic
attempts to send an Atomic Op for a
Function for which this bit is not set,
logic in the core will nullify the TLP
on its way to the link. This bit can
also be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R16
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R16]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IDORE
bit_ranges.description:
IDO Request Enable [IDORE]
When this bit is 1, the Function is
allowed to set the ID-based Ordering
(IDO) Attribute bit in the requests it
generates.

bit_ranges.name: IDOCE
bit_ranges.description:
IDO Completion Enable [IDOCE]
When this bit is 1, the Function is
allowed to set the ID-based Ordering
(IDO) Attribute bit in the
Completions it generates.

bit_ranges.name: LTRME
bit_ranges.description:
LTR Mechanism Enable [LTRME]
This must be set to 1 to enable the
Latency Tolerance Reporting
Mechanism. This bit is implemented
only in PF 0. Its default value is 1,
but can be modified from the local
management bus. This bit is read-
only in PF 1.

bit_ranges.name: R17
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R17]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: OBFFE
bit_ranges.description:
OBFF Enable [OBFFE]
Enables the Optimized Buffer
Flush/Fill (OBFF) capability in the
device. This field is implemented
only in PF 0. Valid settings are 00
(disabled), 01 (Variation A) and 10
(Variation B). This field can also be
written from the local management
bus. RW if OBFF capability is
supported, RO otherwise.

bit_ranges.name: R18
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R18]
Reserved

name: LINK_CAPABILITIES_2
description:
Link Capabilities Register 2
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
RSVD
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: SLSV
bit_ranges.description:
Supported Link Speeds Vector [SLSV]
This field indicates the supported
link speeds of the core. For each bit,
a value of 1 indicates that the
corresponding link speed is
supported, while a value of 0
indicates that the corresponding
speed is not supported. The bits
corresponding to various link speeds
are: Bit 1 = Link Speed 2.5 GT/s,
Bit 2= Link Speed 5 GT/s, Bit 3 =
Link Speed 8 GT/s. This field is
hardwired to 001 (2.5 GT/s) when
the PCIE_GENERATION_SEL strap
pins of the core are set to 0, 011
(2.5 and 5 GT/s) when the strap
is set to 1. This field is RsvrdP for
the selected configuration.

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
RSVD
RSVD

name: LINK_CONTROL_AND_STATUS_2
description:
Link Control and Status Register 2
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: TLS
bit_ranges.description:
Target Link Speed [TLS]
For an upstream component, this
field sets an upper limit on Link
operational speed during
reconfiguration. Additionally for both
upstream and downstream
components, this field sets the
target speed when the software
forces the link into Compliance
mode by setting the Enter
Compliance bit in this register (0001
= 2.5 GT/ s, 0010 = 5 GT/s, 0100 =
8 GT/s). The default value of this
field is 0001 (2.5 GT/s) when the
PCIE_GENERATION_SEL strap pins
of the core are set to 0, 0010 (5
GT/s) when the strap is set to 1.
These bits are STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EC
bit_ranges.description:
Enter Compliance [EC]
into the Compliance mode. The
target speed for the Compliance
mode is determined by the Target
Link Speed field of this register.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HASD
bit_ranges.description:
Hardware Autonomous Speed Disable [HASD]
When this bit is set, the LTSSM is
prevented from changing the
operating speed of the link, other
than reducing the speed to correct
unreliable operation of the link.
STICKY

bit_ranges.name: SDE
bit_ranges.description:
Selectable De- emphasis [SDE]
This bit selects the de-emphasis
level when the core is operating at 5
GT/s (0 = -6 dB, 1 = -3.5 dB). This
is reserved for  Endpoints.

bit_ranges.name: TM
bit_ranges.description:
Transmit Margin [TM]
This field is intended for debug and
compliance testing purposes only. It
controls the non-de- emphasized
voltage level at the transmitter
outputs. Its encodings are: 000:
Normal operating range. 001: 800 -
1200 mV for full swing and 400 -
700 mV for half swing. 010 - 111:
See PCI Express Base Specification
2.0. This field is reset to 0 when the
LTSSM enters the Polling
Configuration substate during link
training.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EMC
bit_ranges.description:
Enter Modified Compliance [EMC]
This field is intended for debug and
compliance testing purposes only. If
this bit is set to 1, the device will
transmit the Modified Compliance
Pattern when the LTSSM enters the
Polling. Compliance substate.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CS
bit_ranges.description:
Compliance SOS [CS]
When this bit is set to 1, the device
will transmit SKP ordered sets
between compliance patterns.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CDE
bit_ranges.description:
Compliance De- Emphasis [CDE]
This bit sets the de-emphasis level
(for 5GT/s operation) or the
Transmitter Preset level (for 8 GT/s
operation) when the LTSSM enters
the Polling Compliance state
because of software
setting the Enter Compliance bit in
this register. It is used only when
the link is running at 5 GT/s or 8
GT/s. At 5 GT/s, the only valid
setting are 0 (-6dB) and 1 (-3.5 dB).
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CDEL
bit_ranges.description:
Current De- Emphasis Level [CDEL]
This status bit indicates the current
operating de- emphasis level of the
transmitter (0 = -6 dB, 1 = -3.5
dB).This field is undefined when link
is not at Gen2 speed.

bit_ranges.name: R20
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R20]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R19
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R19]
Reserved

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: ADVANCED_ERROR_REPORTING_(AER)_ENHANCED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
Advanced Error Reporting (AER) Enhanced Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PEECI
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PEECI]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to
the PCI Express AER Extended
Capability Structure (0001 hex).

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG assigned value for
the version   of the capability
structure. This field is set by default
to 4'h2, but can be modified from
the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_STATUS
description:
Uncorrectable Error Status Register
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DLPES
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Protocol Error Status [DLPES]
This bit is set when the core
receives an Ack or Nak DLLP whose
sequence number does not
correspond to that of an
unacknowledged TLP or that of the
last acknowledged TLP (for details,
refer to PCI Express Base
Specification 1.1, Section 3.5.2).
This error is not Function-specific,
and is reported by Function 0.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PTS
bit_ranges.description:
Poisoned TLP Status [PTS]
This bit is set when the core
receives a poisoned TLP from the
link. This error is Function-specific.
This error is considered non-fatal by
default. The error is reported by
sending an ERR_NONFATAL
message. The header of the
received TLP with error is logged in
the Header Log Registers.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: FCPES
bit_ranges.description:
Flow Control Protocol Error Status [FCPES]
This bit is set when certain
violations of the flow control
protocol are detected by the core.
See Section 2.6.1 for details. This
error is not Function- specific
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CTS
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Status [CTS]
This bit is set when the completion
timer associated with an
outstanding request times out. This
error is Function-specific. This error
is considered non-fatal by default.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CAS
bit_ranges.description:
Completer Abort Status [CAS]
This bit is set when the core has
returned the Completer Abort (CA)
status to a request received from
the link. This error is Function-
specific. The header of the received
request that caused the error is
logged in the Header Log Registers.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: UCS
bit_ranges.description:
Unexpected Completion Status [UCS]
This bit is set when the core has
received an unexpected Completion
packet from the link. This error is
not Function-specific.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ROS
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Overflow Status [ROS]
This bit is set when the core
receives a TLP in violation of the
receive credit currently available.
This error is not Function-specific.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: MTS
bit_ranges.description:
Malformed TLP Status [MTS]
This bit is set when the core
receives a malformed TLP from the
link. This error is not Function-
specific. This error is considered
fatal by default, and is reported by
sending an ERR_FATAL message.
The header of the received TLP with
error is logged in the Header Log
Registers.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EES
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Error Status [EES]
This bit is set when the core has
detected an ECRC error in a
received
TLP. This error is not Function-
specific. The header of the received
TLP with error is logged in the
Header Log Registers.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: URES
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Request Error Status [URES]
This bit is set when the core has
received a request from the link that
it does not support. This error is not
Function-specific. This error is
considered non-fatal by default. In
the special case described in
Sections 6.2.3.2.4.1 of the PCI
Express Specifications, the error is
reported by sending an ERR_COR
message. In all other cases, the
error is reported by sending an
ERR_NONFATAL message. The
header of the received request that
caused the error is logged in the
Header Log Registers. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: UIES
bit_ranges.description:
Uncorrectable Internal Error Status [UIES]
This bit is set when the core has
detected an internal uncorrectable
error (HAL parity error or an
uncorrectable ECC error while
reading from any of the RAMs). This
bit is also set in response to the
client signaling an internal error
through the input
UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_IN. This
error is not Function-specific. This
error is considered fatal by default,
and is reported by sending an
ERR_FATAL message. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
(no description)

name: UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_MASK
description:
Uncorrectable Error Mask Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DLPEM
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Protocol Error Mask [DLPEM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of Data Link Protocol Errors.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R5]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PTM
bit_ranges.description:
Poisoned TLP Mask [PTM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of a Poisoned TLP. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: FCPEM
bit_ranges.description:
Flow Control Protocol Error Mask [FCPEM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of Flow Control Protocol Errors.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CTM
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Mask [CTM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of Completion Timeouts. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CAM
bit_ranges.description:
Completer Abort Mask [CAM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of the core sending a Completer
Abort.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: UCM
bit_ranges.description:
Unexpected Completion Mask [UCM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of unexpected Completions received
by the core.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ROM
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Overflow Mask [ROM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of violations of receive credit.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: MTM
bit_ranges.description:
Malformed TLP Mask [MTM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of malformed TLPs received from
the link.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EEM
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Error Mask [EEM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of ECRC errors. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: UREM
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Request Error Mask [UREM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of unexpected requests received
from the link.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R6
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R6]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: UIEM
bit_ranges.description:
Uncorrectable Internal Error Mask [UIEM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of internal errors. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R7
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R7]
Reserved

name: UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_SEVERITY
description:
Uncorrectable Error Severity Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R8
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R8]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DLPER
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Protocol Error Severity [DLPER]
Severity of Data Link Protocol Errors
(0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: SDES
bit_ranges.description:
Surprise Down Error Severity [SDES]
hard coded to 1

bit_ranges.name: R10
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R10]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PTS
bit_ranges.description:
Poisoned TLP Severity [PTS]
Severity of a Poisoned TLP error (0
= Non-Fatal, 1= Fatal). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: FCPES
bit_ranges.description:
Flow Control Protocol Error Severity [FCPES]
Severity of Flow Control Protocol
Errors (0 = Non- Fatal, 1 = Fatal).
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CTS
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Severity [CTS]
Severity of Completion Timeouts (0
= Non-Fatal, 1= Fatal). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CAS
bit_ranges.description:
Completer Abort Severity [CAS]
Severity of sending a Completer
Abort (0 = Non- Fatal, 1 = Fatal).
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: UCS
bit_ranges.description:
Unexpected Completion Severity [UCS]
Severity of unexpected Completions
received by the core (0 = Non-Fatal,
1 = Fatal).  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ROS
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Overflow Severity [ROS]
Severity of receive credit violations
(0 = Non- Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: MTS
bit_ranges.description:
Malformed TLP Severity [MTS]
Severity of malformed TLPs received
from the link (0 = Non- Fatal, 1 =
Fatal).  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EES
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Error Severity [EES]
Severity of ECRC errors (0 = Non-
Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: URES
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Requeset Error Severity [URES]
Severity of unexpected requests
received from the link (0 = Non-
Fatal, 1 = Fatal).  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R11
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R11]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: UIES
bit_ranges.description:
Uncorrectable Internal Error Severity [UIES]
Severity of internal errors (0 = Non-
Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R12
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R12]
Reserved

name: CORRECTABLE_ERROR_STATUS
description:
Correctable Error Status Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RES
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Error Status [RES]
This bit is set when an error is
detected in the receive side of the
Physical Layer of the core (e.g. a bit
error or coding violation). This error
is not Function-specific.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R12
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R12]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BTS
bit_ranges.description:
Bad TP Status [BTS]
This bit is set when an error is
detected in a received TLP by the
Data Link Layer of the core. The
conditions causing this error are: (i)
An LCRC error (ii) The packet
terminates with EDB symbol, but its
LCRC field does not equal the
inverted value of the calculated CRC.
This error is not Function-specific.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: BDS
bit_ranges.description:
Bad DLLP Status [BDS]
This bit is set when an LCRC error is
detected in a received DLLP, and no
errors were detected by the Physical
Layer. This error is not Function-
specific. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: RNRS
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Number Rollover Status [RNRS]
This bit is set when the replay count
rolls over after three re-
transmissions of a TLP at the Data
Link Layer of the core. This error is
not Function- specific STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R13
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R13]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RTTS
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Timer Timeout Status [RTTS]
This bit is set when the replay timer
in the Data Link Layer of the core
times out, causing the core to
retransmit a TLP. This error is not
Function- specific. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ANFES
bit_ranges.description:
Advisory Non- Fatal Error Status [ANFES]
This bit is set when an uncorrectable
error occurs, which is determined to
belong to one of the special cases
described in Section 6.2.3.2.4 of the
PCI Express 2.0 Specifications. This
causes the core to generate an
ERR_COR message in place of an
ERR_NONFATAL message. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CIES
bit_ranges.description:
Corrected Internal Error Status [CIES]
This bit is set when the core has
detected an internal correctable
error condition (a correctable ECC
error while reading from any of the
RAMs). This bit is also set in
response to the client signaling an
internal error through the input
CORRECTABLE_ERROR_IN. This
error is not Function-specific.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HLOS
bit_ranges.description:
Header Log Overflow Status [HLOS]
This bit is set on a Header Log
Register overflow, that is, when the
header could not be logged in the
Header Log Register because it is
occupied by a previous header.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R14
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R14]
Reserved

name: CORRECTABLE_ERROR_MASK
description:
Correctable Error Mask Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: REM
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Error Mask [REM]
This bit, when set, masks the
generation of error messages in
response to the Physical Layer errors
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R15
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R15]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BTM
bit_ranges.description:
Bad TLP Mask [BTM]
This bit, when set, masks the
generation of error messages in
response to a 'Bad TLP' received.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: BDM
bit_ranges.description:
Bad DLLP Mask [BDM]
This bit, when set, masks the
generation of error messages in
response to a 'Bad DLLP' received.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: RNRM
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Number Rollover Mask [RNRM]
This bit, when set, masks the
generation of error messages in
response to a Replay Number
Rollover event. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R16
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R16]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RTTM
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Timer Timeout Mask [RTTM]
This bit, when set, masks the
generation of error messages in
response to a Replay Timer timeout
event. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ANFEM
bit_ranges.description:
Advisory Non-Fatal Error Mask [ANFEM]
This bit, when set, masks the
generation of error messages in
response to an uncorrectable error
occur, which is determined to belong
to one of the special cases (as
described in Section 6.2.3.2.4 of the
PCI Express 2.0 Specifications).
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CIEM
bit_ranges.description:
Corrected Internal Error Mask [CIEM]
This bit, when set, masks the
generation of error messages in
response to a corrected internal
error condition. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HLOM
bit_ranges.description:
Header Log Overflow Mask [HLOM]
This bit, when set, masks the
generation of error messages in
response to a Header Log register
overflow. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R17
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R17]
Reserved

name: ADVANCED_ERROR_CAPABILITIES_AND_CONTROL
description:
Advanced Error Capabilities and Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: FER
bit_ranges.description:
First Error Pointer [FER]
This is a 5-bit pointer to the bit
position in the Uncorrectable Error
Status Register corresponding to the
error that was detected first. When
there are multiple bits set in the
Uncorrectable Error Status Register,
this field informs the software which
error was observed first. To prevent
the field from being overwritten
before software was able to read it,
this field is not updated while the
status bit pointed by it in the
Uncorrectable Error Status Register
remains set. After the software
clears this status bit, a subsequent
error condition that sets any bit in
the Uncorrectable Error Status
Register will update the First Error
Pointer. Any uncorrectable error
type, including the special cases
where the error is reported using an
ERR_COR message, will set the First
Error Pointer (assuming the software
has reset the error pointed by it in
the Uncorrectable Error Status
Register). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EGC
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Generation Capability [EGC]
This read-only bit indicates to the
software that the device is capable
of generating ECRC in packets
transmitted on the link. This bit is
writable from  the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: EEG
bit_ranges.description:
Enable ECRC Generation [EEG]
Setting this bit enables the ECRC
generation on the transmit side of
the core. This bit is writable from the
local management bus.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ECC
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Check Capability [ECC]
This read-only bit indicates to the
software that the device is capable
of checking ECRC in packets received
from the link. This bit is writable
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: EEC
bit_ranges.description:
Enable ECRC Check [EEC]
Setting this bit enables ECRC
checking on the receive side of the
core. This bit is writable from the
local management bus.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: MHRC
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Header Recording Capable [MHRC]
This bit is set when the Function has
the capability to log more than one
error header in its Header Log
Registers. It is hardwired to  0.

bit_ranges.name: MHRE
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Header Recording Enable [MHRE]
Setting this bit enables the Function
to log multiple error headers in its
Header Log Registers. It is hardwired
to 0

bit_ranges.name: R18
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R18]
Reserved

name: ARI_EXTENDED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
ARI Extended Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PECID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI-SIG to
the ARI Extended Capability (000E
hex).

bit_ranges.name: ARICV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [ARICV]
Specifies the SIG-assigned value for
the version of the capability
structure. This field is set to 1 by
default, but can be modified
independently for each Function
from the local management bus

bit_ranges.name: ARINCO
bit_ranges.description:

at the Function Group-level. This
field is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: AFGC
bit_ranges.description:

supported. This field is hardwired to
0.

RSVD

bit_ranges.name: ACR

management bus.

name: POWER_BUDGETING_DATA_SELECT
description:
Power Budgeting Data Select Register
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: PBDN
bit_ranges.description:
Power Budgeting Data Index [PBDN]
This field selects the power
budgeting data read from the Power
Budgeting Data Register. Its settings
are: 00: Selects power budgeting
data for power state D0 MAX for the
associated PF. 01: Selects power
budgeting data for power state D0
SUSTAINED for the associated PF.
10: Selects power budgeting data for
power state D3hot for the associated
PF. 11: Selects power budgeting data
for power state D1 for the associated
PF. Others: Not a valid setting. A
read from the Power Budgeting Data
Register returns all  zeroes.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
(no description)

description:

bit_ranges.name: TYPE

bit_ranges.name: PR

corresponding to the power
management data in this  register.

bit_ranges.name: SA
bit_ranges.description:
System Allocated [SA]
This bit is set to indicate that the
device power specified by this Power
Management Capability Structure is
included in the system power
budget. When this bit set, the
software must exclude the device
power reported by this Capability
Structure from power calculations,
when making power budgeting
decisions. This bit is set to 0 by
default, but its setting can be
modified individually for each PF
from the local management  bus.
