name: LATENCY_TOLERANCE_REPORTING_(LTR)_EXTENDED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
Latency Tolerance Reporting (LTR) Extended Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PECID
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PECID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to
the Latency Tolerance Reporting
Capability (0018  hex).

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG assigned value for
the version of the capability
structure. This field is set by default
to 1, but can be modified from the
local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: LTR_MAX_SNOOP/MAX_NO_SNOOP_LATENCY
description:
LTR Max Snoop/Max No-Snoop Latency Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MSL
bit_ranges.description:
Max Snoop Latency [MSL]
When multiplied by the value of the
Max Snoop Latency Scale, this field
defines the maximum snoop value
the device is permitted to request in
an LTR message. This field can be
written independently for each
Physical Function from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: MSLS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Snoop Latency Scale [MSLS]
Specifies the scale value for the Max
Snoop Latency. When the setting of
this field is non- zero, the actual
snoop latency is determined by
multiplying the Max Snoop Latency
by the following scale factors: 001:
32 ns, 010: 1024 ns, 011: 32,768
ns, 100: 1,047,576 ns, 101:
33,554,432ns, 110-111: Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MNSL
bit_ranges.description:
Max No- Snoop Latency [MNSL]
When multiplied by the value of the
Max No- Snoop Latency Scale, this
field defines the maximum no-snoop
value the device is permitted to
request in an LTR message. This field
can be written independently for
each Physical Function from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: MNSLS
bit_ranges.description:
Max No- Snoop Latency Scale [MNSLS]
Specifies the scale value for the Max
No-Snoop Latency. When the setting
of this field is non- zero, the actual
snoop latency is determined by
multiplying the Max No-Snoop
Latency by the following scale
factors: 001: 32 ns, 010: 1024 ns,
011: 32,768 ns, 100: 1,047,576 ns,
101: 33,554,432ns, 110-111:
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

name: DPA_EXTENDED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
DPA Extended Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PECID
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PECID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to
the Dynamic Power Allocation
Reporting Capability

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG assigned value for
the version of the capability
structure. This field is set by default
to 1, but can be modified from the
local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: DPA_CAPABILITY
description:
DPA Capability Register
Specifies the second of the two
transition latency values for the
substates. The unit of latency is
specified by the Transition Latency
Unit field of this register.

bit_ranges.name: MNS
bit_ranges.description:
Maximum Number of Substates [MNS]
Maximum number of DPA substates
supported by the Function (the value
in this field is the number of
substates minus 1).

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: TLU
bit_ranges.description:
Transition Latency Unit [TLU]
This is the unit of the transition
latencies specified in the Transition
Latency Value 0 and Transition
Latency Value 1 fields of this register
(00 = 1ms, 01 = 10ms, 10 =
100ms, 11 = reserved).

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PAS
bit_ranges.description:
Power Allocation Scale [PAS]
This is the scale used to compute the
actual power from the values
specified in the Dynamic Power
Allocation Array Registers 0 - 7. The
actual   power in Watts is obtained
by multiplying the value in the
Dynamic Power Allocation Array
Register by this scale factor (00 =
10x, 01 = 1x, 10 = 0.1x, 11 =
0.01x).

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: TLV0
bit_ranges.description:
Transition Latency Value 0 [TLV0]
Specifies the transition latency for
the substate. Each of the 32
substates may specify one of the two
transition latency values. This field
contains the first of the two latency
values. The unit of latency is
specified by the Transition Latency
Unit field of this register.

bit_ranges.name: TLV1
bit_ranges.description:
Transition Latency Value 1 [TLV1]
Specifies the second of the two
transition latency values for the
substates. The unit of latency is
specified by the Transition Latency
Unit field of this register.

name: DPA_LATENCY_INDICATOR
description:
DPA Latency Indicator Register
Bit i of this register indicates the
choice of the transition latency value
for substate i. A setting of 0
indicates that Transition Latency
Value 0 from the DPA Capability
Register applies to this substate; a
setting of 1 indicates that Transition
Latency Value 1 applies.

bit_ranges.name: TLIN
bit_ranges.description:
Transition Latency Indicator Bits [TLIN]
Bit i of this register indicates the
choice of the transition latency value
for substate i. A setting of 0
indicates that Transition Latency
Value 0 from the DPA Capability
Register applies to this substate; a
setting of 1 indicates that Transition
Latency Value 1 applies.

name: DPA_CONTROL_AND_STATUS_S
description:
DPA Control and Status Registers
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SS
bit_ranges.description:
Substate Status [SS]
This field provides the current DPA
substate of   this Function. This field
is writable from the local
management bus, and must be
updated by the local software
running on the EndPoint upon
completion of a DPA transition to a
new  substate.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SCE
bit_ranges.description:
Substate Control Enabled [SCE]
This bit enables the Substate Control
field. This bit is initialized to 1 by the
hardware on a power- on reset or a
Function-Level Reset. Software may
clear this bit by writing a 1 to this bit
position, but cannot set this bit
directly through a configuration
write. Clearing this bit disables the
Substate Control field, thus
preventing further substate
transitions for this Function. This bit
can be set to 0 or 1 through the local
management bus, by writing a 0 or
1,  respectively.

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SC
bit_ranges.description:
Substate Control [SC]
This field is used to initiate a
transition of the Function's DPA to a
new substate. To initiate the
transition, software must write the
desired substate value into this field
and wait for the transition latency of
the substate for the Function to
complete the transition. This field
can also be written from the local
management bus. All substate
transitions are disabled when the
Substate Control Enabled bit is 0.
The core generates a one-cycle pulse
on the output DPA_INTERRUPT when
the value if this field is changed (bit
0 is for PF 0 and so on) This
interrupt informs the client of the
request from software to change the
DPA substate. In response, the client
must read the Substate Control field
from this register to determine the
new substate, and perform the
actions necessary to effect the
substate change. On completion of
the substate change, the client must
update the Substate Status field to
reflect the new substate the function
is  in.

bit_ranges.name: R5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R5]
Reserved

name: DYNAMIC_POWER_ALLOCATION_ARRAY_0
description:
Dynamic Power Allocation Array Register 0
This field contains the power
allocation for the DPA substate #3
covered by this register. This value,
when multiplied by the Power
Allocation Scale programmed in the
DPA Capability Register, provides the
power associated with the
corresponding substate in  Watts.

bit_ranges.name: SPA0_0
bit_ranges.description:

allocation for the DPA substate #0
covered by this register. This value,

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: SR_IOV_EXTENDED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
SR-IOV Extended Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PECID
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PECID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI-SIG to
the SR-IOV Extended Capability
Structure (0010  hex).

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG-assigned value for
the version of the capability
structure. This field is set by default
to 1, but can be modified
independently for each Function
from the local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: SR_IOV_CAPABILITIES
description:
SR-IOV Capabilities Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: VFMC
bit_ranges.description:
VF Migration Capable [VFMC]
Set when the core supports VF
migration. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: ACHP
bit_ranges.description:
ARI Capable Hierarchy Preserved [ACHP]
A 1 in this bit position indicates that
the ARI Capable Hierarchy bit in the
SR-IOV Control Register is preserved
across certain power state
transitions (see the PCI-SIG Single
Root IO Virtualization and Sharing
Specifications, Version 1.1, Section
3.3.3.5 for details). This bit is set to
1 by default, but can be modified
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

name: SR_IOV_CONTROL_AND_STATUS_S
description:
SR-IOV Control and Status Registers
Not implemented.

bit_ranges.name: VFE
bit_ranges.description:
VF Enable [VFE]
This bit must be set to enable the
VFs associated with this PF.

bit_ranges.name: VFME
bit_ranges.description:
VF Migration Enable [VFME]
Not supported. Hardwired to  0

bit_ranges.name: VFMIE
bit_ranges.description:
VF Migration Interrupt Enable [VFMIE]
Not supported. Hardwired to  0

bit_ranges.name: VFMSE
bit_ranges.description:
VF Memory Space Enable [VFMSE]
This bit must be set to allow access
to the memory space of the VFs
associated with this  PF.

bit_ranges.name: ARIE
bit_ranges.description:
ARI Capable Hierarchy [ARIE]
This bit enables the ARI mode for
Virtual Functions. This bit must be
set when VF Enable is set. Valid only
for PF0

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SSR
bit_ranges.description:
SRIOV Status Register [SSR]
Not implemented.

name: INITIAL_VFS/TOTAL_VFS
description:
Initial VFs/Total VFs Register
This field contains the total number
of VFs per PF. Its default setting is
identical to that of InitialVFs. This
field can be modified using local
management registers.

bit_ranges.name: IVF
bit_ranges.description:
Initial VFs [IVF]
This field contains the initial number
of VFs configured for each PF. This
field can be modified using local
management registers.

bit_ranges.name: TVF
bit_ranges.description:
Total VFs [TVF]
This field contains the total number
of VFs per PF. Its default setting is
identical to that of InitialVFs. This
field can be modified using local
management registers.

name: FUNCTION_DEPENDENCY_LINK/NUMVFS
description:
Function Dependency Link/NumVFs Register
This field is used to specify
dependencies between PFs. It can be
modified independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: NVF
bit_ranges.description:
NumVFs [NVF]
This field must be set by the
software to the number of VFs that it
wants to enable for each PF. This
field can be changed only when the
VF Enable bit in the SR-IOV Control
Register is 0. Its value should not
exceed the setting of TotalVFs for
the corresponding Physical Function.
This field can also be written from
the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: FDL
bit_ranges.description:
Function Dependency Link [FDL]
This field is used to specify
dependencies between PFs. It can be
modified independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

name: VF_OFFSET/STRIDE
description:
VF Offset/Stride Register
Stride value used to assign RIDs for
VFs. The stride value is hardwired to
1 for all Physical Functions.

bit_ranges.name: FVFO
bit_ranges.description:
First VF Offset [FVFO]
Offset of First VF relative to its PF.
This field can be re-written
independently for each PF from the
local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: VFS
bit_ranges.description:
VF Stride [VFS]
Stride value used to assign RIDs for
VFs. The stride value is hardwired to
1 for all Physical Functions.

name: VF_DEVICE_ID
description:
VF Device ID Register
VF device id assigned to the device.
Its default value is specified in
reg_defaults.h, but can be re-
written independently for each PF
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: VFDI
bit_ranges.description:
VF Device ID [VFDI]
VF device id assigned to the device.
Its default value is specified in
reg_defaults.h, but can be re-
written independently for each PF
from the local management bus.

name: SUPPORTED_PAGE_SIZES
description:
Supported Page Sizes Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PS
bit_ranges.description:
Page Sizes [PS]
Page sizes supported by the device
(one bit for each page size). The
core implements only bits 15:0 of
this register. The default value of this
field is specified in reg_defaults.h,
but can be re- written independently
for each PF from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

name: SYSTEM_PAGE_SIZE
description:
System Page Size Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SPS
bit_ranges.description:
System Page Size [SPS]
This field must be programmed by
software to the current page size in
use. The core implements only bits
15:0 of this register. This field can
also be written from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

name: VF_BASE_ADDRESS_0
description:
VF Base Address Register 0
This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated Physical
Function.

bit_ranges.name: MSI
bit_ranges.description:
Memory Space Indicator [MSI]
Specifies whether this BAR defines a
memory address range or an I/O
address range (0 = memory, 1 =
I/O). The value read in this field is
determined by the setting of BAR
Configuration Registers of the
associated Physical  Function

bit_ranges.name: R7
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R7]
This bit is hardwired to 0 for both
memory and I/O BARs.

bit_ranges.name: S0
bit_ranges.description:
Size [S0]
When the BAR is used to define a
memory address range, this field
indicates whether the address
range is 32-bit or 64-bit (0 = 32-
bit, 1 = 64 bit).
For 64-bit address ranges, the value
in BAR 1 is treated as a continuation
of the base address in BAR 0. The
value read in this field is determined
by the setting of BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated Physical
Function.

bit_ranges.name: P0
bit_ranges.description:
Prefetchability [P0]
When the BAR is used to define a
memory address range, this field
declares whether data from the
address range is prefetchable (0 =
non- prefetchable, 1 =
prefetchable). The value read in this
field is determined by the setting of
BAR
Configuration Registers of the
associated Physical Function

bit_ranges.name: R8
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R8]
These bits are hardwired to  0

bit_ranges.name: BAMR0
bit_ranges.description:
Base Address - RO part [BAMR0]
This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated Physical
Function. All other bits are not
writeable, and are read as 0's.

bit_ranges.name: BAMRW
bit_ranges.description:

This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in BAR Configuration
Registers of the associated Physical
Function.

name: TPH_REQUESTER_EXTENDED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
TPH Requester Extended Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PECID
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PECID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to
the TPH Requester Capability.

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG assigned value for
the version of the capability
structure. This field is set by default
to 1, but can be modified
independently for each  PF from the
local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: TPH_REQUESTER_CAPABILITY
description:
TPH Requester Capability Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: NSM
bit_ranges.description:
No ST Mode Supported [NSM]
When set to 1, indicates that this
Function supports the 'No ST Mode'
for the generation of TPH Steering
Tags. In the No ST Mode, the device
must use a Steering Tag value of 0
for all requests. This bit is hardwired
to 1, as all TPH Requesters are
required to support the No ST Mode
of  operation.

bit_ranges.name: IVMS
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Vector Mode Supported [IVMS]
A setting of 1 indicates that the
Function supports the Interrupt
Vector Mode for TPH Steering Tag
generation. In the Interrupt Vector
Mode, Steering Tags are attached to
MSI/MSI-X interrupt requests. The
Steering Tag for each interrupt
request is selected by the MSI/MSI-X
interrupt vector number. This bit is
set to 1 by default, but can be
modified from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: DSMS
bit_ranges.description:
Device- Specific Mode Supported [DSMS]
A setting of 1 indicates that the
Function supports the Device-
Specific Mode for TPH Steering Tag
generation. In this mode, the
Steering Tags are supplied by the
client for each request through the
HAL master interface. The client
typically chooses the Steering Tag
values from the ST Table, but is not
required to do so. This bit is set to 1
by default, but can be modified from
the local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ERS
bit_ranges.description:
Extended TPH Requester Supported [ERS]
When set to 1, indicates that the
Function is capable of generating
requests with a TPH TLP Prefix.

bit_ranges.name: STL
bit_ranges.description:
ST Table Location [STL]
The setting of this field indicates if a
Steering Tag Table is implemented
for this Function, and its location if
present. (00 = ST Table not present,
01 = ST Table in the TPH Requester
Capability Structure, 10 = ST values
stored in the MSI-X Table in client
RAM, 11 = reserved.). This field can
be modified from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: STS
bit_ranges.description:
ST Table Size [STS]
Specifies the number of entries in
the Steering Tag Table (0 = 1 entry,
1 = 2 entries, and so on). Max limit
is 64 entries when the ST Table is
located in the TPH Requester
Capability Structure, and 2048
entries when located in the MSI-X
table. Each entry is 16 bits long. This
field can be modified from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

name: TPH_REQUESTER_CONTROL
description:
TPH Requester Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CSM
bit_ranges.description:
ST Mode [CSM]
This field selects the ST mode (000
= No Steering Tag Mode, 001 =
Interrupt Vector Mode, 010 =
Device-Specific Mode, other values
are reserved). The TPH_ST_MODE
output of the core reflects the
setting of this register field. This field
can also be written from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
RSVD
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: CRE
bit_ranges.description:
TPH Requester Enable [CRE]
When set the Function is allowed to
generate requests with Transaction
Processing Hints. Defined Encodings
are: 00b - Function operating as a
Requester is not permitted to issue
Requests with TPH or Extended TPH.
01b - Function operating as a
Requester is permitted to issue
Requests with TPH and is not
permitted to issue Requests with
Extended TPH. 10b - Reserved.  11b
- Function operating as a Requester
is permitted to issue Requests with
TPH and Extended  TPH.

bit_ranges.name: R10
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R10]
Reserved

name: VENDOR_ID_AND_DEVICE_ID
description:
Vendor ID and Device ID
Device ID assigned by the
manufacturer of the device. On
power-up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be
written independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: VID
bit_ranges.description:
Vendor ID [VID]
This is the Vendor ID assigned by
the PCI SIG   to the manufacturer
of the device The Vendor ID is set in
the Vendor ID Register within the
local management  register block.

bit_ranges.name: DID
bit_ranges.description:
Device ID [DID]
Device ID assigned by the
manufacturer of the device. On
power-up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be
written independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

name: COMMAND_AND_STATUS
description:
Command and Status Register
This bit is set when the core has
received a Poisoned TLP targeted at
this VF. The Parity Error Response
enable bit (bit 6) in the PCI
Command Register of the associated
PF has no effect on the setting of
this bit.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: IOSE
bit_ranges.description:
IO-Space Enable [IOSE]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MSE
bit_ranges.description:
Mem- Space Enable [MSE]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BME
bit_ranges.description:
Bus-Master Enable [BME]
Enables the device to issue memory
requests from this Function. This
field can be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PERE
bit_ranges.description:
Parity Error Response Enable [PERE]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SE
bit_ranges.description:
SERR Enable [SE]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IMD
bit_ranges.description:
INTx Message Disable [IMD]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IS
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Status [IS]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CL
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities List [CL]
Indicates the presence of PCI
Extended Capabilities registers. This
bit is hardwired to  1.

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MDPE
bit_ranges.description:
Master Data Parity Error [MDPE]
When the Parity Error Response
enable bit in the PCI Command
Register of the associated Physical
Function is set, the core sets this bit
when it detects the following error
conditions: (i) The core receives a
Poisoned Completion TLP from the
link in response to a request from
this VF. (ii)The core sends out a
poisoned write request on the link
from this VF. (This bit remains 0
when the Parity Error Response
enable bit in the PCI Command
Register of the associated Physical
Function is 0). This field can also be
cleared from the local management
bus by writing a 1 into this bit
position. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R5]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: STA
bit_ranges.description:
Signaled Target Abort [STA]
This bit is set when the core has sent
a completion from this VF to the link
with the Completer Abort status.
This field can also be cleared from
the   local management bus by
writing a 1 into this bit position.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: RTA
bit_ranges.description:
Received Target Abort [RTA]
This bit is set when this Virtual
Function has received a completion
from the link with the Completer
Abort status. This field can also be
cleared from the local management
bus by writing a 1 into this bit
position.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: RMA
bit_ranges.description:
Received Master Abort [RMA]
This bit is set when this VF has
received a completion from the link
with the Unsupported Request
status. This field can also be cleared
from the local management bus by
writing a 1 into this bit position.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: SSE
bit_ranges.description:
Signaled System Error [SSE]
If the SERR enable bit in the PCI
Command Register of the associated
Physical Function is 1, this bit is set
when this VF has sent out a fatal or
non-fatal error message on the link
to the Root Complex. If the SERR
enable bit is 0, this bit remains 0.
This field can also be cleared from
the local management bus by writing
a 1 into this bit position. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: DPE
bit_ranges.description:
Detected Parity Error [DPE]
This bit is set when the core has
received a Poisoned TLP targeted at
this VF. The Parity Error Response
enable bit (bit 6) in the PCI
Command Register of the associated
PF has no effect on the setting of
this bit.  STICKY.

name: REVISION_ID_AND_CLASS_CODE
description:
Revision ID and Class Code Register
Identifies the function of the device.
This field reflects the setting of the
corresponding register in the
configuration space of the
associated Physical Function.

bit_ranges.name: RID
bit_ranges.description:
Revision ID [RID]
Assigned by the manufacturer of the
device to identify the revision RO
Setting of this field Denali PCIe Core
Register Specification, PMC-Sierra
Version 3.4 202 number of the
device. This field reflects the setting
of the corresponding register in the
configuration space of the
associated Physical Function.

bit_ranges.name: PIB
bit_ranges.description:
Programming Interface Byte [PIB]
Identifies the register set layout of
the device. This field reflects the
setting of the corresponding register
in the configuration space of the
associated Physical Function.

bit_ranges.name: SCC
bit_ranges.description:
Sub-Class Code [SCC]
Identifies a sub-category within the
selected function. This field reflects
the setting of the corresponding
register in the configuration space of
the associated Physical  Function.

bit_ranges.name: CC
bit_ranges.description:
Class Code [CC]
Identifies the function of the device.
This field reflects the setting of the
corresponding register in the
configuration space of the
associated Physical Function.

name: BIST,_HEADER_TYPE,_LATENCY_TIMER_AND_CACHE_LINE_SIZE_S
description:
BIST, Header Type, Latency Timer and Cache Line Size Registers
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CLS
bit_ranges.description:
Cache Line Size [CLS]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LT
bit_ranges.description:
Latency Timer [LT]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: HT

Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DT
bit_ranges.description:
Device Type [DT]
Identifies whether the device
supports a single Function or
multiple Functions. This bit is read as
0 when only Function 0 has been
enabled in the Physical Function
Configuration Register (in the local
management block). Reserved for
VFs

bit_ranges.name: BR
bit_ranges.description:
BIST Register [BR]
Reserved

name: SUBSYSTEM_VENDOR_ID_AND_SUBSYSTEM_ID
description:
Subsystem Vendor ID and Subsystem ID Register
Specifies the Subsystem ID assigned
by the manufacturer of the device.
This field reflects the setting of the
corresponding register in the
configuration space of the associated
Physical Function.

bit_ranges.name: SVID
bit_ranges.description:
Subsystem Vendor ID [SVID]
Specifies the Subsystem Vendor ID
assigned by the PCI SIG to the
manufacturer of the device.  Its
value comes from the Subsystem
Vendor ID Register in the local
management register  block.

bit_ranges.name: SID
bit_ranges.description:
Subsystem ID [SID]
Specifies the Subsystem ID assigned
by the manufacturer of the device.
This field reflects the setting of the
corresponding register in the
configuration space of the associated
Physical Function.

description:
Capabilities Pointer

Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Contains pointer to the first PCI
Capability Structure. This field is set
by default to point to the Power
Management Capability Structure. It
can be modified by writing to VF 0
from the local management bus, and
the setting is common across all VFs.

bit_ranges.name: R6
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R6]

name: POWER_MANAGEMENT_CAPABILITIES
description:
Power Management Capabilities Register
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D3cold state. Because
the device does not have aux power,
this bit is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Identifies that the capability
structure is for Power Management.
This field is set by default to 01 hex.
It can be re-written independently
for each Function from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: CP
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Contains pointer to the next PCI
Capability Structure. The core sets it
to the value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. By default, this
points to the MSI Capability
Structure. This field can be re-
written independently for each
Function from  the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: VID
bit_ranges.description:
Version ID [VID]
Indicates the version of the PCI Bus
Power Management Specifications
that the Function implements. This
field is set by default to 011 (Version
1.2). It can be re-written
independently  for each Function
from the local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: PC
bit_ranges.description:
PME Clock [PC]
Not applicable to PCI Express. This
bit is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DSI
bit_ranges.description:
Device Specific Initialization Bit [DSI]
This bit, when set, indicates that the
device   requires additional
configuration steps beyond setting
up its PCI configuration space, to
bring it to the D0active state from
the D0uninitialized state. This bit is
hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: MCRAPS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Current Required from Aux Power Supply [MCRAPS]
Specifies the maximum current
drawn by the device from the aux
power source in the D3cold state.
This field is not implemented in
devices not supporting PME
notification when in the D3cold
state, and is therefore hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: D1S
bit_ranges.description:
D1 Support [D1S]
Set if the Function supports the D1
power state. This bit can be modified
from the local management bus by
writing into Function 0. All other
Functions assume the value set in
Function 0s Power Management
Capabilities Register.

bit_ranges.name: D2S
bit_ranges.description:
D2 Support [D2S]
Set if the Function supports the D2
power state. Currently hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: PSD0S
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D0 State [PSD0S]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D0 state.  This bit is set
to 1 by default, but can be modified
from the local management bus by
writing into Function 0. All other
Functions assume the value set in
Function 0s Power Management
Capabilities Register.

bit_ranges.name: PSD1S
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D1 State [PSD1S]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D1 state.  This bit is set
to 1 by default, but can be modified
from the local management bus by
writing into Function 0. All other
Functions assume the value set in
Function 0s Power Management
Capabilities Register.

bit_ranges.name: PSD2S
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D2 State [PSD2S]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D2 state.  This bit is
hardwired to 0 because D2 state is
not supported.

bit_ranges.name: PSDHS
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D3(hot) State [PSDHS]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D3hot state. This bit is
set to 1 by default, but can be
modified from the local management
bus by writing into Function 0. All
other Functions assume the value
set in Function 0s Power
Management Capabilities Register.

bit_ranges.name: PSDCS
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D3(cold) State [PSDCS]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D3cold state. Because
the device does not have aux power,
this bit is hardwired to 0.

name: POWER_MANAGEMENT_CONTROL/STATUS_REPORT
description:
Power Management Control/Status Report
This optional register is not
implemented in the PCIe core. This
field is hardwired to  0.

bit_ranges.name: PS
bit_ranges.description:
Power State [PS]
Indicates the power state this
Function is currently in. This field
can be read by the software to
monitor the current power state, or
can be written to cause a transition
to a new state. The valid settings are
00 (state D0), 01 (state D1) and 11
(state D3hot). The software should
not write any other value into this
field. This field can also be written
from the local management bus
independently for each VF  Function.

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: NSR
bit_ranges.description:
No Soft Reset [NSR]
When this bit is set to 1, the
Function will maintain all its state in
the PM state D3hot. The software is
not required to re-initialize the
Function registers on the transition
back to D0. This bit is set to 1 by
default, but can be modified
independently for each VF from the
local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PE
bit_ranges.description:
PME Enable [PE]
Setting this bit enables the
notification of PME events from the
associated Function. This bit can be
set also by writing into this register
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PMES
bit_ranges.description:
PME Status [PMES]
When PME notification is enabled,
writing a 1 into this bit position from
the local management bus sets this
bit and causes the core to send a
PME message from the associated
Function. When the Root Complex
processes this message, it will turn
off this bit by writing a 1 into this bit
position though a Config Write. This
bit can be set or cleared from the
local management bus, by writing a
1 or 0, respectively. It can only be
cleared from the configuration path
(by writing a 1).

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DR
bit_ranges.description:
Data Register [DR]
This optional register is not
implemented in the PCIe core. This
field is hardwired to  0.

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: MSI_CONTROL
description:
MSI Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Specifies that the capability structure is
for MSI. Hardwired to 05 hex.

bit_ranges.name: CP
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Pointer to the next PCI Capability
Structure.   The value read from this
read-only field is the corresponding
pointer in the MSI Capability Structure of
the Physical Function this VF is attached
to. The setting is common across all the
Virtual Functions.

bit_ranges.name: ME
bit_ranges.description:
MSI Enable [ME]
Set by the configuration program to
enable the   MSI feature. This field can
also be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: MMC
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Message Capable [MMC]
Encodes the number of distinct messages
that the core is capable of generating for
this Function (000 = 1, 001 = 2, 010 = 4,
011 = 8, 100 = 16, 101= 32). Thus, this
field defines the number of the interrupt
vectors for this Function. The core allows
up to 32 distinct messages, but the
setting of this field must be based on the
number of interrupt inputs of the core
that are actually used by the client. For
example, if the client logic uses 8 of the
32 distinct MSI interrupt inputs of the
core for this Function, then the value of
this field must be set to 011. This field
can be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: MME
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Message Enable [MME]
Encodes the number of distinct messages
that the core is programmed to generate
for this Function (000 = 1, 001 = 2, 010
= 4, 011 = 8, 100 = 16, 101= 32). This
setting must be based on the number of
interrupt inputs of the core that are
actually used

bit_ranges.name: AC64
bit_ranges.description:
64-Bit Address Capable [AC64]
Set to 1 to indicate that the device is
capable of generating 64-bit addresses
for MSI  messages.

bit_ranges.name: MC
bit_ranges.description:
MSI masking capable [MC]
can be modified using localmanagement interface

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

name: MSI_MESSAGE_LOW_ADDRESS
description:
MSI Message Low Address Register
Lower bits of the address to be used
in MSI messages. This field can also
be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
The two lower bits of the address are
hardwired to 0 to align the address
on a double-word  boundary.

bit_ranges.name: MAL
bit_ranges.description:
Message Address Low [MAL]
Lower bits of the address to be used
in MSI messages. This field can also
be written from the local
management bus.

name: MSI_MESSAGE_HIGH_ADDRESS
description:
MSI Message High Address Register
Contains bits 63:32 of the 64-bit
address to be used in MSI Messages.
A value of 0 specifies that 32-bit
addresses are to be used in the
messages. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: MAH
bit_ranges.description:
Message Address High [MAH]
Contains bits 63:32 of the 64-bit
address to be used in MSI Messages.
A value of 0 specifies that 32-bit
addresses are to be used in the
messages. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

name: MSI_MESSAGE_DATA
description:
MSI Message Data Register
Hardwired to 0

bit_ranges.name: MD
bit_ranges.description:
Message Data [MD]
Message data to be used for this
Function. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Hardwired to 0

name: MSI_MASK
description:
MSI Mask Register
Please note that if the Multiple
Message Capable field is changed
from the local management APB bus,
then the width of this field also
changes correspondingly

bit_ranges.name: MM
bit_ranges.description:
MSI Mask [MM]
Mask bits for MSI interrupts. The
Multiple Message Capable field of the
MSI Control Register specifies the
number of distinct interrupts for the
Function, which determines the
number of valid mask bits. Please
note that if the Multiple Message
Capable field is changed from the
local management APB bus, then the
width of the MSI Mask field also
changes  correspondingly

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Please note that if the Multiple
Message Capable field is changed
from the local management APB bus,
then the width of this field also
changes correspondingly

name: MSI_PENDING_BITS
description:
MSI Pending Bits Register
Please note that if the Multiple
Message Capable field is changed
from the local management APB bus,
then the width of this field also
changes correspondingly

bit_ranges.name: MP
bit_ranges.description:
MSI Pending Bits [MP]
Pending bits for MSI interrupts. This
register contains the MSI pending
interrupt bits, one for each of the
interrupt levels. This field can be
written from the local management
APB bus. The Multiple Message
Capable field of the MSI Control
Register specifies the number of
distinct interrupts for the Function,
which determines the number of
valid pending bits. Please note that if
the Multiple Message Capable field is
changed from the local management
APB bus, then the width of the MSI
Pending Bits field also changes
correspondingly

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Please note that if the Multiple
Message Capable field is changed
from the local management APB bus,
then the width of this field also
changes correspondingly

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: MSI_X_CONTROL
description:
MSI-X Control Register
Set by the configuration program to
enable the MSI-X feature. This field
can also be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Identifies that the capability
structure is for MSI-X. This field is
set by default to 11 hex. It can be
rewritten independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: CP
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Contains a pointer to the next PCI
Capability Structure. The value read
from this read-only  field is the
corresponding pointer in the MSI-X
Capability Structure of the Physical
Function this VF is attached to.

bit_ranges.name: MSIXTS
bit_ranges.description:
MSI-X Table Size [MSIXTS]
Specifies the size of the MSI-X Table,
that is, the number of interrupt
vectors defined for the Function. The
programmed value is 1 minus the
size of the table (that is, this field is
set to 0 if the table size is 1.). It can
be re-written independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: FM
bit_ranges.description:
Function Mask [FM]
This bit serves as a global mask to
all the interrupt conditions
associated with this Function. When
this bit is set, the core will not send
out MSI messages from this
Function. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: MSIXE
bit_ranges.description:
MSI-X Enable [MSIXE]
Set by the configuration program to
enable the MSI-X feature. This field
can also be written from the local
management bus.

name: MSI_X_TABLE_OFFSET
description:
MSI-X Table Offset Register
Offset of the memory address where
the MSI-   X Table is located,
relative to the selected BAR. The
three least significant bits of the
address are omitted, as the
addresses are QWORD  aligned.

bit_ranges.name: BARI
bit_ranges.description:
BAR Indicator Register [BARI]
Identifies the BAR corresponding to
the memory address range where
the MSI-X Table is located (000 =
BAR 0, 001 = BAR 1, ... , 101 = BAR
5).

bit_ranges.name: TO
bit_ranges.description:
Table Offset [TO]
Offset of the memory address where
the MSI-   X Table is located,
relative to the selected BAR. The
three least significant bits of the
address are omitted, as the
addresses are QWORD  aligned.

name: MSI_X_PENDING_INTERRUPT
description:
MSI-X Pending Interrupt Register
Offset of the memory address where
the PBA is located, relative to the
selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD  aligned.

bit_ranges.name: BARI
bit_ranges.description:
BAR Indicator Register [BARI]
Identifies the BAR corresponding to
the memory address range where
the PBA Structure is located (000 =
BAR 0, 001 = BAR 1, ... , 101 = BAR
5).
The value programmed must be the
same as the BAR Indicator
configured in the MSI-X TableOffset
Register.Identifies the BAR
corresponding to the memory
address range where the PBA
Structure is located (000 = BAR 0,
001 =  BAR1, ... , 101 = BAR 5).
The value programmed must be the
same as the BAR Indicator
configured in the MSI-X Table Offset
Register.

bit_ranges.name: PO
bit_ranges.description:
PBA Offset [PO]
Offset of the memory address where
the PBA is located, relative to the
selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD  aligned.

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_CAPABILITY_LIST
description:
PCI Express Capability List Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Specifies Capability ID assigned by
PCI SIG for this structure. This field
is hardwired to 10  hex.

bit_ranges.name: NCP
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Pointer [NCP]
Points to the next PCI capability
structure. Set to 0 because this is
the last capability  structure.

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Identifies the version number of the
capability structure. The value
depends on the value of  the strap
input PCIE_GENERATION_SEL If
PCIE_GENERATION_SEL indicates
Gen 2 or later generations, then the
value is 2 else 1.

bit_ranges.name: DT
bit_ranges.description:
Device Type [DT]
Indicates the type of device
implementing this Function. This
field is hardwired to 0 in the EP
mode.

bit_ranges.name: SS
bit_ranges.description:
Slot Status [SS]
Set to 1 when the link connected to
a slot. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: IMN
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Message Number [IMN]
Identifies the MSI or MSI-X interrupt
vector for the interrupt message
generated corresponding to the
status bits in the Slot Status
Register, Root Status Register, or this
capability structure. This field must
be defined based on the chosen
interrupt mode - MSI or MSI-X. This
field is hardwired to  0.

bit_ranges.name: TRS
bit_ranges.description:
TCS Routing Supported [TRS]
When set to 1, this bit indicates that
the device supports routing of
Trusted Configuration Requests. Not
valid for Endpoints. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CAPABILITIES
description:
PCI Express Device Capabilities Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MPS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Payload Size [MPS]
Specifies maximum payload size
supported by the device. This field
reflects the setting of the
corresponding field in the PCIe
Device Capability Register of PF 0

bit_ranges.name: PFS
bit_ranges.description:
Phantom Functions Supported [PFS]
This field is used to extend the tag
field by combining unused Function
bits with the tag bits. This field is
hardwired to 00 to disable this
feature.

bit_ranges.name: ETFS
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Tag Field Supported [ETFS]
Set when device allows the tag field
to be extended from 5 to 8 bits. This
field reflects the setting of the
corresponding field in the PCIe
Device Capability Register of PF  0.

bit_ranges.name: AL0SL
bit_ranges.description:
Acceptable L0S Latency [AL0SL]
Specifies acceptable latency that the
Endpoint can tolerate while
transitioning from L0S to L0. This
field reflects the setting of the
corresponding field in the PCIe
Device Capability Register of PF  0.

bit_ranges.name: AL1SL
bit_ranges.description:
Acceptable L1 Latency [AL1SL]
Specifies acceptable latency that the
Endpoint can tolerate while
transitioning from L1 to L0. This field
reflects the setting of the
corresponding field in the PCIe
Device Capability Register of PF  0.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RBER
bit_ranges.description:
Role- Based Error Reporting [RBER]
This field reflects the setting of the
corresponding field in the PCIe
Device Capability Register of PF 0.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CSPLV
bit_ranges.description:
Captured Slot Power Limit Value [CSPLV]
This field reflects the setting of the
corresponding field in the PCIe
Device Capability Register of PF 0.

bit_ranges.name: CPLS
bit_ranges.description:
Captured Power Limit Scale [CPLS]
This field reflects the setting of the
corresponding field in the PCIe
Device Capability Register of PF 0.

bit_ranges.name: FLRC
bit_ranges.description:
FLR Capable [FLRC]
Set when device has Function-Level
Reset capability. Hardwired to 1.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CONTROL_AND_STATUS
description:
PCI Express Device Control and Status Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ECER
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Correctable Error Reporting [ECER]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ENFER
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Non- Fatal Error Reporting [ENFER]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: EFER
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Fatal Error Reporting [EFER]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: EURR
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Unsupported Request Reporting [EURR]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ERO
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Relaxed Ordering [ERO]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MPS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Payload Size [MPS]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ETFE
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Tag Field Enable [ETFE]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: EPF
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Phantom Functions [EPF]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: EAP
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Aux Power [EAP]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: EBS
bit_ranges.description:
Enable No Snoop [EBS]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MRRS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Read Request Size [MRRS]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: FLR
bit_ranges.description:
Function- Level Reset [FLR]
Writing a 1 into this bit position
generated a Function-Level Reset
for the selected VF. This bit reads as
0.

bit_ranges.name: CED
bit_ranges.description:
Correctable Error Detected [CED]
Set to 1 by the core when it detects
a correctable error, regardless of
whether error reporting is enabled
or not, and regardless of whether
the error is masked

bit_ranges.name: NFER
bit_ranges.description:
Non-Fatal Error Detected [NFER]
Set to 1 by the core when it detects
a non-fatal error, regardless of
whether error reporting is enabled
or not, and regardless of whether
the error is masked.

bit_ranges.name: FED
bit_ranges.description:
Fatal Error Detected [FED]
Set to 1 by the core when it detects
a fatal error, regardless of whether
error reporting is enabled or not,
and regardless of whether the error
is  masked.

bit_ranges.name: URD
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Request Detected [URD]
Set to 1 by the core when it
receives an unsupported request,
regardless of whether its reporting
is enabled or  not.

bit_ranges.name: APD
bit_ranges.description:
Aux Power Detected [APD]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: TP
bit_ranges.description:
Transaction Pending [TP]
Indicates if any of the Non-Posted
requests issued by the VF are still
pending.

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

name: LINK_CAPABILITIES
description:
Link Capabilities Register
Specifies the port number assigned
to the PCI Express link connected to
this  device.

bit_ranges.name: MLS
bit_ranges.description:
Maximum Link Speed [MLS]
Indicates the maximum speed
supported by the link. (2.5 GT/s, 5
GT/s per lane). This field is
hardwired to 0001 (2.5GT/s) when
the strap input
PCIE_GENERATION_SEL is set to 0,
to 0010 (5GT/s) when the strap is
set to 1.

bit_ranges.name: MLW
bit_ranges.description:
Maximum Link Width [MLW]
Indicates the maximum number of
lanes supported by the device. This
field is hardwired based on the
setting of the LANE_COUNT_IN strap
input.

bit_ranges.name: ASPM
bit_ranges.description:
Active State Power Management [ASPM]
Indicates the level of ASPM support
provided by the device. This field
can be re-written independently for
each Function from the local
management bus. When SRIS is
enabled in local management
register bit, L0s capability is not
supported and is forced low.

bit_ranges.name: L0SEL
bit_ranges.description:
L0S Exit Latency [L0SEL]
Specifies the time required for the
device to transition from L0S to L0.
This parameter is dependent on the
Physical Layer implementation. It is
set by default to the value define in
reg_defaults.h. It can be re-written
independently for each Function
from the local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: L1EL
bit_ranges.description:
L1 Exit Latency [L1EL]
Specifies the exit latency from L1
state. This parameter is dependent
on the Physical Layer
implementation. It is set by default
to the value define in
reg_defaults.h. It can be re-written
independently for each Function
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: CPM
bit_ranges.description:
Clock Power Management [CPM]
Indicates that the device supports
removal of referenc clocks. It is set
by default to the value of the define
in reg_defaults.h. It can be re-
written independently for each
function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: SDERC
bit_ranges.description:
Surprise Down Error Reporting Capability [SDERC]
Indicates the capability of the device
to report a Surprise Down error
condition. This bit is hardwired to 0,
as this version of the core does not
support the feature.

bit_ranges.name: DLLARC
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Layer Active Reporting Capability [DLLARC]
Set to 1 if the device is capable of
reporting that the DL Control and
Management State Machine has
reached the DL Active state. This bit
is hardwired to 0, as this version of
the core does not support the
feature.

bit_ranges.name: LBNC
bit_ranges.description:
Link Bandwidth Notification Capability [LBNC]
A value of 1b indicates support for
the Link Bandwidth Notification
status and interrupt mechanisms.
Reserved for  Endpoint.

bit_ranges.name: AOC
bit_ranges.description:
ASPM Optionality Compliance [AOC]
Setting this bit indicates that the
device supports the ASPM
Optionality feature. It can be turned
off by writing a 0 to this bit position
through the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R5]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PN
bit_ranges.description:
Port Number [PN]
Specifies the port number assigned
to the PCI Express link connected to
this  device.

name: RESERVE
description:
Reserve
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_2
description:
PCI Express Device Capabilities Register 2
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CTR
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Ranges [CTR]
Specifies the Completion Timeout
values supported by the device. This
field is set by default to 0010 (10
ms - 250 ms). The actual timeout
values are in two programmable
local management registers, which
allow the timeout settings of the two
sub-ranges within Range B to be
programmed independently.

bit_ranges.name: CTDS
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Disable Supported [CTDS]
A 1 in this field indicates that the
associated Function supports the
capability to turn off its Completion
timeout. This bit is set to 1 by
default, but can be re-written
independently for each Function
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: AFS
bit_ranges.description:
ARI forwarding support [AFS]
ARI  forwarding supported.

bit_ranges.name: OPRS
bit_ranges.description:
OP routing supported [OPRS]
Atomic OP routing  supported.

bit_ranges.name: BAOCS32
bit_ranges.description:
32-Bit Atomic Op Completer Supported [BAOCS32]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: BAOCS64
bit_ranges.description:
64-Bit Atomic Op Completer Supported [BAOCS64]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: BAOCS128
bit_ranges.description:
128-Bit CAS Atomic Op Completer Supported [BAOCS128]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R12
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R12]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LMS
bit_ranges.description:
LTR Mechanism Supported [LMS]
A 1 in this bit position indicates that
the Function supports the Latency
Tolerance Reporting (LTR) Capability.
This bit is set to 1 by default, but
can be turned off for all Physical
Functions by writing into PF 0.

bit_ranges.name: TCS
bit_ranges.description:
TPH Completer Supported [TCS]
These bits, when set, indicate that
the Function is capable of serving as
a completer for requests with
Transaction Processing Hints (TPH).
It can be turned off for all Physical
Functions by writing into PF 0.
Defined Encodings are: 00b TPH and
Extended TPH Completer not
supported. 01b TPH Completer
supported; Extended TPH Completer
not supported. 10b Reserved. 11b
Both TPH and Extended TPH
Completer supported.

bit_ranges.name: R13
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R13]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: OPFFS
bit_ranges.description:
OBFF Supported [OPFFS]
A 1 in this bit position indicates that
the Function supports the Optimized
Buffer Flush/Fill (OBFF) capability
using message signaling.

bit_ranges.name: EXFS
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Format Field Supported [EXFS]
Indicates that the Function supports
the 3-bit definition of the Fmt field
in the TLP header. This bit is
hardwired to 1 for all Physical
Functions.

bit_ranges.name: EEPS
bit_ranges.description:
End-End TLP Prefix Supported [EEPS]
Indicates whether the Function
supports End-End TLP Prefixes. A 1
in this field indicates that the
Function supports receiving TLPs
containing End- End TLP Prefixes.

bit_ranges.name: MEEP
bit_ranges.description:
Max End- End TLP Prefixes [MEEP]
Indicates the maximum number of
End-End TLP Prefixes supported by
the Function. The supported values
are: 01b 1 End-End TLP Prefix 10b 2
End- End TLP Prefixes

bit_ranges.name: R14
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R14]
Reserved

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: ADVANCED_ERROR_REPORTING_(AER)_ENHANCED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
Advanced Error Reporting (AER) Enhanced Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PECID
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PECID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to
the PCI Express AER Extended
Capability Structure (0001  hex).

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG assigned value for
the version of the capability
structure. This field reflects the
setting of the corresponding field in
the AER Enhanced Capability Header
Register of PF  0.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_STATUS
description:
Uncorrectable Error Status Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DLPER
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Protocol Error Status [DLPER]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PTS
bit_ranges.description:
Poisoned TLP Status [PTS]
This bit is set when the core
receives a poisoned TLP from the
link, targeted at this VF. This
error is Function-specific. This
error is considered non- fatal by
default. The error is reported by
sending an ERR_NONFATAL
message. The header of the
received TLP with error is logged
in the Header Log Registers
associated with the VF.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: FCPES
bit_ranges.description:
Flow Control Protocol Error Status [FCPES]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: CTS
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Status [CTS]
This bit is set when the
completion timer associated with
an outstanding request times
out. This error is Function-
specific. This error is considered
non-fatal by default. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CAS
bit_ranges.description:
Completer Abort Status [CAS]
This bit is set when the core has
returned the Completer Abort
(CA) status to a request received
from the link. This error is
Function-specific. The header of
the received request that caused
the error is logged in the Header
Log Registers. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: UCS
bit_ranges.description:
Unexpected Completion Status [UCS]
This bit is set when the core has
received an unexpected
Completion packet from the link.
This error is not Function-
specific.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name:
Rcvr_Overflow
_Status
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Overflow Status [Rcvr_Overflow _Status]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: Malformed_TL_Status
bit_ranges.description:
Malformed TLP Status [Malformed_TL_Status]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: ECRC_Err_Stat us
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Error Status [ECRC_Err_Stat us]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: URES
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Request Error Status [URES]
This bit is set when the core has
received a request from the link
that it does not support. This
error is not Function-specific.
This error is considered non-fatal
by default. In the special case
described in Sections 6.2.3.2.4.1
of the PCI Express Specifications,
the error is reported by sending
an ERR_COR message. In all
other cases, the error is reported
by sending an ERR_NONFATAL
message. The header of the
received request that caused the
error is logged in the Header Log
Registers. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: Uncorr_Int_Err_status
bit_ranges.description:
Uncorrectable Internal Error Status [Uncorr_Int_Err_status]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

name: UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_MASK
description:
Uncorrectable Error Mask Register
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
(no description)

name: UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_SEVERITY
description:
Uncorrectable Error Severity Register
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: R8
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R8]
(no description)

name: CORRECTABLE_ERROR_STATUS
description:
Correctable Error Status Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RES
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Error Status [RES]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R12
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R12]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BTPS
bit_ranges.description:
Bad TP Status [BTPS]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: BDS
bit_ranges.description:
Bad DLLP Status [BDS]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: RNRS
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Number Rollover Status [RNRS]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R13
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R13]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RTTS
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Timer Timeout Status [RTTS]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: ANFES
bit_ranges.description:
Advisory Non- Fatal Error Status [ANFES]
This bit is set when an uncorrectable
error occurs, which is determined to
belong to one of the special cases
described in Section 6.2.3.2.4 of the
PCI Express 2.0 Specifications. This
causes the core to generate an
ERR_COR message in place of an
ERR_NONFATAL message. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CIES
bit_ranges.description:
Corrected Internal Error Status [CIES]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: HLOS
bit_ranges.description:
Header Log Overflow Status [HLOS]
This bit is set on a Header Log
Register overflow, that is, when the
header could not be logged in the
Header Log Register because it is
occupied by a previous header.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R14
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R14]
Reserved

name: CORRECTABLE_ERROR_MASK
description:
Correctable Error Mask Register
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: REM
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Error Mask [REM]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R15
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R15]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BTM
bit_ranges.description:
Bad TLP Mask [BTM]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: BDM
bit_ranges.description:
Bad DLLP Mask [BDM]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: RNRM
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Number Rollover Mask [RNRM]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R16
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R16]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RTTM
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Timer Timeout Mask [RTTM]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: ANFEM
bit_ranges.description:
Advisory Non-Fatal Error Mask [ANFEM]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: CIEM
bit_ranges.description:
Corrected Internal Error Mask [CIEM]
This bit is not implemented for
Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: HLOM
bit_ranges.description:
Header Log Overflow Mask [HLOM]
This bit, when set, masks the
generation of error messages in
response to a Header Log register
overflow. STICKY. Header logs are
shared across Vfs hence this field is
reserved. This field is reserved since
Header log sharing is selected for
this configuration.

bit_ranges.name: R17
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R17]
(no description)

name: ADVANCED_ERROR_CAPABILITIES_AND_CONTROL
description:
Advanced Error Capabilities and Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: FER
bit_ranges.description:
First Error Pointer [FER]
This is a 5-bit pointer to the bit
position in the Uncorrectable Error
Status Register corresponding to the
error that was detected first. When
there are multiple bits set in the
Uncorrectable Error Status Register,
this field informs the software which
error was observed first. To prevent
the field from being overwritten
before software was able to read it,
this field is not updated while the
status bit pointed by it in the
Uncorrectable Error Status Register
remains set. After the software
clears this status bit, a subsequent
error condition that sets any bit in
the Uncorrectable Error Status
Register will update the First Error
Pointer. Any uncorrectable error
type, including the special cases
where the error is reported using an
ERR_COR message, will set the First
Error Pointer (assuming the software
has reset the error pointed by it in
the Uncorrectable Error Status
Register). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EGC
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Generation Capability [EGC]
This read-only bit indicates to the
software that the device is capable
of generating ECRC in packets
transmitted on the link. This bit is
hardwired to 0. The setting of the
corresponding bit in the Advanced
Error Capabilities and Control
Register of PF 0 applies to all Virtual
Functions.

bit_ranges.name: EEG
bit_ranges.description:
Enable ECRC Generation [EEG]
Enables the ECRC generation on the
transmit side of the core. This bit is
hardwired to 0. The setting of the
corresponding bit in the Advanced
Error Capabilities and Control
Register of PF0 applies to all Virtual
Functions.

bit_ranges.name: ECCAP
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Check Capability [ECCAP]
This read-only bit indicates to the
software that the device is capable
of checking ECRC in packets received
from the link. This bit is hardwired
to0. This setting of the
corresponding bit in the Advanced
Error Capabilities and Control
Register of PF 0 applies to all Virtual
Functions.

bit_ranges.name: ECC
bit_ranges.description:
Enable ECRC Check [ECC]
Setting this bit enables ECRC
checking on the receive side of the
core. This bit is hardwired to 0. The
setting of the corresponding bit in
the Advanced Error Capabilities and
Control Register of PF 0 applies to all
Virtual  Functions.

bit_ranges.name: MHRC
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Header Recording Capable [MHRC]
This bit is set when the Function has
the capability to log more than one
error header in its Header Log
Registers. It is hardwired to  0.

bit_ranges.name: MHRE
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Header Recording Enable [MHRE]
Setting this bit enables the Function
to log multiple error headers in its
Header Log Registers. It is hardwired
to 0

bit_ranges.name: R18
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R18]
Reserved

name: HEADER_LOG_0
description:
Header Log Register 0
First DWORD of captured TLP header
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HD0
bit_ranges.description:
Header DWORD 0 [HD0]
First DWORD of captured TLP header
STICKY.

name: HEADER_LOG_1
description:
Header Log Register 1
Second DWORD of captured TLP
header STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HD1
bit_ranges.description:
Header DWORD 1 [HD1]
Second DWORD of captured TLP
header STICKY.

name: HEADER_LOG_2
description:
Header Log Register 2
Third DWORD of captured TLP
header  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HD2
bit_ranges.description:
Header DWORD 2 [HD2]
Third DWORD of captured TLP
header  STICKY.

name: HEADER_LOG_3
description:
Header Log Register 3
Fourth DWORD of captured TLP
header  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HD3
bit_ranges.description:
Header DWORD 3 [HD3]
Fourth DWORD of captured TLP
header  STICKY.

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: ARI_EXTENDED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
ARI Extended Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PCCID
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PCCID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI-SIG to
the ARI Extended Capability (000E
hex).

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG-assigned value for
the version   of the capability
structure. This field is taken from the
setting of the corresponding field in
the ARI Extended Capability Header
Register of PF  0.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: ARI_CAPABILITY_AND_ARI_CONTROL
description:
ARI Capability Register and ARI Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R13
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R13]
Reserved

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSVD]
Reserved

name: TPH_REQUESTER_ENHANCED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
TPH Requester Enhanced Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PECID
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PECID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to
the TPH Requester Capability.

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG assigned value for
the version of the capability
structure. This field is set by default
to 1, but can be modified for all VFs
by writing  into this register field of
Physical Function 0 from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: TPH_REQUESTER_CAPABILITY
description:
TPH Requester Capability Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: NSTM
bit_ranges.description:
No ST Mode Supported [NSTM]
When set to 1, indicates that this
Function supports the 'No ST Mode'
for the generation of TPH Steering
Tags. In the No ST Mode, the device
must use a Steering Tag value of 0
for all requests. This bit is hardwired
to 1, as all TPH Requesters are
required to support the No ST Mode
of operation.

bit_ranges.name: IVMS
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Vector Mode Supported [IVMS]
A setting of 1 indicates that the
Function supports the Interrupt
Vector Mode for TPH Steering Tag
generation. In the Interrupt Vector
Mode, Steering Tags are attached to
MSI/MSI-X interrupt requests. The
Steering Tag for each interrupt
request is selected by the MSI/MSI-X
interrupt vector number. This bit is
set to 1 by default, but can be
modified from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: DSMS
bit_ranges.description:
Device- Specific Mode Supported [DSMS]
A setting of 1 indicates that the
Function supports the Device-
Specific Mode for TPH Steering Tag
generation. In this mode, the
Steering Tags are supplied by the
client for each request through the
HAL master interface. The client
typically chooses the Steering Tag
values from the ST Table, but is not
required to do so. This bit is set to 1
by default, but can be modified from
the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ERS
bit_ranges.description:
Extended TPH Requester Supported [ERS]
When set to 1, indicates that the
Function is capable of generating
requests with a TPH TLP Prefix.

bit_ranges.name: STTL
bit_ranges.description:
ST Table Location [STTL]
The setting of this field indicates if a
Steering Tag Table is implemented
for this Function, and its location if
present. (00 = ST Table not present,
01 = ST Table in the TPH Requester
Capability Structure, 10 = ST values
stored in the MSI-X Table in client
RAM, 11 = reserved.). This field can
be modified from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: STTS
bit_ranges.description:
ST Table Size [STTS]
Specifies the number of entries in
the Steering Tag Table (0 = 1 entry,
1 = 2 entries, and so on). Max limit
is 64 entries when the ST Table is
located in the TPH Requester
Capability Structure, and 2048
entries when located in the MSI-X
table. Each entry is 16 bits long. This
field can be modified from the local
management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

name: TPH_REQUESTER_CONTROL
description:
TPH Requester Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: STM
bit_ranges.description:
ST Mode [STM]
This field selects the ST mode (000
= No Steering Tag Mode, 001 =
Interrupt Vector Mode, 010 =
Device-Specific Mode, other values
are reserved). The
VF_TPH_ST_MODE output of the
core reflects the setting of this
register field (bits 3:0  for VF 0 and
so on). This field can also be written
from the local management  bus.

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
RSVD
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: TRE
bit_ranges.description:
TPH Requester Enable [TRE]
When set the Function is allowed to
generate requests with Transaction
Processing Hints. Defined Encodings
are: 00b Function operating as a
Requester is not permitted to issue
Requests with TPH or Extended TPH.
01b Function operating as a
Requester is permitted to issue
Requests with TPH and is not
permitted to issue Requests with
Extended TPH. 10b Reserved. 11b
Function operating as a Requester is
permitted to issue Requests with TPH
and Extended TPH.

bit_ranges.name: R10
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R10]
Reserved

name: TPH_ST_TABLE_0
description:
TPH ST Table 0
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the second Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

bit_ranges.name: ST0L
bit_ranges.description:
ST 0 Lower [ST0L]
Lower 8 bits of the first Steering Tag.
This is the 8- bit Steering Tag sent
out in  requests.

bit_ranges.name: ST0U
bit_ranges.description:
ST 0 Upper [ST0U]
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the first Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

bit_ranges.name: ST1L
bit_ranges.description:
ST 1 Lower [ST1L]
Lower 8 bits of the second Steering
Tag. This is the 8-bit Steering Tag
sent out in  requests.

bit_ranges.name: ST1U
bit_ranges.description:
ST 1 Upper [ST1U]
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the second Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

name: TPH_ST_TABLE_1
description:
TPH ST Table 1
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the second Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

bit_ranges.name: ST0L
bit_ranges.description:
ST 0 Lower [ST0L]
Lower 8 bits of the first Steering Tag.
This is the 8- bit Steering Tag sent
out in  requests.

bit_ranges.name: ST0U
bit_ranges.description:
ST 0 Upper [ST0U]
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the first Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

bit_ranges.name: ST1L
bit_ranges.description:
ST 1 Lower [ST1L]
Lower 8 bits of the second Steering
Tag. This is the 8-bit Steering Tag
sent out in  requests.

bit_ranges.name: ST1U
bit_ranges.description:
ST 1 Upper [ST1U]
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the second Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

name: TPH_ST_TABLE_2
description:
TPH ST Table 2
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the second Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

bit_ranges.name: ST0L
bit_ranges.description:
ST 0 Lower [ST0L]
Lower 8 bits of the first Steering Tag.
This is the 8- bit Steering Tag sent
out in  requests.

bit_ranges.name: ST0U
bit_ranges.description:
ST 0 Upper [ST0U]
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the first Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

bit_ranges.name: ST1L
bit_ranges.description:
ST 1 Lower [ST1L]
Lower 8 bits of the second Steering
Tag. This is the 8-bit Steering Tag
sent out in  requests.

bit_ranges.name: ST1U
bit_ranges.description:
ST 1 Upper [ST1U]
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the second Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

name: TPH_ST_TABLE_3
description:
TPH ST Table 3
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the second Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

bit_ranges.name: ST0L
bit_ranges.description:
ST 0 Lower [ST0L]
Lower 8 bits of the first Steering Tag.
This is the 8- bit Steering Tag sent
out in  requests.

bit_ranges.name: ST0U
bit_ranges.description:
ST 0 Upper [ST0U]
This field is used for the upper 8 bits
of the first Steering Tag when
Extended TPH Requester support is
enabled.

bit_ranges.name: ST1L
bit_ranges.description:
ST 1 Lower [ST1L]
Lower 8 bits of the second Steering
Tag. This is the 8-bit Steering Tag
sent out in  requests.

bit_ranges.name: ST1U
bit_ranges.description:
ST 1 Upper [ST1U]
This field is used for the upper 8 bits

Extended TPH Requester support is

name: VENDOR_ID_AND_DEVICE_ID
description:
Vendor ID and Device ID
Device ID assigned by the
