manufacturer of the device. On
power-up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field  can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: VID
bit_ranges.description:
Vendor ID [VID]
This is the Vendor ID assigned by
PCI SIG to the manufacturer of the
device. The Vendor ID is set in the
Vendor ID Register within the local
management  register block.

bit_ranges.name: DID
bit_ranges.description:
Device ID [DID]
Device ID assigned by the
manufacturer of the device. On
power-up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field  can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

name: COMMAND_AND_STATUS
description:
Command and Status Register
This bit is set when the core has
received a poisoned TLP. The Parity
Error Response enable bit (bit 6) has
no effect on the setting   of this bit.
This field can also be cleared from
the local management bus APB by
writing a 1 into this bit position. This
field can be forced  to 1 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: ISE
bit_ranges.description:
IO-Space Enable [ISE]
Enables IO accesses through the
core for this PCI Function.

bit_ranges.name: MSE
bit_ranges.description:
Mem-Space Enable [MSE]
Enables memory accesses through
the core for this PCI Function.

bit_ranges.name: BE
bit_ranges.description:
Bus-Master Enable [BE]
Enables the device to issue memory
and I/O requests from this
Function.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PERE
bit_ranges.description:
Parity Error Response Enable [PERE]
When this bit is 1, the core sets the
Master Data Parity Error status bit
when it detects the following error
conditions: (i) The core receives a
poisoned completion from the link in
response to a request. (ii) The core
sends out a poisoned write request
on the link (this may be because an
underflow occurred during the
packet transfer at the host interface
of the core.). When this bit is 0, the
Master Data Parity Error status bit is
never  set.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SE
bit_ranges.description:
SERR Enable [SE]
Enables the reporting of fatal and
non-fatal errors detected by the core
to the Root  Complex.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IMD
bit_ranges.description:
INTx Message Disabled [IMD]
Enables or disables the transmission
of INTx Assert and De-assert
messages from the core. The setting
of this bit has no effect on the
operation of the core in the RC
mode.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IS
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Status [IS]
This bit is valid only when the core is
configured to support legacy
interrupts. Indicates that the core
has a pending interrupt, that is, the
core has sent an Assert_INTx
message but has not transmitted a
corresponding  Deassert_INTx
message.

bit_ranges.name: CL
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities List [CL]
Indicates the presence of PCI
Extended Capabilities registers. This
bit is hardwired to  1.

bit_ranges.name: R5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R5]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MDPE
bit_ranges.description:
Master Data Parity Error [MDPE]
When the Parity Error Response
enable bit is 1, the core sets this bit
when it detects the following error
conditions: (i) The core receives a
poisoned request from the link. (ii)
The core has sent a Poisoned
Completion downstream to the link
This bit remains 0 when the Parity
Error Response enable bit is 0. This
field can be forced to 1 from the APB
bus by setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: R6
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R6]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: STA
bit_ranges.description:
Signaled Target Abort [STA]
This bit is set when the core has
sent a completion to the link with
the Completer Abort status. This
field can also be cleared from the
local management APB bus by
writing a 1 into this bit position. This
field can be forced to 1 from the APB
bus by setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: RTA
bit_ranges.description:
Received Target Abort [RTA]
This bit is set when the core has
received a completion from the link
with the Completer Abort status.
This field can also be cleared from
the local management APB bus by
writing a 1 into this bit position. This
field can be written from the APB
bus by setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: RMA
bit_ranges.description:
Received Master Abort [RMA]
This bit is set when the core has
received a completion from the link
with the Unsupported Request
status. This field can also be cleared
from the local management APB bus
by writing a 1 into this bit position
This field can be forced to 1 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high  of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: SSE
bit_ranges.description:
Signaled System Error [SSE]
The core sets this bit (i)On receiving
an error message from the link, if
SERR-Enable in PCI Command
Register is 1 and SERR-Enable in the
Bridge Control Register is also 1.
(ii)On any internal Fatal/Non-Fatal
error detected, if SERR-Enable in PCI
Command Register is 1. This field
can also be cleared from the local
management APB bus by writing a 1
into this bit position. This field can
be forced to 1 from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: DPE
bit_ranges.description:
Detected Parity Error [DPE]
This bit is set when the core has
received a poisoned TLP. The Parity
Error Response enable bit (bit 6) has
no effect on the setting   of this bit.
This field can also be cleared from
the local management bus APB by
writing a 1 into this bit position. This
field can be forced  to 1 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

name: REVISION_ID_AND_CLASS_CODE
description:
Revision ID and Class Code Register
Identifies the function of the device.
On power- up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: RID
bit_ranges.description:
Revision ID [RID]
Assigned by the manufacturer of the
device to identify the revision
number of the device. This field can
be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register  write.

bit_ranges.name: PIB
bit_ranges.description:
Programming Interface Byte [PIB]
Identifies the register set layout of
the device. This field can be written
from the APB bus by setting [21] bit
high of the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR
during a local management register
write.

bit_ranges.name: SCC
bit_ranges.description:
Sub-Class Code [SCC]
Identifies a sub-category within the
selected function. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: CC
bit_ranges.description:
Class Code [CC]
Identifies the function of the device.
On power- up, the core sets it to the
value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

name: BIST,_HEADER_TYPE,_LATENCY_TIMER_AND_CACHE_LINE_SIZE_S
description:
BIST, Header Type, Latency Timer and Cache Line Size Registers
BIST control register. This field can
be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: CLS
bit_ranges.description:
Cache Line Size [CLS]
Cache Line Size Register defined in
PCI Specifications 3.0. This field can
be read or written, both from the
link and from the local management
bus, but its value is not used.

bit_ranges.name: LT
bit_ranges.description:
Latency Timer [LT]
This is an unused field and is
hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: HT
bit_ranges.description:
Header Type [HT]
Identifies format of header. This field
is hardwired to 1.

bit_ranges.name: DT
bit_ranges.description:
Device Type [DT]
Identifies whether the device
supports a single Function or
multiple Functions. Hardwired to
zero

bit_ranges.name: BR
bit_ranges.description:
BIST Register [BR]
BIST control register. This field can
be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

name: ROOT_COMPLEX_BASE_ADDRESS_0
description:
Root Complex Base Address Register 0
This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in Root Complex BAR
Configuration Register. All other bits
are not writeable, and are read as
0's.

bit_ranges.name: MSI0
bit_ranges.description:
BAR Type [MSI0]
Specifies whether this BAR defines a
memory address range or an I/O
address range (0 = memory, 1 =
I/O). The value read in this field is
determined by the setting of Root
Complex BAR Configuration
Register.

bit_ranges.name: R7
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R7]
This bit is hardwired to 0 for both
memory and I/O BARs.

bit_ranges.name: S0
bit_ranges.description:
Size [S0]
For memory BAR: This bit reads as
0 when BAR 0 is configured as a 32-
bit BAR, and as 1 when configured
as a 64-bit BAR. For IO BAR: This is
bit 3 of the base address. The value
read in this field is determined by
the setting of Root Complex BAR
Configuration Register.

bit_ranges.name: P0
bit_ranges.description:
Prefetchability [P0]
For memory BAR: This bit reads as
1 when BAR 0 is configured as a
prefetchable BAR, and as 0 when
configured as a non-prefetchable
BAR. For IO BAR: This is bit 3 of the
base address. The value read in this
field is determined by the setting of
Root Complex BAR Configuration
Register.

bit_ranges.name: BAMR0
bit_ranges.description:
Base Address - RO part [BAMR0]
This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in Root Complex BAR
Configuration Register. All other bits
are not writeable, and are read as
0's.

bit_ranges.name: BAMRW
bit_ranges.description:
Base Address - RW part [BAMRW]
This field defines the base address
of the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in Root Complex BAR
Configuration Register. All other bits
are not writeable, and are read as
0's.

name: ROOT_COMPLEX_BASE_ADDRESS_1
description:
Root Complex Base Address Register 1
This field defines the base address of
the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in Root Complex BAR
Configuration Register. All other bits
are not writeable, and are read as
0's.

bit_ranges.name: BAMRW
bit_ranges.description:
Base Address [BAMRW]
This field defines the base address of
the memory address range. The
number of implemented bits in this
field determines the BAR aperture
configured in Root Complex BAR
Configuration Register. All other bits
are not writeable, and are read as
0's.

name: PRIMARY_BUS_NUMBER,_SECONDARY_BUS_NUMBER,_SUBORDINATE_BUS_NUMBER,_SECONDARY_LATENCY_TIMER
description:
Primary Bus Number, Secondary Bus Number, Subordinate Bus Number, Secondary Latency Timer
This field is not  implemented.

bit_ranges.name: PBN
bit_ranges.description:
Primary Bus Number [PBN]
This field can be read and written
from the local management bus, but
its value is not used within the core.

bit_ranges.name: SBN
bit_ranges.description:
Secondary Bus Number [SBN]
This field can be read and written
from the local management bus, but
its value is not used within the core.

bit_ranges.name: SUBN
bit_ranges.description:
Subordinate Bus Number [SUBN]
This field can be read and written
from the local management bus, but
its value is not used within the core.

bit_ranges.name: SLTN
bit_ranges.description:
Secondary Latency Timer [SLTN]
This field is not  implemented.

name: IO_BASE,_IO_LIMIT,_SECONDARY_STATUS
description:
IO Base, IO Limit, Secondary Status Register
The core does not set this bit by
itself. This bit can be cleared by
writing a 1 into this bit position from
the local management APB bus. This
field can be forced to 1 or 0 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: IOBS1
bit_ranges.description:
Type1 cfg IO bar size [IOBS1]
value set in Type1 cfg IO bar size(bit
20 of RC BAR CONFIG register). If
type1 cfg IO bar enable bit(bit 19 in
RC BAR CONFIG register) is not set,
then this field will be hard coded to
0.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IBR
bit_ranges.description:
IO Base Register [IBR]
This field can be read and written
from the local management bus if IO
BAR is enabled in the Root Complex
BAR configuration register, else it is
hardwired to zero. Its value is not
used within the core.

bit_ranges.name: IOBS2
bit_ranges.description:
Type1 cfg IO bar size [IOBS2]
value set in Type1 cfg IO bar size(bit
20 of RC BAR CONFIG register).If
type1 cfg IObar enable bit(bit 19 in
RC BAR CONFIG register) is not set,
then this field will be hard coded to
0.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ILR
bit_ranges.description:
IO Limit Register [ILR]
This field can be read and written
from the local management bus if IO
BAR is enabled in the Root Complex
BAR configuration register, else it is
hardwired to zero. Its value is not
used within the core.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MPE
bit_ranges.description:
Master Data Parity Error [MPE]
The core does not set this bit by
itself. This bit can be cleared by
writing a 1 into this bit position from
the local management APB bus. This
field can be forced to 1 or 0 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.
Note that this bit can be set only
when the Parity Error Response
Enable bit is set in the Bridge Control
Register

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: STA
bit_ranges.description:
Signaled Target Abort [STA]
The core does not set this bit by
itself. This bit can be cleared by
writing a 1 into this bit position from
the local management APB bus. This
field can be forced to 1 or 0 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: RTA
bit_ranges.description:
Recieved Target Abort [RTA]
The core does not set this bit by
itself. This bit can be cleared by
writing a 1 into this bit position from
the local management APB bus. This
field can be forced to 1 or 0 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: RMA
bit_ranges.description:
Received Master Abort [RMA]
The core does not set this bit by
itself. This bit can be cleared by
writing a 1 into this bit position from
the local management APB bus. This
field can be forced to 1 or 0 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: RSE
bit_ranges.description:
Received System Error [RSE]
The core does not set this bit by
itself. This bit can be cleared by
writing a 1 into this bit position from
the local management APB bus. This
field can be forced to 1 or 0 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: DPE
bit_ranges.description:
Detected Parity Error [DPE]
The core does not set this bit by
itself. This bit can be cleared by
writing a 1 into this bit position from
the local management APB bus. This
field can be forced to 1 or 0 from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

name: MEMORY_BASE,_MEMORY_LIMIT
description:
Memory Base, Memory Limit
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MBR
bit_ranges.description:
Memory Base Register [MBR]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MLR
bit_ranges.description:
Memory Limit Register [MLR]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

name: PREFETCHABLE_MEMORY_BASE,_PREFETCHABLE_MEMORY_LIMIT
description:
Prefetchable Memory Base, Prefetchable Memory Limit
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus
if prefetchable memory is enabled in
the Root Complex BAR configuration
register, else it is hardwired to zero.
Its value is not used within the core.

bit_ranges.name: PMBR
bit_ranges.description:
Prefetchable Memory Base Register [PMBR]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus
if prefetchable memory is enabled in
the Root Complex BAR configuration
register, else it is hardwired to zero.
Its value is not used within the core.

bit_ranges.name: PMLR
bit_ranges.description:
Prefetchable Memory Limit Register [PMLR]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus
if prefetchable memory is enabled in
the Root Complex BAR configuration
register, else it is hardwired to zero.
Its value is not used within the core.

name: PREFETCHABLE_BASE_UPPER
description:
Prefetchable Base Upper
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus
if 64bit prefetchable memory is
enabled in the Root Complex BAR
configuration register, else it is
hardwired to zero. Its value is not
used within the  core.

bit_ranges.name: PBRU
bit_ranges.description:
Prefetchable Base Register Upper [PBRU]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus
if 64bit prefetchable memory is
enabled in the Root Complex BAR
configuration register, else it is
hardwired to zero. Its value is not
used within the  core.

name: PREFETCHABLE_LIMIT_UPPER
description:
Prefetchable Limit Upper
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus
if 64bit prefetchable memory is
enabled in the Root Complex BAR
configuration register, else it is
hardwired to zero. Its value is not
used within the  core.

bit_ranges.name: PLRU
bit_ranges.description:
Prefetchable Limit Register Upper [PLRU]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus
if 64bit prefetchable memory is
enabled in the Root Complex BAR
configuration register, else it is
hardwired to zero. Its value is not
used within the  core.

name: IO_BASE_UPPER,_IO_LIMIT_UPPER
description:
IO Base Upper, IO Limit Upper
This field can be read and written
from the local management bus if
32bit IO BAR is enabled in the Root
Complex BAR configuration register,
else it is hardwired to zero. Its value
is not used within the core.

bit_ranges.name: IBRU
bit_ranges.description:
IO Base Register Upper [IBRU]
This field can be read and written
from the local management bus if
32bit IO BAR is enabled in the Root
Complex BAR configuration register,
else it is hardwired to zero. Its value
is not used within the core.

bit_ranges.name: ILR
bit_ranges.description:
IO Limit Register Upper [ILR]
This field can be read and written
from the local management bus if
32bit IO BAR is enabled in the Root
Complex BAR configuration register,
else it is hardwired to zero. Its value
is not used within the core.

name: CAPABILITIES_POINTER
description:
Capabilities Pointer
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CP
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Contains pointer to the first PCI
Capability Structure. This field is set
by default to the value defined in the
RTL file reg_defaults.h. It can be re-
written independently for every
Function from the local management
APB bus.

bit_ranges.name: R15
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R15]
Reserved

name: RESERVED
description:
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: rsvd
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [rsvd]
Reserved

name: INTERRUPT_LINE,_INTERRUPT_PIN_AND_BRIDGE_CONTROL
description:
Interrupt Line, Interrupt Pin Register and Bridge Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ILR
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Line Register [ILR]
This field can be read and written
from the local management bus, but
its value is not used within the core.
The given reset value is for PF0.

bit_ranges.name: IPR
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Pin Register [IPR]
Identifies the interrupt input (A, B,
C, D) to which this Functions
interrupt output is connected to
(01= INTA, 02 = INTB, 03 = INTC,
04 = INTD).  The
assignment of interrupt inputs to
Functions is fixed when the core is
configured. This field can be re-
written independently for each
Function from the local management
bus. Default values - PF0: 01 (INTA),
PF1: 02 (INTB).

bit_ranges.name: R5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R5]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PERE
bit_ranges.description:
Parity Error Response Enable [PERE]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus.
It is used only to enable the Master
Data Parity Error bit in the
Secondary Status Register.

bit_ranges.name: BCSE
bit_ranges.description:
Bridge Control SERR Enable [BCSE]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: ISAE
bit_ranges.description:
ISA Enable [ISAE]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: VGAE
bit_ranges.description:
VGA Enable [VGAE]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: VGA16D
bit_ranges.description:
VGA 16 DEcode [VGA16D]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: R21
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R21]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BCRSBR
bit_ranges.description:
Bridge Control Register Secondary Bus Reset [BCRSBR]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus.
When set, it initiates a hot reset on
the link.

bit_ranges.name: R23
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R23]
Reserved

name: POWER_MANAGEMENT_CAPABILITIES
description:
Power Management Capabilities Register
Indicates whether the Function is
capable   of sending PME messages
when in the D3cold state. This field
can be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Identifies that the capability
structure is for Power Management.
This field is set by default to 01 hex.
This field can be written from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: CP
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Contains pointer to the next PCI
Capability Structure. The core sets it
to the value defined in the RTL file
reg_defaults.h. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: VID
bit_ranges.description:
Version ID [VID]
Indicates the version of the PCI Bus
Power Management Specifications
that the Function implements. This
field is set by default to   011
(Version 1.2). This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: PC
bit_ranges.description:
PME Clock [PC]
Not applicable to PCI Express. This
bit is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DSI
bit_ranges.description:
Device Specific Initialization Bit [DSI]
This bit, when set, indicates that the
device   requires additional
configuration steps beyond setting
up its PCI configuration space, to
bring it to the D0 active state from
the D0 uninitialized state. This bit is
hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: MCRAPS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Current Required from Aux Power Supply [MCRAPS]
Specifies the maximum current
drawn by the device from the aux
power source in the D3cold state.
This field is not implemented in
devices not supporting PME
notification when in the D3cold
state, and is therefore hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: D1S
bit_ranges.description:
D1 Support [D1S]
Set if the Function supports the D1
power state. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: D2S
bit_ranges.description:
D2 Support [D2S]
Set if the Function supports the D2
power state. Currently hardwired to
0.

bit_ranges.name: PSD0S
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D0 State [PSD0S]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D0 state. This field can
be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register  write.

bit_ranges.name: PSD1S
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D1 State [PSD1S]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D1 state.  This bit is set
to 1 by default, but can be modified
from the local management bus by
writing into Function 0. All other
Functions assume the  value
set in Function 0s Power
Management Capabilities Register.

bit_ranges.name: PSD2S
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D2 State [PSD2S]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable of sending PME messages
when in the D2 state.  This bit is
hardwired to 0 because D2 state is
not supported.

bit_ranges.name: PSDHS
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D3(hot) State [PSDHS]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable  of sending PME messages
when in the D3hot state. This field
can be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: PSDCS
bit_ranges.description:
PME Support for D3(cold) State [PSDCS]
Indicates whether the Function is
capable   of sending PME messages
when in the D3cold state. This field
can be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

name: POWER_MANAGEMENT_CONTROL/STATUS_REPORT
description:
Power Management Control/Status Report
This optional register is not
implemented in the PCIe core. This
field is hardwired to  0.

bit_ranges.name: PS
bit_ranges.description:
Power State [PS]
This field can also be read or written
from the local management APBbus.

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: NSR
bit_ranges.description:
No Soft Reset [NSR]
This bit is set to 1 by default. This
field can be written from the APB bus
by setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PE
bit_ranges.description:
PME Enable [PE]
This bit can be set or cleared from
the local management APB bus, by
writing a 1 or 0, respectively.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PMES
bit_ranges.description:
PME Status [PMES]
This field can be written from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DR
bit_ranges.description:
Data Register [DR]
This optional register is not
implemented in the PCIe core. This
field is hardwired to  0.

name: MSI_CONTROL
description:
MSI Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CID1
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID1]
Specifies that the capability structure is
for MSI. Hardwired to 05 hex.

bit_ranges.name: CP1
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP1]
Pointer to the next PCI Capability
Structure.   This can be modified from
the local management bus. This field can
be written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: ME
bit_ranges.description:
MSI Enable [ME]
Set by the configuration program to
enable the   MSI feature. This field can
also be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: MMC
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Message Capable [MMC]
Encodes the number of distinct messages
that the core is capable of generating for
this Function (000 = 1, 001 = 2, 010 =
4, 011 = 8, 100 = 16, 101= 32). Thus,
this field defines the number of the
interrupt vectors for this Function. The
core allows up to 32 distinct messages,
but the setting of this field must be
based on the number of interrupt inputs
of the core that are actually used by the
client. For example, if the client logic
uses 8 of the 32 distinct MSI interrupt
inputs of the core for this Function, then
the value of this field must be set to 011.
This field can be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: MME
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Message Enable [MME]
Encodes the number of distinct messages
that the core is programmed to generate
for this Function (000 = 1, 001 = 2, 010
= 4, 011 = 8, 100 = 16, 101 = 32). This
setting must be based on the number of
interrupt inputs of the core that are
actually used   by this Function. This
field can be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: BAC64
bit_ranges.description:
64-Bit Address Capable [BAC64]
Set to 1 to indicate that the device is
capable of generating 64-bit addresses
for MSI messages. Can be modified using
local management interface

bit_ranges.name: MC
bit_ranges.description:
MSI masking capable [MC]
can be modified using local management
interface

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

name: MSI_MESSAGE_LOW_ADDRESS
description:
MSI Message Low Address Register
Lower bits of the address to be used
in MSI messages. This field can also
be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
The two lower bits of the address are
hardwired to 0 to align the address
on a double-word  boundary.

bit_ranges.name: MAL
bit_ranges.description:
Message Address Low [MAL]
Lower bits of the address to be used
in MSI messages. This field can also
be written from the local
management bus.

name: MSI_MESSAGE_HIGH_ADDRESS
description:
MSI Message High Address Register
Contains bits 63:32 of the 64-bit
address to be used in MSI Messages.
A value of 0 specifies that 32-bit
addresses are to be used in the
messages. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: MAH
bit_ranges.description:
Message Address High [MAH]
Contains bits 63:32 of the 64-bit
address to be used in MSI Messages.
A value of 0 specifies that 32-bit
addresses are to be used in the
messages. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

name: MSI_MESSAGE_DATA
description:
MSI Message Data Register
Hardwired to 0

bit_ranges.name: MD
bit_ranges.description:
Message Data [MD]
Message data to be used for this
Function. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: R2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R2]
Hardwired to 0

name: MSI_MASK
description:
MSI Mask Register
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: MM
bit_ranges.description:
MSI Mask [MM]
Mask bits for MSI interrupts. The
Multiple  Message Capable field of
the MSI Control Register specifies
the number of distinct interrupts for
the Function, which determines the
number of valid mask bits.

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
RSVD
RSVD

name: MSI_PENDING_BITS
description:
MSI Pending Bits Register
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: MP
bit_ranges.description:
MSI Pending Bits [MP]
Pending bits for MSI interrupts. This
field can be written from the APB
interface to refelct the current
pending status.

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
RSVD
RSVD

name: MSI_X_CONTROL
description:
MSI-X Control Register
Set by the configuration program to
enable the MSI-X feature. This field
can also be written from the local
management bus.

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Identifies that the capability
structure is for MSI-X. This field is
set by default to 11 hex. It can be
rewritten independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: CP
bit_ranges.description:
Capabilities Pointer [CP]
Contains pointer to the next PCI
Capability Structure. This is set to
point to the PCI Express Capability
Structure at 30 hex. This can be
rewritten independently for each
Function from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: MSIXTS
bit_ranges.description:
MSI-X Table Size [MSIXTS]
Specifies the size of the MSI-X Table,
that   is, the number of interrupt
vectors defined   for the Function.
The programmed value is 1 minus
the size of the table (that is, this
field   is set to 0 if the table size is
1.). It can be re- written
independently for each Function
from the local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: FM
bit_ranges.description:
Function Mask [FM]
This bit serves as a global mask to
all the interrupt conditions
associated with this Function. When
this bit is set, the core will not send
out MSI-X messages from this
Function. This field can also be
written from the local management
bus.

bit_ranges.name: MSIXE
bit_ranges.description:
MSI-X Enable [MSIXE]
Set by the configuration program to
enable the MSI-X feature. This field
can also be written from the local
management bus.

name: MSI_X_TABLE_OFFSET
description:
MSI-X Table Offset Register
Offset of the memory address where
the MSI- X Table is located, relative
to the selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD aligned.

bit_ranges.name: BARI
bit_ranges.description:
BAR Indicator Register [BARI]
Identifies the BAR corresponding to
the memory address range where
the MSI-X Table is located (000 =
BAR 0, 001 = BAR 1, ... , 101 = BAR
5).

bit_ranges.name: TO
bit_ranges.description:
Table Offset [TO]
Offset of the memory address where
the MSI- X Table is located, relative
to the selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD aligned.

name: MSI_X_PENDING_INTERRUPT
description:
MSI-X Pending Interrupt Register
Offset of the memory address where
the PBA is located, relative to the
selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD aligned.

bit_ranges.name: BARI1
bit_ranges.description:
BAR Indicator Register [BARI1]
Identifies the BAR corresponding to
the memory address range where
the PBA Structure is located (000 =
BAR 0, 001 = BAR 1, ... , 101 = BAR
5). The value programmed must be
the same as the BAR Indicator
configured in the MSI-X Table Offset
Register. Identifies the BAR
corresponding to the memory
address range where the PBA
Structure is located (000 = BAR 0,
001 = BAR1, ... , 101 = BAR 5). The
value programmed must be the
same as the BAR Indicator
configured in the MSI-X Table Offset
Register.

bit_ranges.name: PBAO
bit_ranges.description:
PBA Offset [PBAO]
Offset of the memory address where
the PBA is located, relative to the
selected BAR. The three least
significant bits of the address are
omitted, as the addresses are
QWORD aligned.

name: PCI_EXPRESS_CAPABILITY_LIST
description:
PCI Express Capability List Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CID
bit_ranges.description:
Capability ID [CID]
Specifies Capability ID assigned by
PCI SIG for this structure. This field
is hardwired to 10  hex.

bit_ranges.name: NCP
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Pointer [NCP]
Points to the next PCI capability
structure. Set to 0 because this is
the last capability  structure.

bit_ranges.name: PCV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [PCV]
Identifies the version number of the
capability structure. The value
depends on the value of the strap
input PCIE_GENERATION_SEL
If PCIE_GENERATION_SEL indicates
Gen 2 or later generations, then the
value is 2 else 1. Can be modified
using local management interface
after asserting input signal
MGMT_TYPE1_CONFIG_REG_ACCESS
high.

bit_ranges.name: DT
bit_ranges.description:
Device Type [DT]
Indicates the type of device
implementing this Function. This field
is hardwired to 4 in the RP mode.

bit_ranges.name: SI
bit_ranges.description:
Slot Implemented [SI]
When Set, this bit indicates that the
Link associated with this Port is
connected to a slot

bit_ranges.name: IMN
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt Message Number [IMN]
Identifies the MSI or MSI-X interrupt
vector for the interrupt message
generated corresponding to the
status bits in the Slot Status
Register, Root Status Register, or this
capability structure. This field must
be defined based on the chosen
interrupt mode - MSI or MSI-X. This
field is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: TRS
bit_ranges.description:
TCS Routing Supported [TRS]
When set to 1, this bit indicates that
the device supports routing of
Trusted Configuration Requests. Not
valid for Endpoints. Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CAPABILITIES
description:
PCI Express Device Capabilities Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MP
bit_ranges.description:
Max Payload Size [MP]
Specifies maximum payload size
supported by the device. This field
can be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: PFS
bit_ranges.description:
Phantom Functions Supported [PFS]
This field is used to extend the tag
field by combining unused Function
bits with the tag bits. This field is
hardwired to 00 to disable this
feature.

bit_ranges.name: ETFS
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Tag Field Supported [ETFS]
hard coded to zero .

bit_ranges.name: AL0L
bit_ranges.description:
Acceptable L0S Latency [AL0L]
Specifies acceptable latency that the
Endpoint can tolerate while
transitioning from L0S to L0. This
field can be written from the APB bus
by setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: AL1L
bit_ranges.description:
Acceptable L1 Latency [AL1L]
Specifies acceptable latency that the
Endpoint can tolerate while
transitioning from L1 to L0. This field
can be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register  write.

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RER
bit_ranges.description:
Role- Based Error Reporting [RER]
Enables role-based error reporting.
This field can be written from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit  high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: R4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R4]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CSP
bit_ranges.description:
Captured Slot Power Limit Value [CSP]
Specifies upper limit on power
supplied by slot. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: CPLS
bit_ranges.description:
Captured Power Limit Scale [CPLS]
Specifies the scale used by Slot
Power Limit Value. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: FLRC
bit_ranges.description:
Function level reset capability [FLRC]
A value of 1b indicates the Function
supports the optional Function Level
Reset mechanism

bit_ranges.name: R5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R5]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CONTROL_AND_STATUS
description:
PCI Express Device Control and Status Register
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: ECER
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Correctable Error Reporting [ECER]
This bit is not used by the core in
Root Port  mode.

bit_ranges.name: ENFER
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Non- Fatal Error Reporting [ENFER]
This bit is not used by the core in
Root Port  mode.

bit_ranges.name: EFER
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Fatal Error Reporting [EFER]
This bit is not used by the core in
Root Port  mode.

bit_ranges.name: EURR
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Unsupported Request Reporting [EURR]
Enables the sending of error
messages by the core on receiving
unsupported  requests.

bit_ranges.name: ERO
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Relaxed Ordering [ERO]
When set, this bit indicates that the
device is allowed to set the Relaxed
Ordering bit in the Attributes field of
transactions initiated from it. when
the transactions do not require
Strong Ordering.

bit_ranges.name: MP
bit_ranges.description:
Max Payload Size [MP]
Specifies the maximum TLP payload
size configured. The device must be
able to receive a TLP of this
maximum size, and should not
generate TLP's larger than this
value. Software must set this field
based on the maximum payload size
in the Device Capabilities Register,
and the capability of the other side.

bit_ranges.name: ETE
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Tag Enable [ETE]
extended tag not enabled. Hence
hard coded to zero .

bit_ranges.name: PFE
bit_ranges.description:
phantum functions enable [PFE]
Hardwired to 0

bit_ranges.name: APPME
bit_ranges.description:
aux power PM enable [APPME]
Hardwired to 0

bit_ranges.name: ENS
bit_ranges.description:
Enable no snoop [ENS]
If this bit is Set, the Function is
permitted to Set   the No Snoop bit
in the Requester Attributes of
transactions it initiates that do not
require hardware enforced cache
coherency.

bit_ranges.name: MRR
bit_ranges.description:
Max Read Request Size [MRR]
Specifies the maximum size allowed
in read requests generated by the
device.

bit_ranges.name: R7
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R7]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: CED
bit_ranges.description:
Correctable Error Detected [CED]
Set to 1 by the core when it detects
a correctable error, regardless of
whether the error is  masked.

bit_ranges.name: NFED
bit_ranges.description:
Non-Fatal Error Detected [NFED]
Set to 1 by the core when it detects
a non-fatal error, regardless of
whether the error is  masked.

bit_ranges.name: FED
bit_ranges.description:
Fatal Error Detected [FED]
Set to 1 by the core when it detects
a fatal error, regardless of whether
the error is  masked.

bit_ranges.name: URD
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Request Detected [URD]
Set to 1 by the core when it receives
an unsupported request.

bit_ranges.name: APD
bit_ranges.description:
Aux Power Detected [APD]
Set when auxiliary power is detected
by the device. This is an unused
field.

bit_ranges.name: TP
bit_ranges.description:
Transaction Pending [TP]
Indicates if any of the Non-Posted
requests issued by the RC are still
pending.

bit_ranges.name: R8
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R8]
(no description)

name: LINK_CAPABILITIES
description:
Link Capabilities Register
Specifies the port number assigned
to the PCI Express link connected to
this device. This field can be written
from the APB bus by setting [21] bit
high of the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR
during a local management register
write.

bit_ranges.name: MLS
bit_ranges.description:
Max Link Speed [MLS]
Indicates the speeds supported by
the link (2.5 GT/s, 5 GT/s per lane).
This field is hardwired to 0001
(2.5GT/s) when the strap input
PCIE_GENERATION_SEL is set to 0,
to 0010 (5GT/s) when the strap is
set to  1.

bit_ranges.name: MLW
bit_ranges.description:
Max Link Width [MLW]
Indicates the maximum number of
lanes supported by the device. This
field is hardwired based on the
setting of the LANE_COUNT_IN strap
input.

bit_ranges.name: ASPM
bit_ranges.description:
Active State Power Management [ASPM]
Indicates the level of ASPM support
provided by the device. This field
can be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: L0EL
bit_ranges.description:
L0S Exit Latency [L0EL]
Specifies the time required for the
device to transition from L0S to L0.
This parameter is dependent on the
Physical Layer implementation. This
field can be written from the APB
bus by setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: L1EL
bit_ranges.description:
L1 Exit Latency [L1EL]
Specifies the exit latency from L1
state. This parameter is dependent
on the Physical Layer
implementation. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: CPM
bit_ranges.description:
Clock Power Management [CPM]
Indicates that the device supports
removal of reference clocks. Not
supported in this version of the core.
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: SERC
bit_ranges.description:
Surprise Down Error Reporting Capability [SERC]
Indicates the capability of the device
to report a Surprise Down error
condition. This bit is hardwired to 0,
as this version of the core does not
support the feature.

bit_ranges.name: DARC
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Layer Active Reporting Capability [DARC]
Set to 1 if the device is capable of
reporting that the DL Control and
Management State Machine has
reached the DL_Active state. This bit
is hardwired to 0, as this version of
the core does not support the
feature.

bit_ranges.name: LBNC
bit_ranges.description:
Link Bandwidth Notification Capability [LBNC]
A value of 1b indicates support for
the Link Bandwidth Notification
status and interrupt mechanisms.
This field can be written from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: ASPMOC
bit_ranges.description:
ASPM Optionality Compliance [ASPMOC]
A 1 in this position indicates the
device supports the ASPM
Optionality feature. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: R9
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R9]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PN
bit_ranges.description:
Port Number [PN]
Specifies the port number assigned
to the PCI Express link connected to
this device. This field can be written
from the APB bus by setting [21] bit
high of the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR
during a local management register
write.

name: LINK_CONTROL_AND_STATUS
description:
Link Control and Status Register
This bit is Set by hardware to
indicate that hardware has
autonomously changed Link speed
or width, without the Port
transitioning through DL_Down
status, for reasons other than to
attempt to correct unreliable Link
operation. This triggers an interrupt
to be generated through
PHY_INTERRUPT_OUT if enabled.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0.

bit_ranges.name: ASPMC
bit_ranges.description:
Active State Power Management Control [ASPMC]
Controls the level of ASPM support
on the PCI Express link associated
with the function. The valid setting
are 00: ASPM disabled 01: L0s entry
enabled, L1 disabled 10: L1 entry
enabled, L0s disabled 11: Both L0s
and L1 enabled. Note that these
Control bits can be enabled only if
the corresponding ASPM Support bit
is 1.

bit_ranges.name: R10
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R10]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RCB
bit_ranges.description:
Read Completion Boundary [RCB]
Indicates the Read Completion
Boundary of the Root Port (0 = 64
bytes, 1 = 128 bytes). This field can
be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: LD
bit_ranges.description:
Link Disable [LD]
Writing a 1 to this bit position
causes the LTSSM to go to the
Disable Link state. The LTSSM stays
in the Disable Link state while this
bit is set.

bit_ranges.name: RL
bit_ranges.description:
Retrain Link [RL]
Setting this bit to 1 causes the
LTSSM to initiate link training. This
bit always reads as 0.

bit_ranges.name: CCC
bit_ranges.description:
Common Clock Configuration [CCC]
A value of 0 indicates that the
reference clock of this device is
asynchronous to that of the
upstream device. A value of 1
indicates that the reference clock is
common.

bit_ranges.name: ES
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Synch [ES]
Set to 1 to extend the sequence of
ordered sets transmitted while
exiting from the L0S  state.

bit_ranges.name: ECPM
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Clock Power Management [ECPM]
This field is hardwired to 0 when the
core is in the RC mode.

bit_ranges.name: R9
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R9]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LBMIE
bit_ranges.description:
Link Bandwidth Management Interrupt Enable [LBMIE]
When Set, this bit enables the
generation of an interrupt to
indicate that the Link Bandwidth
Management Status bit has been
Set. This enables an interrupt to be
generated through
PHY_INTERRUPT_OUT if triggered.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0.

bit_ranges.name: LABIE
bit_ranges.description:
Link Autonomous Bandwidth Interrupt Enable [LABIE]
When Set, this bit enables the
generation of an interrupt to
indicate that the Link Autonomous
Bandwidth Status bit has been Set.
This enables an interrupt to be
generated through
PHY_INTERRUPT_OUT if triggered.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0.

bit_ranges.name: R11
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R11]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: NLS
bit_ranges.description:
Negotiated Link Speed [NLS]
Negotiated link speed of the device.
The only supported speed ids are
2.5 GT/s per lane (0001),5 GT/s per
lane (0010) .

bit_ranges.name: NLW
bit_ranges.description:
Negotiated Link Width [NLW]
Set at the end of link training to the
actual link width negotiated between
the two sides.

bit_ranges.name: R12
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R12]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LTS
bit_ranges.description:
Link Training Status [LTS]
This bit is set to 1 when the LTSSM
is in the Recovery or Configuration
states, or if a 1 has been written to
the Retrain Link bit but the link
training has not yet begun.

bit_ranges.name: SCC
bit_ranges.description:
Slot Clock Configuration [SCC]
Indicates that the device uses the
reference clock provided by the
connector. This field can be written
from the APB bus by setting [21] bit
high of the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR
during a local management register
write.

bit_ranges.name: DA
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Layer Active [DA]
Indicates the status of the Data Link
Layer. Set   to 1 when the DL
Control and Management State
Machine has reached the DL_Active
state. This bit is hardwired to 0 in
this version of the  core.

bit_ranges.name: LBMS
bit_ranges.description:
Link Bandwidth Management Status [LBMS]
This bit is Set by hardware to
indicate that either link training has
completed following write to retrain
link bit, or when HW has changed
link speed or width to attempt to
correct unreliable link operation.
This triggers an interrupt to be
generated through
PHY_INTERRUPT_OUT if enabled.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0.

bit_ranges.name: LABS
bit_ranges.description:
Link Autonomous Bandwidth Status [LABS]
This bit is Set by hardware to
indicate that hardware has
autonomously changed Link speed
or width, without the Port
transitioning through DL_Down
status, for reasons other than to
attempt to correct unreliable Link
operation. This triggers an interrupt
to be generated through
PHY_INTERRUPT_OUT if enabled.
Hardwired to 0 if Link Bandwidth
Notification Capability is 0.

name: SLOT_CAPABILITY
description:
Slot Capability Register
This field indicates the physical
slot number attached to this Port.
This field must be hardware
initialized to a value that assigns
a slot number that is unique
within the chassis, regardless of
the form factor associated with
the slot. This field must be
initialized to zero for Ports
connected to devices  that are
either integrated on the system
board or integrated within the
same silicon as the Switch device
or Root Port.

bit_ranges.name: ABPRSNT
bit_ranges.description:
Attention Button Present [ABPRSNT]
When Set, this bit indicates that
an Attention Button for this slot is
electrically controlled by the
chassis.

bit_ranges.name: PCP
bit_ranges.description:
Power Controller Present [PCP]
When Set, this bit indicates that a
software programmable Power
Controller is implemented for this
slot/adapter (depending on form
factor).

bit_ranges.name: MRLSP
bit_ranges.description:
MRL Sensor Present [MRLSP]
When Set, this bit indicates that
an MRL Sensor is implemented on
the chassis for this  slot.

bit_ranges.name: AIP
bit_ranges.description:
Attention Indicator Present [AIP]
When Set, this bit indicates that
an Attention Indicator is
electrically controlled by the
chassis.

bit_ranges.name: PIP
bit_ranges.description:
Power Indicator Present [PIP]
When Set, this bit indicates that a
Power Indicator  is electrically
controlled by the chassis for this
slot.

bit_ranges.name: HPS
bit_ranges.description:
Hot-Plug Surprise [HPS]
When Set, this bit indicates that
an adapter present in this slot
might be removed from the
system without any prior
notification. This is a form factor
specific capability. This bit is an
indication to the operating system
to allow for such removal without
impacting continued software
operation.

bit_ranges.name: HPC
bit_ranges.description:
Hot-Plug Capable [HPC]
When Set, this bit indicates that
this slot is capable of supporting
hot-plug operations.

bit_ranges.name: SPLV
bit_ranges.description:
Slot Power Limit Value [SPLV]
In combination with the Slot
Power Limit Scale value, specifies
the upper limit on power supplied
by the slot (see Section 6.9) or by
other means to the adapter.
Power limit (in Watts) is
calculated by multiplying the
value in this field by the value in
the Slot Power Limit Scale field
except when the Slot Power Limit
Scale field equals 00b (1.0x) and
Slot Power Limit Value exceeds
EFh, the following alternative
encodings are used: F0h = 250 W
Slot Power Limit F1h = 275 W
Slot Power Limit F2h = 300 W
Slot Power Limit F3h to FFh=
Reserved for Slot Power Limit
values above 300 W This register
must be implemented if the Slot
Implemented bit is Set. Writes to
this register also cause the Port to
send the Set_Slot_Power_Limit
Message. The default value prior
to hardware/ firmware
initialization is 0000 0000b.

bit_ranges.name: SPLS
bit_ranges.description:
Slot Power Limit Scale [SPLS]
Specifies the scale used for the
Slot Power Limit Value. Range of
Values: 00b = 1.0x 01b = 0.1x
10b = 0.01x 11b = 0.001x This
register must be implemented if
the Slot Implemented bit is Set.
Writes to this register also cause
the Port to send the
Set_Slot_Power_Limit Message.
The default value prior to
hardware/firmware initialization is
00b.

bit_ranges.name: EIP
bit_ranges.description:
Electromechanical Interlock Present [EIP]
When Set, this bit indicates that
an Electromechanical Interlock is
implemented on the chassis for
this slot.

bit_ranges.name: NCCS
bit_ranges.description:
No Command Completed Support [NCCS]
When Set, this bit indicates that
this slot does not generate
software notification when an
issued command is completed by
the Hot-Plug Controller. This bit is
only permitted to be Set if the
hot-plug capable Port is able to
accept writes to all fields of the
Slot Control register without delay
between successive writes.

bit_ranges.name: PSN
bit_ranges.description:
Physical Slot Number [PSN]
This field indicates the physical
slot number attached to this Port.
This field must be hardware
initialized to a value that assigns
a slot number that is unique
within the chassis, regardless of
the form factor associated with
the slot. This field must be
initialized to zero for Ports
connected to devices  that are
either integrated on the system
board or integrated within the
same silicon as the Switch device
or Root Port.

name: SLOT_CONTROL_AND_STATUS
description:
Slot Control and Status Register
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: ABPE
bit_ranges.description:
Attention Button Pressed Enable [ABPE]
When Set to 1b, this bit enables
software notification on an
attention button pressed event. If
the Attention Button Present bit in
the Slot Capabilities register is 0b,
this bit is permitted to be read-
only with a value of 0b. Default
value of this bit is 0b.

bit_ranges.name: PFDE
bit_ranges.description:
Power Fault Detected Enable [PFDE]
When Set, this bit enables
software notification on a power
fault event If a Power Controller
that supports power fault detection
is not implemented, this bit is
permitted to be read-only with a
value of 0b. Default value of this
bit is  0b.

bit_ranges.name: MSCE
bit_ranges.description:
MRL Sensor Changed Enable [MSCE]
When Set, this bit enables
software notification on  a MRL
sensor changed event If the MRL
Sensor Present bit in the Slot
Capabilities register is Clear, this
bit is permitted to be read-only
with a value of 0b. Default value of
this bit is  0b.

bit_ranges.name: PDCE
bit_ranges.description:
Presence Detect Changed Enable [PDCE]
When Set, this bit enables
software notification on a presence
detect changed event. If the Hot-
Plug Capable bit in the Slot
Capabilities register is 0b, this bit
is permitted to be read-only with a
value of 0b. Default value of this
bit is  0b.

bit_ranges.name: CCIE
bit_ranges.description:
Command Completed Interrupt Enable [CCIE]
If Command Completed
notification is supported (if the No
Command Completed Support bit
in the Slot Capabilities register is
0b), when Set,   this bit enables
software notification when a hot-
plug command is completed by the
Hot-Plug Controller. If Command
Completed notification  is not
supported, this bit must be
hardwired to 0b. Default value of
this bit is 0b.

bit_ranges.name: HPIE
bit_ranges.description:
Hot-Plug Interrupt Enable [HPIE]
When Set, this bit enables
generation of an interrupt on
enabled hot-plug events. If the Hot
Plug Capable bit in the Slot
Capabilities register is Clear, this
bit is permitted to be read-only
with a value of 0b. Default value of
this bit is 0b.

bit_ranges.name: AIC
bit_ranges.description:
Attention Indicator Control [AIC]
If an Attention Indicator is
implemented, writes to this field
set the Attention Indicator to the
written state. Reads of this field
must reflect the value  from the
latest write, Defined encodings
are: 00b Reserved 01b On 10b
Blink 11b Off

bit_ranges.name: PIC
bit_ranges.description:
Power Indicator Control [PIC]
If a Power Indicator is
implemented, writes to this field
set the Power Indicator to the
written state. Reads of this field
must reflect the value from the
latest write, Defined encodings
are: 00b Reserved 01b On 10b
Blink 11b Off

bit_ranges.name: PCC
bit_ranges.description:
Power Controller Control [PCC]
If a Power Controller is
implemented, this bit when written
sets the power state of the slot per
the defined encodings. Reads of
this bit must reflect the value from
the latest write, even if the
corresponding hot-plug command
is not complete, unless software
issues a write, if required to,
without waiting for the previous
command to complete in which
case the read value is undefined.
The defined encodings are: 0b
Power On 1b Power Off

bit_ranges.name: EMIC
bit_ranges.description:
Electromechanical Interlock Control [EMIC]
If an Electromechanical Interlock is
implemented, a write of 1b to this
bit causes the state of the interlock
to toggle. A write of 0b to this bit
has no effect. A read of this bit
always returns a 0b.

bit_ranges.name: DLLSCE
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Layer State Changed Enable [DLLSCE]
If the Data Link Layer Link Active
Reporting capability is 1b, this bit
enables software notification when
Data Link Layer Link  Active bit is
changed. If the Data Link Layer
Link Active Reporting Capable bit is
0b, this bit is permitted to be read-
only with a value of 0b. Default
value of this bit is 0b.

bit_ranges.name: RSCS1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSCS1]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ABPRSD
bit_ranges.description:
Attention Button Pressed [ABPRSD]
If an Attention Button is
implemented, this bit is Set when
the attention button is pressed. If
an Attention Button is not
supported, this bit must not be
Set.

bit_ranges.name: PFD
bit_ranges.description:
Power Fault Detected [PFD]
If a Power Controller that supports
power fault detection is
implemented, this bit is Set when
the Power Controller detects a
power fault at this slot. Note that,
depending on hardware capability,
it is possible that a power fault can
be detected at any time,
independent of the Power
Controller Control setting or the
occupancy of the slot. If power
fault detection is not supported,
this bit must not be  Set.

bit_ranges.name: MRLSC
bit_ranges.description:
MRL Sensor Changed [MRLSC]
If an MRL sensor is implemented,
this bit is Set when a MRL Sensor
state change is detected. If an MRL
sensor is not implemented, this bit
must not be Set.

bit_ranges.name: PDC
bit_ranges.description:
Presence Detect Changed [PDC]
This bit is set when the value
reported in the Presence Detect
State bit is  changed.

bit_ranges.name: CMDCMPL
bit_ranges.description:
Command Completed [CMDCMPL]
If Command Completed
notification is supported (if the No
Command Completed Support bit
in the Slot Capabilities register is
0b), this bit is Set when a hot-plug
command has completed and the
Hot-Plug Controller is ready to
accept a subsequent command.
The Command Completed status
bit is Set as an indication to host
software that the Hot- Plug
Controller has processed the
previous command and is ready to
receive the next command; it
provides no guarantee that the
action corresponding to the
command is complete. If
Command Completed notification
is not supported, this bit must be
hardwired to 0b.

bit_ranges.name: MRLSS
bit_ranges.description:
MRL Sensor State [MRLSS]
This bit reports the status of the
MRL sensor if implemented.
Defined encodings are: 0b MRL
Closed 1b MRL Open

bit_ranges.name: PDS
bit_ranges.description:
Presence Detect State [PDS]
This bit indicates the presence of
an adapter in the slot, reflected by
the logical “OR” of the Physical
Layer in-band presence detect
mechanism and, if present, any
out-of-band presence detect
mechanism defined for the slot’s
corresponding form factor. Note
that the in-band presence detect
mechanism requires that power be
applied to an adapter for its
presence to be detected.
Consequently, form factors that
require a power controller for hot-
plug must implement a physical
pin presence detect mechanism.
Defined encodings are: 0b Slot
Empty 1b Card Present in slot.

bit_ranges.name: EMIS
bit_ranges.description:
Electromechanical Interlock Status [EMIS]
If an Electromechanical Interlock is
implemented, this bit indicates the
status of the Electromechanical
Interlock. Defined encodings
are: 0b Electromechanical
Interlock Disengaged 1b
Electromechanical  Interlock
Engaged

bit_ranges.name: DLLSC
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Layer State Changed [DLLSC]
This bit is Set when the value
reported in the Data Link Layer
Link Active bit of the Link Status
register is changed. In response to
a Data Link Layer State Changed
event, software must read the
Data Link Layer Link Active bit of
the Link Status register to
determine if the Link is active
before initiating configuration
cycles to the hot plugged device.

bit_ranges.name: RSCS2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [RSCS2]
(no description)

name: ROOT_CONTROL_AND_CAPABILITY
description:
Root Control and Capability Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SECEE
bit_ranges.description:
System Error on Correctable Error Enable [SECEE]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: SENFEE
bit_ranges.description:
System Error on Non-Fatal Error Enable [SENFEE]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: PMEIE
bit_ranges.description:
PME Interrupt Enable [PMEIE]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: CRSSVE
bit_ranges.description:
CRS Software Visibility Enable [CRSSVE]
This field can be read and written
from the local management APB bus,
but its value is not used within the
core.

bit_ranges.name: R28
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R28]
Reserved

name: ROOT_STATUS
description:
Root Status Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PMERID
bit_ranges.description:
PME Requester ID [PMERID]
This field can be written from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: PMES
bit_ranges.description:
PME Status [PMES]
This field is not set by the core but
can be cleared by writing a 1 from
the local management APB bus. This
field can be written from the APB bus
by setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: PMEP
bit_ranges.description:
PME Pending [PMEP]
This field can be written from the
APB bus by setting [21] bit high of
the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: R18
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R18]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_2
description:
PCI Express Device Capabilities 2 Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CTR
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Ranges [CTR]
Specifies the Completion Timeout
values supported by the device. This
field is set by default to 0010 (10 ms
- 250 ms), but can be modified from
the local management APB bus. The
actual timeout values are in two
programmable local management
registers, which allow the timeout
settings of the two sub-ranges
within Range B to be programmed
independently. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: CTDS
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Disable Supported [CTDS]
A 1 in this field indicates that the
associated Function supports the
capability to turn off its Completion
timeout. This field can be written
from the APB bus by setting [21] bit
high  of the pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR
during a local management register
write

bit_ranges.name: AFS
bit_ranges.description:
ARI Forwarding Supported [AFS]
A 1 in this bit indicates that the
device is able to forward TLPs with
function number greater than 8. This
field can be written from the APB
bus by setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: AOPRS
bit_ranges.description:
Atomic OP routing supported [AOPRS]
Applicable only to Switch Upstream
Ports, Switch Downstream Ports, and
Root Ports; must be 0b for other
Function types. This bit must be set
to 1b if the Port supports this
optional capability. This field can be
written from the APB bus by setting
[21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management  register write.

bit_ranges.name: ACS32
bit_ranges.description:
32-Bit Atomic Op Completer Supported [ACS32]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: ACS64
bit_ranges.description:
64-bit Atomic Op Completer Supported [ACS64]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: ACS128
bit_ranges.description:
128-bit CAS Atomic Op Completer Supported [ACS128]
Hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R14
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R14]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LMS
bit_ranges.description:
LTR mechanism supported [LMS]
A value of 1b indicates support for
the optional Latency Tolerance
Reporting (LTR) mechanism. This
field can be written from the APB
bus by setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write.

bit_ranges.name: TPHC
bit_ranges.description:
TPH Completer Supported [TPHC]
These bits, when set, indicate that
the Function is capable of serving as
a completer for requests with
Transaction Processing Hints (TPH).
It can be turned off for all Physical
Functions by writing into PF 0.
Defined Encodings are: 00b TPH and
Extended TPH Completer not
supported. 01b TPH Completer
supported; Extended TPH Completer
not supported. 10b Reserved. 11b
Both TPH and Extended TPH
Completer supported.

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
RSVD
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: R15
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R15]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: OBFF
bit_ranges.description:
OBFF Supported [OBFF]
A 1 in this bit position indicates that
the Function supports the Optimized
Buffer Flush/Fill (OBFF) capability
using message signaling. This field
can  be written from the APB bus by
setting [21] bit high of the
pcie_mgmt_APB_ADDR during a
local management register write

bit_ranges.name: EXFS
bit_ranges.description:
Extended Format Field Supported [EXFS]
Indicates that the Function supports
the 3-bit definition of the Fmt field in
the TLP header. This bit is hardwired
to 1 for all Physical  Functions.

bit_ranges.name: EEPS
bit_ranges.description:
End-End TLP Prefix Supported [EEPS]
hard coded to zero.

bit_ranges.name: MEEP
bit_ranges.description:
Max End- End TLP Prefixes [MEEP]
hard coded to zero.

bit_ranges.name: R16
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R16]
Reserved

name: PCI_EXPRESS_DEVICE_CONTROL_AND_STATUS_2
description:
PCI Express Device Control and Status 2 Register
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: CTV
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Value [CTV]
Specifies the Completion Timeout
value for the device. Allowable
values are 0101 (sub-range 1) and
0110 (sub-range 2). The
corresponding timeout values are
stored in the local management
register's Completion Timeout
Interval Registers 0 and 1,
respectively.

bit_ranges.name: CTD
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Disable [CTD]
Setting this bit disables the
Completion Timeout in the device.

bit_ranges.name: AFE
bit_ranges.description:
ARI Forwarding Enable [AFE]
A 1 in this filed indicates that the
port treats fields 7:0 of the ID as
function number while converting a
Type 1 config packet to type 0 config
packet.

bit_ranges.name: AORE
bit_ranges.description:
Atomic Op Requester Enable [AORE]
This bit must be set to enable the
generation of Atomic Op Requests. If
the client logic attempts to send an
Atomic Op when this bit is not set,
logic in the core will nullify the TLP
on its way to the link.

bit_ranges.name: R18
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R18]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IRE
bit_ranges.description:
IDO Request Enable [IRE]
When this bit is 1, the RC is allowed
to set the ID- based Ordering (IDO)
Attribute bit in the requests it
generates.

bit_ranges.name: ICE
bit_ranges.description:
IDO Completion Enable [ICE]
When this bit is 1, the RC is allowed
to set the ID-based Ordering (IDO)
Attribute bit in the Completions it
generates.

bit_ranges.name: LTRME
bit_ranges.description:
LTR Mechanism Enable [LTRME]
This must be set to 1 to enable the
Latency Tolerance Reporting
Mechanism. This bit is implemented
only in PF 0. Its default value is 1,
but can be modified from the local
management bus. This bit is read-
only in PF 1.

bit_ranges.name: R19
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R19]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: OBFFE
bit_ranges.description:
OBFF Enable [OBFFE]
Enables the Optimized Buffer
Flush/Fill (OBFF) capability in the
device. Valid settings are 00
(disabled), 01 (Variation A), and 10
(Variation B).

bit_ranges.name: R20
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R20]
(no description)

name: LINK_CAPABILITIES_2
description:
Link Capabilities Register 2
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
RSVD
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: SLSV
bit_ranges.description:
Supported Link Speeds Vector [SLSV]
This field indicates the supported
link speeds of   the core. For each
bit, a value of 1 indicates that   the
corresponding link speed is
supported, while a value of 0
indicates that the corresponding
speed is not supported. This field is
RsvdP for Gen1, Gen2
configurations.

bit_ranges.name: RSVD
bit_ranges.description:
RSVD
RSVD

name: LINK_CONTROL_AND_STATUS_2
description:
Link Control and Status 2 Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: TLS
bit_ranges.description:
Target Link Speed [TLS]
This field sets the target speed when
the software forces the link into
Compliance mode by setting the
Enter Compliance bit in this register
(0001= 2.5 GT/s, 0010 = 5 GT/s,
0100 = 8 GT/s).  The default value
of this field is 0001 (2.5 GT/s) when
the PCIE_GENERATION_SEL[1:0]
strap pins of the core are set to 0,
0010 (5 GT/s) when the strap is set
to 1. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EC
bit_ranges.description:
Enter Compliance [EC]
This bit is used to force the Endpoint
device to enter the Compliance
mode. Software sets this bit to 1
and initiates a hot reset to force the
device into the Compliance mode.
The target speed for the Compliance
mode is determined by the Target
Link Speed field of this register.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HASD
bit_ranges.description:
Hardware Autonomous Speed Disable [HASD]
When this bit is set, the LTSSM is
prevented from changing the
operating speed of the link, other
than reducing the speed to correct
unreliable operation of the link.
STICKY

bit_ranges.name: SD
bit_ranges.description:
Selectable De- Emphasis [SD]
This bit selects the de-emphasis
level when the core is operating at 5
GT/s (0 = -6 dB, 1 = -3.5 dB).

bit_ranges.name: TM
bit_ranges.description:
Transmit Margin [TM]
This field is intended for debug and
compliance testing purposes only. It
controls the non- deemphasized
voltage level at the transmitter
outputs. Its encodings are: 000 =
Normal operating range, 001 = 800
- 1200 mV for full swing and 400 -
700 mV for half swing, 010 - 111 =
See PCI Express Base Specification
2.0. This field is reset to 0 when th
LTSSM enters the
Polling.Configuration substate during
link training. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EMC
bit_ranges.description:
Enter Modified Compliance [EMC]
This field is intended for debug and
compliance testing purposes only. If
this bit is set to 1, the device will
transmit the Modified Compliance
Pattern when the LTSSM enters the
Polling.Compliance substate. STICKY

bit_ranges.name: CS
bit_ranges.description:
Compliance SOS [CS]
When this bit is set to 1, the device
will transmit SKP ordered sets
between compliance patterns.
STICKY

bit_ranges.name: CD
bit_ranges.description:
Compliance De- Emphasis [CD]
This bit sets the de-emphasis level
(for 5 GT/s operation) or the
Transmitter Preset level (for 8 GT/s
operation) when the LTSSM enters
the Polling.Compliance state
because of software setting the
Enter Compliance bit in this register.
It is used only when the link is
running at 5 GT/s or 8 GT/s. At 5
GT/s, the only valid setting are 0 (-
6dB) and 1 (-3.5 dB).  STICKY

bit_ranges.name: CDEL
bit_ranges.description:
Current De- Emphasis Level [CDEL]
This status bit indicates the current
operating de- emphasis level of the
transmitter (0 = -6dB, 1 = -3.5dB).

bit_ranges.name: R20
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R20]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R19
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R19]
Reserved

name: ADVANCED_ERROR_REPORTING_(AER)_ENHANCED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
Advanced Error Reporting (AER) Enhanced Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PECID
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PECID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to
the PCI Express AER Extended
Capability Structure (0001  hex).

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG assigned value for
the version of the capability
structure. This field is set by default
to 4'h2.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_STATUS
description:
Uncorrectable Error Status Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R25
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R25]
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: DLPE
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Protocol Error Status [DLPE]
This bit is set when the core
receives an Ack or Nak DLLP whose
sequence does not correspond to
that of an unacknowledged TLP or
that of the last acknowledged TLP
(for details, refer to the PCI Express
Base Specifications).

bit_ranges.name: R26
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R26]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PT
bit_ranges.description:
Poisoned TLP Status [PT]
This bit is set when the core
receives a poisoned TLP from the
link. This error is considered non-
fatal by default. The header of the
received TLP with error is logged in
the Header Log  Registers.

bit_ranges.name: FCPE
bit_ranges.description:
Flow Control Protocol Error Status [FCPE]
This bit is set when certain
violations of the flow control
protocol are detected by the  core.

bit_ranges.name: CT
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Status [CT]
This bit is set when the completion
timer associated with an
outstanding request times out. This
error is considered non-fatal by
default.

bit_ranges.name: CA
bit_ranges.description:
Completer Abort Status [CA]
This bit is set when the core has
returned the Completer Abort (CA)
status to a request received from
the link. This error is considered
non-fatal by default, except for the
special cases outlined in PCI Express
Base Specification 2.0. The header
of the received request that caused
the error is logged in the Header
Log Registers.

bit_ranges.name: UC
bit_ranges.description:
Unexpected Completion Status [UC]
This bit is set when the core has
received an unexpected Completion
packet from the link.

bit_ranges.name: RO
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Overflow Status [RO]
This bit is set when the core
receives a TLP in violation of the
receive credit currently available.

bit_ranges.name: MT
bit_ranges.description:
Malformed TLP Status [MT]
This bit is set when the core
receives a malformed TLP from the
link. This error is considered fatal by
default. The header of the received
TLP with error is logged in the
Header Log  Registers.

bit_ranges.name: EE
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Error Status [EE]
This bit is set when the core has
detected an ECRC error in a
received TLP.

bit_ranges.name: URE
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Request Error Status [URE]
This bit is set when the core has
received a request from the link that
it does not support. This error is not
Function-specific. This error is
considered non-fatal by default,
except for the special case outlined
in PCI Express Base Specification
2.0. The header of the received
request that caused the error is
logged in the Header Log
Registers.

bit_ranges.name: R27
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R27]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: UIE
bit_ranges.description:
Uncorrectable Internal Error Status [UIE]
This bit is set when the core has
