detected an internal uncorrectable
error (HAL parity error or an
uncorrectable ECC error while
reading from any of the RAMs). This
bit is also set in response to the
client signaling an internal error
through the input
UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_IN. This
error is considered fatal by default.

bit_ranges.name: R28
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R28]
Reserved

name: UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_MASK
description:
Uncorrectable Error Mask Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R29
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R29]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DLPER
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Protocol Error Mask [DLPER]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of Data Link Protocol Errors.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R30
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R30]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PTM
bit_ranges.description:
Poisoned TLP Mask [PTM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of a Poisoned TLP. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: FCPER
bit_ranges.description:
Flow Control Protocol Error Mask [FCPER]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of Flow Control Protocol Errors.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CTM
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Mask [CTM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of Completion Timeouts. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CAM
bit_ranges.description:
Completer Abort Mask [CAM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of the core sending a Completer
Abort.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: UCM
bit_ranges.description:
Unexpected Completion Mask [UCM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of unexpected Completions received
by the core.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ROM
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Overflow Mask [ROM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of violations of receive credit.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: MTM
bit_ranges.description:
Malformed TLP Mask [MTM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of malformed TLPs received from
the link.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EEM
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Error Mask [EEM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of ECRC errors. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: UREM
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Request Error Mask [UREM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of unexpected requests received
from the link.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R31
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R31]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: UIEM
bit_ranges.description:
Uncorrectable Internal Error Mask [UIEM]
This bit is set to mask the reporting
of internal errors. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R32
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R32]
Reserved

name: UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR_SEVERITY
description:
Uncorrectable Error Severity Register
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: R33
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R33]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DLPES
bit_ranges.description:
Data Link Protocol Error Severity [DLPES]
Severity of Data Link Protocol
Errors (0 = Non- Fatal, 1 = Fatal).
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: SDES
bit_ranges.description:
surprise down error severity [SDES]
surprise down error severity. This
field is hard coded to 1.

bit_ranges.name: R35
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R35]
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: PTS
bit_ranges.description:
Poisoned TLP Severity [PTS]
Severity of a Poisoned TLP error (0
= Non-Fatal, 1= Fatal). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: FCPES
bit_ranges.description:
Flow Control Protocol Error Severity [FCPES]
Severity of a Flow Control Protocol
Error (0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal).
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CTS
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Timeout Severity [CTS]
Severity of Completion Timeouts (0
= Non-Fatal, 1= Fatal). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CAS
bit_ranges.description:
Completer Abort Severity [CAS]
Severity of sending a Completer
Abort (0 = Non- Fatal, 1 = Fatal).
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: UCS
bit_ranges.description:
Unexpected Completion Severity [UCS]
Severity of unexpected
Completions received by the core
(0 = Non-Fatal, 1 = Fatal).
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ROS
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Overflow Severity [ROS]
Severity of receive credit violations
(0 = Non- Fatal, 1 = Fatal).
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: MTS
bit_ranges.description:
Malformed TLP Severity [MTS]
Severity of malformed TLPs
received from the link (0 = Non-
Fatal, 1 = Fatal).  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EES
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Error Severity [EES]
Severity of ECRC errors (0 = Non-
Fatal, 1 = Fatal). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: URES
bit_ranges.description:
Unsupported Request Error Severity [URES]
Severity of unexpected requests
received from the link (0 = Non-
Fatal, 1 = Fatal).  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R36
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R36]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name:
Uncorr_Intrnal_
Err_Svrty
bit_ranges.description:
Uncorrectable Internal Error Severity [Uncorr_Intrnal_ Err_Svrty]
Severity of internal errors (0 =
Non-Fatal, 1 =Fatal).

bit_ranges.name: R37
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R37]
(no description)

name: CORRECTABLE_ERROR_STATUS
description:
Correctable Error Status Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RES
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Error Status [RES]
This bit is set when an error is
detected in the receive side of the
Physical Layer of the core (e.g. an
8b10b decode error).

bit_ranges.name: R37
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R37]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BTS
bit_ranges.description:
Bad TP Status [BTS]
This bit is set when an error is
detected in a received TLP by the
Data Link Layer of the core the
conditions causing this error are (1)
an LCRC error, (2) the packet
terminates with EDB symbol, but its
LCRC field does not equal the
inverted value of the calculated
CRC.

bit_ranges.name: BDS
bit_ranges.description:
Bad DLLP Status [BDS]
This bit is set when an LCRC error is
detected in a received DLLP, and no
errors were detected by the Physical
Layer.

bit_ranges.name: RNRS
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Number Rollover Status [RNRS]
This bit is set when the replay count
rolls over after three re-
transmissions of a TLP at the Data
Link Layer of the core.

bit_ranges.name: R38
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R38]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RTTS
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Timer Timeout Status [RTTS]
This bit is set when the replay timer
in the Data Link Layer of the core
times out, causing the core to re-
transmit a TLP.

bit_ranges.name: ANES
bit_ranges.description:
Advisory Non- Fatal Error Status [ANES]
This bit is set when an uncorrectable
error occurs, which is determined to
belong to one of the   special cases
described in the PCI Express Base
Specification 2.0. This causes the
core to assert the
CORRECTABLE_ERROR_OUT output
in place  of
NON_FATAL_ERROR_OUT.

bit_ranges.name: CIES
bit_ranges.description:
Corrected Internal Error Status [CIES]
This bit is set when the core has
detected an internal correctable
error condition (a correctable ECC
error while reading from any of the
RAMs). This bit is also set in
response to the client signaling an
internal error through the input
CORRECTABLE_ERROR_IN.

bit_ranges.name: HLOS
bit_ranges.description:
Header Log Overflow Status [HLOS]
This bit is set on a Header Log
Register overflow, that is, when the
header could not be logged in the
Header Log Register because it is
occupied by a previous header.

bit_ranges.name: R39
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R39]
Reserved

name: CORRECTABLE_ERROR_MASK
description:
Correctable Error Mask Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: REM
bit_ranges.description:
Receiver Error Mask [REM]
This bit, when set, masks the
reporting of Physical Layer errors.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R40
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R40]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BTM
bit_ranges.description:
Bad TP Mask [BTM]
This bit, when set, masks the
reporting of an error in response to a
'Bad TLP' received.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: BDM
bit_ranges.description:
Bad DLLP Mask [BDM]
This bit, when set, masks the
reporting of an error in response to a
'Bad DLLP' received.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: RNRM
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Number Rollover Mask [RNRM]
This bit, when set, masks the
reporting of an error in response to a
Replay Number Rollover event.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R41
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R41]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RTTM
bit_ranges.description:
Replay Timer Timeout Mask [RTTM]
This bit, when set, masks the
reporting of an error in response to a
Replay Timer timeout event. STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ANEM
bit_ranges.description:
Advisory Non- Fatal Error Mask [ANEM]
This bit, when set, masks the
reporting of an error in response to
an uncorrectable error occurrence,
which is determined to belong to one
of the special cases in the PCI
Express Base Specification 2.0.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: CIEM
bit_ranges.description:
Corrected Internal Error Mask [CIEM]
This bit, when set, masks the
reporting of an error in response to a
corrected internal error condition.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HLOM
bit_ranges.description:
Header Log Overflow Mask [HLOM]
This bit, when set, masks the
reporting of an error in response to a
Header Log register overflow.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: R42
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R42]
Reserved

name: ADVANCED_ERROR_CAPABILITIES_AND_CONTROL
description:
Advanced Error Capabilities and Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: FEP
bit_ranges.description:
First Error Pointer [FEP]
This is a 5-bit pointer to the bit
position in the Uncorrectable Error
Status Register corresponding to the
error that was detected first. When
there are multiple bits set in the
Uncorrectable Error Status Register,
this field informs the software which
error was observed first. To prevent
the field from being overwritten
before the software is able to read it,
this field is not updated while the
status bit it points to in the
Uncorrectable  Error Status Register
remains set. After the software
clears this status bit, a subsequent
error condition that sets any bit in
the Uncorrectable Error Status
Register will update the First Error
Pointer. Any uncorrectable error
type, including the special cases
where the error is reported using an
ERR_COR message, will set the First
Error Pointer (assuming the software
has reset the error pointed by it in
the Uncorrectable Error Status
Register). STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: EGC
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Generation Capability [EGC]
This read-only bit indicates to the
software that the device is capable
of generating ECRC in packets
transmitted on the link.

bit_ranges.name: EEG
bit_ranges.description:
Enable ECRC Generation [EEG]
Setting this bit enables the ECRC
generation on the transmit side of
the core. This bit is writable from the
local management bus.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: ECC
bit_ranges.description:
ECRC Check Capability [ECC]
This read-only bit indicates to the
software that the device is capable
of checking ECRC in packets received
from the link.

bit_ranges.name: EEC
bit_ranges.description:
Enable ECRC Check [EEC]
Setting this bit enables ECRC
checking on the receive side of the
core. This bit is writable from the
local management bus.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: MHRC
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Header Recording Capable [MHRC]
This bit is set when the RC has the
capability to log more than one error
header in its Header Log Registers.
It is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: MHRE
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Header Recording Enable [MHRE]
Setting this bit enables the RC to log
multiple error headers in its Header
Log Registers. It is hardwired to 0.

bit_ranges.name: R43
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R43]
Reserved

name: HEADER_LOG_0
description:
Header Log Register 0
First Dword of captured TLP header.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HD0
bit_ranges.description:
Header Dword 0 [HD0]
First Dword of captured TLP header.
STICKY.

name: HEADER_LOG_1
description:
Header Log Register 1
Second Dword of captured TLP
header.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HD1
bit_ranges.description:
Header Dword 1 [HD1]
Second Dword of captured TLP
header.  STICKY.

name: HEADER_LOG_2
description:
Header Log Register 2
Third Dword of captured TLP header.
STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HD2
bit_ranges.description:
Header Dword 2 [HD2]
Third Dword of captured TLP header.
STICKY.

name: HEADER_LOG_3
description:
Header Log Register 3
Fourth Dword of captured TLP
header.  STICKY.

bit_ranges.name: HD3
bit_ranges.description:
Header Dword 3 [HD3]
Fourth Dword of captured TLP
header.  STICKY.

name: ROOT_ERROR_COMMAND
description:
Root Error Command Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CERE
bit_ranges.description:
Correctable Error Reporting Enable [CERE]
If this bit is set, the core will active
its CORRECTABLE_ERROR_OUT
output in response to an error
message received from the link.

bit_ranges.name: NFERE
bit_ranges.description:
Non-Fatal Error Reporting Enable [NFERE]
If this bit is set, the core will active
its NON_FATAL_ERROR_OUT output
in response to an error message
received from the link.

bit_ranges.name: FERE
bit_ranges.description:
Fatal Error Reporting Enable [FERE]
If this bit is set, the core will active
its FATAL_ERROR_OUT output in
response to an error message
received from the link.

bit_ranges.name: R44
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R44]
Reserved

name: ROOT_ERROR_STATUS
description:
Root Error Status Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ECR
bit_ranges.description:
Correctable Error Message Received [ECR]
This bit is set when the RC receives
a Correctable error message from
the link.  STICKY

bit_ranges.name: MECR
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Correctable Error Messages Received [MECR]
This bit is set when the RC receives
a Correctable error message from
the link, if the ERR_COR received bit
is already set.  STICKY

bit_ranges.name: EFNR
bit_ranges.description:
Fatal/Non- Fatal Error Message Received [EFNR]
This bit is set when the RC receives
either a Fatal or Non-Fatal error
message from the link.  STICKY

bit_ranges.name: MEFNR
bit_ranges.description:
Multiple Fatal/ Non- Fatal Error Messages Received [MEFNR]
This bit is set when the RC receives
either a Fatal or Non-Fatal error
message from the link, and the
ERR_FATAL/NONFATAL Received bit
is already set. STICKY

bit_ranges.name: FUF
bit_ranges.description:
First Uncorrectable Fatal [FUF]
This bit, when set, indicates that the
first Uncorrectable error message
received was for a Fatal error.
STICKY

bit_ranges.name: NEMR
bit_ranges.description:
Non-Fatal Error Messages Received [NEMR]
This bit, when set, indicates that the
RC has received one or more Non-
Fatal error messages from the link.
STICKY

bit_ranges.name: FEMR
bit_ranges.description:
Fatal Error Messages Received [FEMR]
This bit, when set, indicates that the
RC has received one or more Fatal
error messages from the link.
STICKY

bit_ranges.name: R45
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R45]
Reserved

name: ERROR_SOURCE_IDENTIFICATION
description:
Error Source Identification Register
This field captures and stores the
Requester ID from an ERR_FATAL or
ERROR_NONFATAL message
received by the RC, if the
ERR_FATAL or NONFATAL Received
bit was not set at the time the
message was received.  STICKY

bit_ranges.name: ECSI
bit_ranges.description:
Correctable Error Message Source ID [ECSI]
This field captures and stores the
Requester ID from an ERR_COR
message received by the RC, if the
ERR_COR bit was not set at the
time the message was received.
STICKY

bit_ranges.name: EFNSI
bit_ranges.description:
Fatal/Non- Fatal Error Message Source ID [EFNSI]
This field captures and stores the
Requester ID from an ERR_FATAL or
ERROR_NONFATAL message
received by the RC, if the
ERR_FATAL or NONFATAL Received
bit was not set at the time the
message was received.  STICKY

name: L1_PM_SUBSTATES_EXTENDED_CAPABILITY_HEADER
description:
L1 PM Substates Extended Capability Header Register
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

bit_ranges.name: PECID
bit_ranges.description:
PCI Express Extended Capability ID [PECID]
This field is hardwired to the
Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to
the L1 PM Substates Extended
Capability Structure (001E  hex).

bit_ranges.name: CV
bit_ranges.description:
Capability Version [CV]
Specifies the SIG assigned value for
the version of the capability
structure. This field is set by default
to 1, but can be modified from the
local management bus.

bit_ranges.name: NCO
bit_ranges.description:
Next Capability Offset [NCO]
Indicates offset to the next PCI
Express capability structure. The
default next pointer value is dynamic
and is dependent on whether the
strap or LMI bits are set.

name: PHYSICAL_LAYER_CONFIGURATION_0
description:
Physical Layer Configuration Register 0
When the core is operating as a Root
Port, setting this to 1 causes the
LTSSM to initiate a loopback and
become the loopback master. This
bit is not used in the EndPoint Mode.

bit_ranges.name: LS
bit_ranges.description:
Link Status [LS]
Current state of link (1 = link
training complete, 0 = link training
not  complete).

bit_ranges.name: NLC
bit_ranges.description:
Negotiated Lane Count [NLC]
Lane count negotiated with other
side during link training (00 = x1, 01
= x2, 10 = x4, 11 =  x8).

bit_ranges.name: NS
bit_ranges.description:
Negotiated Speed [NS]
Current operating speed of link (00
= 2.5G, 01 = 5G, 10 = 8G).

bit_ranges.name: LTD
bit_ranges.description:
Link Training Direction [LTD]
The state of this bit indicates
whether the core completed link
training as an upstream port or a
downstream port (0 = upstream, 1
= downstream). Default value
depends on CORE_TYPE strap pin.

bit_ranges.name: APER
bit_ranges.description:
Phy Error Reporting [APER]
If set to 0, the core will only report
those errors that caused a TLP or
DLLP to be dropped because of a
detected phy error, TLP framing
error or DLLP framing error. When
set to 1, the core will report all
detected phy errors regardless of
whether a TLP or DLLP was dropped
but does not include TLP nor DLLP
framing errors. Detected phy errors
include:- received errors indicated
on PIPE RxStatus interface, and TLP
or DLLP framing errors depending on
the programmed value of this bit.

bit_ranges.name: TSS
bit_ranges.description:
Tx Swing Setting [TSS]
This bit drives the PIPE_TX_SWING
output of the core.

bit_ranges.name: RFC
bit_ranges.description:
Received FTS Count for 2.5 GT/s speed [RFC]
FTS count received from the other
side during link training for use at
the 2.5 GT/s link speed. The core
transmits this many FTS sequences
while exiting the L0S state, when
operating at the  2.5 GT/s speed.

bit_ranges.name: RLID
bit_ranges.description:
Received Link ID [RLID]
Link ID received from other side
during link training.

bit_ranges.name: LTSSM
bit_ranges.description:
LTSSM State [LTSSM]
Current state of the LTSSM. The
encoding of the states is given in
Appendix C.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Remote Linkwidth Upconfigure Capability Status [R0]
A 1 in this field indicates that the
remote node advertised Link Width
Up configure Capability in the
training sequences in the
Configuration. Complete state when
the link came up. A 0 indicates that
the remote node did not set the Link
Up configure bit.

bit_ranges.name: MLE
bit_ranges.description:
Master Loopback Enable [MLE]
When the core is operating as a Root
Port, setting this to 1 causes the
LTSSM to initiate a loopback and
become the loopback master. This
bit is not used in the EndPoint Mode.

name: PHYSICAL_LAYER_CONFIGURATION_1
description:
Physical Layer Configuration Register 1
FTS count transmitted by the core in
TS1/TS2 sequences during link
training. This value must  be set
based on the time needed by the
receiver to acquire sync while exiting
from L0S  state.

bit_ranges.name: TLI
bit_ranges.description:
Transmitted Link ID [TLI]
Link ID transmitted by the device in
training sequences in the Root Port
mode.

bit_ranges.name: TFC1
bit_ranges.description:
Transmitted FTS Count at 2.5 GT/s Speed [TFC1]
FTS count transmitted by the core in
TS1/TS2 sequences during link
training. This value must be set
based on the time needed by the
receiver on the other side to acquire
sync while exiting from L0S state.

bit_ranges.name: TFC2
bit_ranges.description:
Transmitted FTS Count at 5 GT/s Speed [TFC2]
FTS count transmitted by the core in
TS1/TS2 sequences during link
training. This value must  be set
based on the time needed by the
receiver to acquire sync while exiting
from L0S  state.

bit_ranges.name: TFC3
bit_ranges.description:
Transmitted FTS Count at 8 GT/s Speed [TFC3]
FTS count transmitted by the core in
TS1/TS2 sequences during link
training. This value must  be set
based on the time needed by the
receiver to acquire sync while exiting
from L0S  state.

name: DATA_LINK_LAYER_TIMER_CONFIGURATION
description:
Data Link Layer Timer Configuration Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: TSRT
bit_ranges.description:
Transmit- Side Replay Timeout Adjustment [TSRT]
Additional transmit-side replay timer
timeout interval. This 9-bit value is
added as a signed 2's complement
number to the internal replay timer
timeout value computed by the core
based on the PCI Express
Specifications. This enables the user
to make minor adjustments to the
spec-defined replay timer settings.
Its value is in multiples of 4ns
(maximum = +1020 ns, minimum =
-1024  ns).

bit_ranges.name: R9
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R9]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RSART
bit_ranges.description:
Receive-Side ACK-NAK Replay Timeout Adjustment [RSART]
Additional receive side ACK-NAK
timer timeout interval. This 9-bit
value is added as a signed 2's
complement number to the internal
ACK-NAK timer timeout value
computed by the core based on the
PCI Express Specifications. This
enables the user to make minor
adjustments to the spec-defined
replay timer settings. Its value is in
multiples of 4 ns (maximum =
+1020 ns, minimum = -1024 ns).

bit_ranges.name: R25
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R25]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: NPHCL

bit_ranges.name: CPC

Completion Payload Credit VC0 [CPC]

name: TRANSMIT_CREDIT_LIMIT_0_VC0

Non-Posted payload credit limit

bit_ranges.name: PPC
bit_ranges.description:
Posted Payload Credit VC0 [PPC]
Posted payload credit limit received

bit_ranges.name: PHC
bit_ranges.description:

Posted header credit limit received

bit_ranges.name: NPPC

Non-Posted payload credit limit
received by the core for Link 0 (in

name: TRANSMIT_CREDIT_LIMIT_1_VC0
description:
Transmit Credit Limit Register 1 VC0
Completion header credit limit
received by the core for VC 0 (in
number of  packets).

bit_ranges.name: NPHC
bit_ranges.description:
Non- Posted Header Credit VC0 [NPHC]
Non-Posted header credit limit
received by the core for VC 0 (in
number of  packets).

bit_ranges.name: CPC
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Payload Credit VC0 [CPC]
Completion payload credit limit
received by the core for VC 0 (in
units of 4  Dwords).

bit_ranges.name: R3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R3]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CHC
bit_ranges.description:
Completion Header Credit VC0 [CHC]
Completion header credit limit
received by the core for VC 0 (in
number of  packets).

name: TRANSMIT_CREDIT_UPDATE_INTERVAL_CONFIGURATION_0
description:
Transmit Credit Update Interval Configuration Register 0
Minimum credit update interval for
non-posted transactions. The core
follows this minimum interval
between issuing posted credit
updates on the link. This is to limit
the bandwidth use of credit updates.
If new credit becomes available in
the receive FIFO since the last
update was sent, the core will issue
a new update only after this interval
has elapsed since the last update.
The value is in units of 4 ns. This
field is re-written by the internal
logic when the negotiated link width
or link speed changes, to correspond
to the default values defined in
defines.h. The user may override this
default value by writing into this
register field. The value written will
be lost on a change in the negotiated
link width/speed.

bit_ranges.name: MPUI
bit_ranges.description:
Minimum Posted Update Interval [MPUI]
Minimum credit update interval for
posted transactions. The core follows
this minimum interval between
issuing posted credit updates on the
link. This is to limit the bandwidth
use of credit updates. If new credit
becomes available in the receive
FIFO since the last update was sent,
the core will issue a new update only
after this interval has elapsed since
the last update. The value is in units
of 4 ns. This field is re-written by the
internal logic when the negotiated
link width   or link speed changes,
to correspond to the default values
defined in defines.h. The user may
override this default value by writing
into this register field. The value
written will be lost on a change in
the negotiated  link width/speed.

bit_ranges.name: MNUI
bit_ranges.description:
Minimum Non- Posted Update Interval [MNUI]
Minimum credit update interval for
non-posted transactions. The core
follows this minimum interval
between issuing posted credit
updates on the link. This is to limit
the bandwidth use of credit updates.
If new credit becomes available in
the receive FIFO since the last
update was sent, the core will issue
a new update only after this interval
has elapsed since the last update.
The value is in units of 4 ns. This
field is re-written by the internal
logic when the negotiated link width
or link speed changes, to correspond
to the default values defined in
defines.h. The user may override this
default value by writing into this
register field. The value written will
be lost on a change in the negotiated
link width/speed.

name: TRANSMIT_CREDIT_UPDATE_INTERVAL_CONFIGURATION_1
description:
Transmit Credit Update Interval Configuration Register 1
Maximum credit update interval for
all transactions. If no new credit has
become available since the last
update, the core will repeat the last
update after this interval. This is to
recover from any losses of credit
update packets. The value is in units
of 4 ns. This field could be re-written
by the internal logic when the
negotiated link width or link speed
changes, to correspond to the
default values defined in defines.h.
The user may override this default
value by writing into this register
field. The value written will be lost
on a change in the negotiated link
width/speed.

bit_ranges.name: CUI
bit_ranges.description:
Minimum Completion Update Interval [CUI]
has elapsed since the last update.
The value is in units of 4 ns. This
parameter is not used when the
Completion credit is infinity.

bit_ranges.name: MUI
bit_ranges.description:
Maximum Update Interval [MUI]
Maximum credit update interval for
all transactions. If no new credit has
become available since the last
update, the core will repeat the last
update after this interval. This is to
recover from any losses of credit
update packets. The value is in units
of 4 ns. This field could be re-written
by the internal logic when the
negotiated link width or link speed
changes, to correspond to the
default values defined in defines.h.
The user may override this default
value by writing into this register
field. The value written will be lost
on a change in the negotiated link
width/speed.

name: L0S_TIMEOUT_LIMIT
description:

Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LT
bit_ranges.description:
L0S Timeout [LT]
Contains the timeout value (in units
of 4ns) for transitioning to the L0S
power state. Setting this parameter
to 0 permanently disables the
transition to the L0S power state.

bit_ranges.name: L1RD
bit_ranges.description:

description:

bit_ranges.name: SVID

Subsystem Vendor ID

description:

bit_ranges.name: L1T
bit_ranges.description:
L1 Timeout [L1T]
Contains the timeout value (in units
of 4 ns) for transitioning to the L1
power state. Setting it to 0
permanently disables the transition
to the L1 power state.

bit_ranges.name: R7
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R7]
Reserved

name: PME_TURNOFF_ACK_DELAY
description:
PME TurnOff Ack Delay Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PTOAD
bit_ranges.description:
PME Turnoff Ack Delay [PTOAD]
Time in microseconds between the
core receiving a PME_TurnOff
message TLP and the core sending a
PME_TO_Ack response to it. This
field must be set to a non-zero value
in order for the core to send a
response. Setting this field to 0
suppresses the core's response to
PME_TurnOff message, so that the
client may transmit the PME_TO_Ack
message through the master
interface.

bit_ranges.name: R7
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R7]
Reserved

name: LINKWIDTH_CONTROL
description:
Linkwidth Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: TLM
bit_ranges.description:
Target Lane Map [TLM]
This field contains the bitmap of the
lanes to be included in forming the
link during the re-training. If the
target lane map includes lanes that
were inactive when retraining is
initiated, then both the core and its
link partner must support the
LinkWidth Upconfigure Capability to
be able to activate those lanes. The
user can check if the remote node
has this capability by reading the
Remote Link Upconfigure Capability
Status bit in Physical Layer
Configuration Register 0 after the
link first came up.

bit_ranges.name: R0
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R0]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RL
bit_ranges.description:
Retrain Link [RL]
Writing a 1 into this field results in
the core re- training the link to
change its width. When setting this
bit to 1, the software must also set
the target lane-map field to indicate
the lanes it desires to be part of the
link. The core will attempt to form a
link with this set of lanes. The link
formed at the end of the retraining
may include all of these lanes (if
both nodes agree on them during re-
training), or the largest subset that
both sides were able to activate. This
bit is cleared by the internal logic of
the core after the re-training has
been completed and link has reached
the L0 state. Software must wait for
the bit to be clear before setting it
again to change the link width.

bit_ranges.name: R1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1]
Reserved

name: SRIS_CONTROL
description:
SRIS Control Register
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SRISE
bit_ranges.description:
SRIS Enable [SRISE]
Setting this bit enables SRIS mode
in the PHY layer. This bit should be
before link training begins by holding
the LINK_TRAINING_ENABLE input
to 1'b0.

bit_ranges.name: R31
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R31]
Reserved

name: SHADOW_REGISTER_HEADER_LOG_0
description:
Shadow register header log 0
The value here will be reflected in
the target function's header log
register when f/w sets any bit In
the shadow error register. If the
header log is already set in the
function's AER space, the value
here may not get written and a
header log overflow bit would get
set. This register holds [31:0]
value  of the TLP header.

bit_ranges.name: SHDW_HDR_LOG_0
bit_ranges.description:

The value here will be reflected in

register when f/w sets any bit In

header log is already set in the

here may not get written and a
header log overflow bit would get

here may not get written and a

set. This register holds [95:64]

posted UR error bits will be set in

bit_ranges.name: NP_UR_ERR
bit_ranges.description:
Non Posted Error [NP_UR_ERR]
If this bit is set, the corresponding
non-posted UR error bits will be set
in the AER and device status

Negotiated Lane Map [NLM]
Bit i of this field is set to 1 at the end
of link training if Lane i is part of the
PCIe link. The value of this field is
valid only when the link is in L0 or
L0s states.

bit_ranges.name: R70
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R70]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: LRS
bit_ranges.description:
Lane Reversal Status [LRS]

Reserved

bit_ranges.name: RFC5S
bit_ranges.description:
Received FTS Count for 5GT/s Speed [RFC5S]
FTS count received from the other
side during link training for use at
the 5 GT/s link speed. The core
transmits this many FTS sequences
while  exiting the L0S state, when
operating at the 5 GT/s speed.

bit_ranges.name: R7
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R7]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R72
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R72]
Reserved

name: DEBUG_MUX_CONTROL
description:
Debug Mux Control Register
Setting this bit to 0 causes all the
enabled Functions to report an error
when a Type-1 configuration access
is received by the core, targeted at
any Function. Setting it to 1 limits
the error reporting to the type-0
Function whose number matches
with the Function number specified
in the request. If the Function
number in the request refers to an
unimplemented or disabled
Function, all enabled Functions
report the error regardless of the
setting of this bit.

bit_ranges.name: MS
bit_ranges.description:
Mux Select [MS]
Bits 3:2 select the module and bits
1:0 select the group of signals
within the module that are driven on
the debug bus. The assignments of
signals on the debug outputs of the
core are given in Appendix B.

bit_ranges.name: R8
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R8]
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: R99
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R99]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R1010
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1010]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R1111
bit_ranges.description:
Disable Client TX MUX arbitration [R1111]
When this bit is 1, Disable Client TX
MUX Completion and PNP request
arbitration, logic added to prevent
PNP requests from starving when
completions are present

bit_ranges.name: R1212
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1212]
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: R1313
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1313]
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: DSSPLM
bit_ranges.description:
Disable Set Slot Power Limit Message [DSSPLM]
Disable sending Set Slot Power Limit
Message if the Slot Capability
register is configured

bit_ranges.name: FDS
bit_ranges.description:
Force Disable Scrambling [FDS]
Disable  Scrambling/Descrambling
in Gen1/Gen2.

bit_ranges.name: AWRPRI
bit_ranges.description:
Enable AXI Bridge Write Priority [AWRPRI]
When this bit is 1, the AXI bridge
places a write request on the HAL
Master interface in preference over
a read request if both AXI write and
AXI read requests are available to
be asserted on the same clock cycle.

bit_ranges.name: R8B
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R8B]
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: R1918
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R1918]
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: DCIVMC
bit_ranges.description:
Disable checking of invalid message codes [DCIVMC]
When this bit is 1, the core will not
check for invalid message codes.
This bit should normally set to 0, as
the invalid message code checking
is mandatory in the PCIe 3.0
specifications.

bit_ranges.name: R21
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R21]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DLUC
bit_ranges.description:
Disable Link Upconfigure Capability [DLUC]
The user may set this bit to turn off
the link upconfigure capability of the
core. Setting this  bit prevents the
core from advertising the link
upconfigure capability in training
sequences transmitted in the
Configuration.Complete  state.

bit_ranges.name: EFLT
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Fast Link Training [EFLT]
This bit is provided to shorten the
link training time to facilitate fast
simulation of the design, especially
at the gate level. Enabling this bit
has the following effects: 1. The
1ms, 2ms, 12ms, 24ms, 32ms and
48ms timeout intervals in the LTSSM
are shortened by a factor of 500. 2.
In the Polling.Active state of the
LTSSM, only 16 training sequences
are required to be transmitted
(Instead of 1024) to make the
transition to the Configuration state.
This bit should not be set during
normal operation of the core.

bit_ranges.name: ESPC
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Slot Power Capture [ESPC]
When this bit is set to 1, the core
will capture the Slot Power Limit
Value and Slot Power Limit   Scale
parameters from a
Set_Slot_Power_Limit message
received in the Device Capabilities
Register. When this bit is 0, the
capture is disabled. This bit is valid
only when the core is configured
as an EndPoint. It has no effect
when the core is a Root Complex.

bit_ranges.name: R26
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R26]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: R27
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R27]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DEI
bit_ranges.description:
Disable Electrical Idle Infer in L0 State [DEI]
Setting this bit to 1 disables the
inferring of electrical idle in the L0
state. Electrical idle is inferred when
no flow control updates and no SKP
sequences are received within an
interval of 128 us. This bit should
not be set during normal operation,
but is useful for testing.

bit_ranges.name: DFCUT
bit_ranges.description:
Disable Flow Control Update Timeout [DFCUT]
When this bit is 0, the core will time
out and re-train the link when no
Flow Control Update DLLPs are
received from the link within an
interval of 128 us. Setting this bit to
1 disables
this timeout. When the advertised
receive credit of the link partner is
infinity for the header and payload
of all credit types, this timeout is
always suppressed. The setting of
this bit has no effect in this case.
This bit should not be set during
normal operation, but is useful for
testing.

bit_ranges.name: DOC
bit_ranges.description:
Disable Ordering Checks [DOC]
Setting this bit to 1 disables the
ordering check in the core between
Completions and Posted requests
received from the link.

bit_ranges.name: EFSRTCA
bit_ranges.description:
Enable Function- Specific Reporting of Type-1 Configuration Accesses [EFSRTCA]
Setting this bit to 0 causes all the
enabled Functions to report an error
when a Type-1 configuration access
is received by the core, targeted at
any Function. Setting it to 1 limits
the error reporting to the type-0
Function whose number matches
with the Function number specified
in the request. If the Function
number in the request refers to an
unimplemented or disabled
Function, all enabled Functions
report the error regardless of the
setting of this bit.

name: ECC_CORRECTABLE_ERROR_COUNT
description:
ECC Correctable Error Count Register
Number of correctable errors
detected while reading from the TPH
Steering Tag RAM. This is an 8-bit
saturating counter that can be
cleared by writing all 1s into it.

bit_ranges.name: PFRCER
bit_ranges.description:
PNP FIFO RAM Correctable Error Count [PFRCER]
Number of correctable errors
detected while reading from the PNP
FIFO RAM. This is an 8-bit saturating
counter that can be cleared by
writing all 1's into it.

bit_ranges.name: SFRCER
bit_ranges.description:
SC FIFO RAM Correctable Error Count [SFRCER]
Number of correctable errors
detected while reading from the SC
FIFO RAM. This is an 8-bit saturating
counter that can be cleared by
writing all 1's into it.

bit_ranges.name: RRCER
bit_ranges.description:
Replay RAM Correctable Error Count [RRCER]
Number of correctable errors
detected while reading from the
Replay Buffer RAM. This is an 8- bit
saturating counter that can be
cleared by writing all 1's into it.

bit_ranges.name: R12
bit_ranges.description:
TPH ST RAM Correctable Error Count [R12]
Number of correctable errors
detected while reading from the TPH
Steering Tag RAM. This is an 8-bit
saturating counter that can be
cleared by writing all 1s into it.

name: LTR_SNOOP/NO_SNOOP_LATENCY
description:
LTR Snoop/No-Snoop Latency Register
The client software must set this bit
to 1 to set the Snoop Latency
Requirement bit in the LTR message
to be sent.

bit_ranges.name: NSLV
bit_ranges.description:
No-Snoop Latency Value [NSLV]
The client software must program
this field with the value to be sent in
the No-Snoop Latency Value field of
the LTR  message.

bit_ranges.name: NSLS
bit_ranges.description:
No-Snoop Latency Scale [NSLS]
The client software must program
this field with  the value to be sent
in the No-Snoop Latency Scale field
of the LTR message.

bit_ranges.name: R12
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R12]
(no description)

bit_ranges.name: NSLR
bit_ranges.description:
No-Snoop Latency Requirement [NSLR]
The client software must set this bit
to 1 to set the No-Snoop Latency
Requirement bit in the LTR message
to be sent.

bit_ranges.name: SLV
bit_ranges.description:
Snoop Latency Value [SLV]
The client software must program
this field with the value to be sent in
the Snoop Latency Value field of the
LTR message.

bit_ranges.name: SLS
bit_ranges.description:
Snoop Latency Scale [SLS]
The client software must program
this field with the value to be sent in
the Snoop Latency Scale field of the
LTR message.

bit_ranges.name: R13
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved [R13]
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SL
bit_ranges.description:
Snoop Latency [SL]
The client software must set this bit
to 1 to set the Snoop Latency
Requirement bit in the LTR message
to be sent.

name: LTR_MESSAGE_GENERATION_CONTROL
description:
LTR Message Generation Control Register
RSVD

bit_ranges.name: MLI
bit_ranges.description:
Minimum LTR Interval [MLI]
This field specifies the minimum
spacing between LTR messages
transmitted by the core in units of
microseconds. The PCI Express
Specifications recommend sending
no more than two LTR messages
within a 500 microsecond interval.
The core will wait for the minimum
delay specified by this field after
sending an LTR message, before
transmitting a new LTR  message.

bit_ranges.name: SLM
bit_ranges.description:
Send LTR Message [SLM]
Setting this bit causes the core to
transmit an LTR message with the
parameters specified in the LTR
Snoop/No-Snoop Latency Register
(Section 8.4.2.9). This bit is cleared
by the core on transmitting the LTR
message, and stays set until then.
Client software must read this
register and verify that this bit is 0
before setting it again to send a new
message. This field becomes writable
when LTR mechanism is enabled in
device control-2 register.

bit_ranges.name: TMLMET
bit_ranges.description:
Transmit Message on LTR Mechanism Enable Transition [TMLMET]
When this bit is set to 1, the core will
automatically transmit an LTR
message whenever the LTR
Mechanism Enable bit in the Device
Control 2 Register changes from 0 to
1, with the parameters specified in
the LTR Snoop/No-Snoop Latency
Register. When this bit is 1, the core
will also transmit an LTR message
whenever the LTR Mechanism Enable
bit is cleared, if the following
conditions are both true: 1. The core
sent at least
one LTR message since the LTR
Mechanism Enable bit was last set.
2. The most recent LTR message
transmitted by the core had as least
one of the Requirement bits set. The
core will set the Requirement bits in
this LTR message to 0. When this bit
11 is 0, the core will not, by itself,
send any LTR messages in response
to state changes of the LTR
Mechanism Enable bit. Client logic
may monitor the state of the
LTR_MECHANISM_ ENABLE output of
the core and transmit LTR messages
through the master interface, in
response to its state changes.

bit_ranges.name: TMFPSC
bit_ranges.description:
Transmit Message on Function Power State Change [TMFPSC]
When this bit is set to 1, the core will
automatically transmit an LTR
message when all the Functions in
the core have transitioned to a non-
D0 power state, provided that the
following conditions are both true: 1.
The core sent at least one LTR
message since the Data Link layer
last transitioned from down to up
state. 2. The most recent LTR
message transmitted by the core had
as least one of the Requirement bits
set. The core will set the
Requirement bits in this LTR
message to 0. When this bit 12 is 0,
the core will not, by itself, send any
LTR messages in response to
Function Power State changes. Client
logic may monitor the
FUNCTION_POWER_STATE outputs
of the core and transmit LTR
messages through the master
interface, in response to changes in
their states.

bit_ranges.name: PSTD
bit_ranges.description:
PME Service Timeout Delay [PSTD]
Specifies the timeout delay for
retransmission of PM_PME
messages. The value is in units of
microseconds. The actual time
elapsed has  a +1 microseconds
tolerance from the value
programmed.

bit_ranges.name: DPMOPS
bit_ranges.description:
Disable PME message on PM Status [DPMOPS]
When this bit is set, core will not
automatically send a PME message,
when PM Status bit in PMCSR
register is set

name: PHYSICAL_FUNCTION_BAR_CONFIGURATION_1
description:

Setting this bit to 1 enables the

Express Configuration Space of the
associated Function. When the

the apertures of the memory BARs of
the corresponding Function are  no
longer selected by the fields in this
register, but by the setting of the
registers in the Resizable BAR
Capability Structure.

This bit must be set to 1 to enable
BAR checking in the RC mode. When
this bit is set to 0, the core will
forward all incoming memory
requests to the client logic without
checking their address  ranges.
